loans.name: Ballay

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Ballay. She is married and has three children, aged 30, 25 and 18 years. In 1987, Ballay established her business, selling groundnuts and oil. She began her business, because she wants a better living with her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Ballay requires a loan in order to purchase more groundnuts and oil for resale. In the future, Ballay plans to educate her son up to university and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to puchase more groundnuts and oil for resale

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Amidu. He is married, and he has two children, aged 5 and 3 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him as works as a sales assistant.  In 1997 Amidu established his business, selling foods like rice and beans. He began his business, because he wants to live a better life. His business is located in the outskirts of town, and his main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Amidu requires a loan in order to buy more foods for resale, including rice and beans. In the future, Amidu plans to build a house and to start another shop, which his wife will manage. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some bags, shoes and other various retail goods.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Sento. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 8 years. In 2007 Sento established her grocery shop. She began her business, because she wants to assist her husband in supporting the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her customers are all kinds of people. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Sento requires a loan in order to purchase groceries to resell at her shop, including cartons of biscuits, sweets, and milk. In the future, Sento plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell at her shop

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mabinty. She is married and has three children, aged 10, 7 and 5 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her in order to go to school. In 1992 Mabinty established her business, selling dried foods like rice, beans and 'gari.' She began her business, because she wants financial development. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 380,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more foods to resell, including rice, beans and 'gari.' In the future, Mabinty plans to educate her children up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foods to resell, including rice, beans and gari

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Frank.  He is married and has two children, aged 6 and 4 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him for schooling. In 2009 Frank established his business, selling drinks. He began his business to enhance his self-reliance, and it is his only source of income. His business is located at the city centre, and his customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Frank has already received and successfully repaid two loans. Now he requires a new loan, which he will use to buy more drinks for his shop. He hopes that this loan will increase his income level. In the future, Frank plans to educate his children, to build his own house, and to buy a commercial motorbike. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks to resell at his business

loans.name: Fatima Suyapa

texts.es:
Fátima es madre de familia de 4 hijos los cuales viven en su casa junto a su esposo dos de ellos (mayores) están en secundaria y los dos menores están en la primaria. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completado cursado hasta el 6 grado gracias al apoyo por parte de sus padres y al esfuerzo que ellos pusieron para que ella estudiara. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café hace más de 18 años actividad inculcada por sus padres ya que es una actividad practicada por su familia por muchos años y generaciones. Ella se traslada en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos hasta el lugar donde están sus cultivos en ocasiones a pie y otras en motocicleta a una distancia de 5 minutos de su casa de habitación.

Ella solicita ayuda para comprar insumos y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos los cuales necesitan de limpieza, fertilización y abonarlos para cuidar la planta, el grano y la raíz. 

Las metas es poder fertilizar y mantener sus cultivos como hasta hoy en día para obtener una cosecha de calidad y segura. Sus sueños como madre son los de seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que ellos logren seguir estudiando y puedan graduarse a nivel universitario.
texts.en:
Fátima is the mother of four children who live in her house with her husband.  Two of them (the oldest) are in secondary school and the younger two are in elementary school.  She completed elementary school through the sixth grade thanks to the support of her parents and the effort they put into her being able to study.

She has made a living growing coffee for more than 18 years, a job her parents instilled in her because it's a job done by her family for many years and generations.  She and her husband and children go to the place where they grow their crops five minutes from their home, sometimes on foot and other times by motorcycle.

She's requesting help to buy inputs and take care of her crops, which need weeding, fertilizer, and soil amendments to take care of the plant, the bean, and the root.  Her goal is to be able to fertilize and maintain her crops as she has done up to the present so she gets a quality and safe crop.

Her dream as a mother is to keep on supporting her children so they continue to study and graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Osman. He is married and has two children, aged 6 and 3 years. He has seven additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives. In 2007, Osman established his used clothing business. He got his initial capital from his uncle. "This business is my only source of income to provide food and other basic things for my family," said Osman. 

Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. Osman would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. He will use the loan in order to buy more used clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Osman plans to build a dwelling house for his family and to give his children a quality education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to resell at his business

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Héctor habita en la ciudad de Estelí junto con su esposa y sus dos pequeños él se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su vivienda que está ubicada en un buen punto en el cual gracias a Dios ha logrado salir adelante  el primer crédito lo saco para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite. Este nuevo crédito lo necesita para la compra de útiles escolares, granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, aceite frijoles, gaseosas. Él dice que desde que recibió el primer crédito su vida mejoró en gran manera ya que con lo que invirtió su negocio ha crecido y con las ganancias ha hecho mejoras en su vivienda que antes era de madera y ahora la hizo de concreto este feliz y sabe que este nuevo crédito significa una gran inyección de capital para su negocio sus metas futuras son tener su casa construida totalmente y su meta próxima es aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Héctor lives in the city of Estelí with his wife and his two young children.  He makes a living with a small grocery store in his house, which is located in a good place where thanks to God he has managed to get ahead.

He got his first loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, and oil.  He needs this new loan to buy school supplies, basic grains, rice, sugar, oil, beans, and soda.

He says that since he received his first loan his life has improved a lot because with what he invested his business has grown.  Also, with the profits, he has made improvements to his house, which before was made of wood and now he made it of concrete.

He's happy and he knows this new loan means a big injection of capital for his business.  His goal for the future is to have his house completely built.  His next goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and provisions

loans.name: Djantoyerela Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est gombo  avec  SETOU , 2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 90.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the DJANTOYERELA II group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution.  Their previous loan was duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Setou, grows okra. In the photo, she is in the sitting row, second from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Bougoula market.

She is expecting to make a profit of 90,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover plowing costs and to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Beaulla from Mutare. Beaulla is a member of the Mercedes Group. She is married with four children, with two attending school. She also cares for two dependents. Beaulla runs a clothing business selling blankets, tracksuits and kitchenware. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenge she faces is late payment from debtors. Beaulla has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing to sell during the winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Beaulla plans to open her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy blankets, tracksuits and women’s suits to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 40 years old and married with 3 children between 5 years and 10 years old. She runs a general store in Tombo, a rural area in western Sierra Leone. 

To earn a living, she’s been in this business since 2008 and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits in her community. She says that the main problem for her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Zainab has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and pay her children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: El grupo está a cargo de la señora Faustina quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos,y como actividad secundaria a la crianza de gallinas y leña en la colonia de San Pedro Sacatepequez, ella necesita nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta y para la compra de leña ya que le están ofreciendo una camionada de leña la cual esta a buen precio y asi tener muy buena ganancia,
texts.en:
Faustina is in charge of the group.  She makes a living selling cosmetics.  As a secondary job she raises chickens and firewood in the community of San Pedro Sacatepéquez.

She needs another loan to buy cosmetics to sell as well as firewood.  She has been offered a truckload of firewood at a good price, so she'll make a very good profit.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and firewood

loans.name: Las Tigresas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Daysi socia mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera con un hijo adolescente de 19 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace tres años y vende también sandalias, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, papel higiénico, sal, sopas maggi, carne de res, carne de pollo, jabón de  lavar, jabón de baños, hace, cloro, pampers, medicamentos  populares, chiverías, cosméticos variados etc. Judith tiene 20 años su negocio es la venta de sandalias de Masaya y Heydi tiene 35 años de edad su negocio es la venta de mariscos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three successful and entrepreneurial members. One of these members is Daysi, a 42 year old, single mother of one 19 year old son. Her business is a small grocery store in her home which she has operated for three years. She also sells footwear. This loan will be used to purchase rice, beans, sugar, toilet paper, salt, soups, beef, chicken, soaps and detergents, bleach, diapers, over the counter medicines, yogurts, a variety of cosmetics, and other items. Judith, another member, is 20 years old and works selling Masaya sandals, while Heydi, who is 35 years old, works selling seafood.

loans.use: purchase rice, beans, sugar, toilet paper, salt, soups, beef, chicken, soaps and detergents, bleach, diapers, over the counter medicines, yogurts, a variety of cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a 54-year-old married woman with nine children. She would like to start growing a taro plantation to earn a living. Epifania has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, shovels, a wheelbarrow, etc., for taro crops.
 
She has been a member of SPBD for many years. Epifania will spend her profits to extend/improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, shovels, a wheel barrow, etc., for taro crops.

loans.name: Mario Ericson

texts.es: El socio Mario nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 23 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y también a la crianza de animales menores, él requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, él está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Marío was born in the city of Pilco - Grande and continues to live there.  He is 23 years old and has a partner, with whom he has a son.  Mario makes a living in agriculture, cattle raising and raising young animals.  He needs this loan to buy more young animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  He is happy with the loan and promises to make his repayments.  (The Pilco - Grande community is in the Huayllabamba district in the Paucartambo province.  This is in the Cusco department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy more young animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Tapuitea

texts.en: Tapuitea is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing a vegetable garden to earn a living. Tapuitea has requested a loan to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, shovels, a wheelbarrow, and also iron roofing to renovate her house. She has been a member of SPBD for many years. Tapuitea will spend her profits to improve/extend her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, shovels, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, iron roofing, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Amor Group

texts.es: El grupo “ESPERANZA Y AMOR” es un nuevo grupo conformada por 7 mujeres trabajadoras  dedicadas a las diversas actividades del comercio minoristas. Juana tiene 51 años es soltera con una hija de 16 años. En el grupo cumple la función de secretaria. Juana se dedica  a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en el mercado Señor de los Milagros de chosica. Años atrás vendía ropa de niños en forma ambulatoria. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más  verduras y tubérculos. Su mayor deseo es darle una carrera profesional a su hija. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Juana es la primera persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en: The "Esperanza y Amor" group is new and made-up of seven hard-working women, who have various types of small businesses.  Juana is 51 years old, single and has a 16-year-old daughter.  Within the group, Juana is the secretary and she has a business selling vegetables and potatoes at the "Señor de los Milagros" market in Chosica.  Years ago Juana used to work as a street vendor, selling children's clothes.  Juana will use this loan to buy more vegetables and potatoes.  Her biggest wish is for her daughter to study to be a professional.  The group thanks Kiva lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Sofai

texts.en:
Sofai is a 54-year-old married woman with six children. She wants to start a small business catching and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as fishing nets, batteries, flashlights, flippers, etc. In the future, Sofai hopes to improve/extend her business. 

She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. She will use the profit that she will make from her sales not only to reinvest into her business, but also to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, flippers, flashlights, batteries, fishing strings and a canoe.

loans.name: Taulau

texts.en: Taulau is a 49-year-old married woman with nine children. She wants to start a small business selling soft drinks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase more trays of soda, a cooler and a freezer. In the future, Taulau hopes to run a soda shop near the bus station where she's running her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas, a cooler and a freezer.

loans.name: Las Renovadas En Cristo Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Dinora mujer de 31 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos de 12, 10 y 4 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio, tiene dos años de tener su negocio anteriormente vendía sopas y fritanga los fines de semanas, de ser cliente de la institución tiene cinco años lo que refleja su puntualidad en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, papel higiénico, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar, hace, cloro, pamper,medicamentos populares, etc. Sonia es una mujer que tiene 33 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y Esperanza tiene 53 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de sopas y tajadas con queso.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members, one whom is named Dinora. She is a 31 year old woman who is married and has three children ages 12, 10, and 4 years old. She has run a grocery shop at her home for two years; before that she sold soups and traditional dishes on the weekends. She has been a client of this institution for five years, which reflects her commitment to making timely payments. The loan will be used to purchase rice, beans, sugar, toilet paper, salt, soups, beef, chicken, soaps and detergents, bleach, diapers, over the counter medicines, yogurts, a variety of cosmetics, and other items. The other members are Sonia, who is 33 years old and works selling clothing, and Esparanza, who is 53 years old and works selling soups and cheeses.

loans.use: purchase rice, beans, sugar, toilet paper, salt, soups, beef, chicken, soaps and detergents, bleach, diapers, over the counter medicines, and other items.

loans.name: Leauta

texts.en: Leauta is 21 years old and married with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling Elei Materials in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more materials, fabric paints, rolls, etc. In the future, Leauta hopes to have her own workshop. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes, rolls, stencil designs

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is 21 years old and married with one child. She runs a shop that sells general products for everyday use. She has requested a loan to buy more supplies such as boxes of canned fish, corned beef, chicken leg quarters, sausages, milk, sugar, flour, and a new refrigerator. Clara will use her profits to extend and improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011

loans.use: to buy products such as boxes of canned fish, corned beef, chicken leg quarters, sausages, milk, sugar, flour, and a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 23 years old and married with one child. She is operating a small business that makes and sells Elei Materials in her community. To maintain this business venture, she needs a loan to buy more materials, fabric paints, designs, brushes, etc. In the future, Sina hopes to extend and expand her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric paints, brushes, rolls, designs

loans.name: Mamapo

texts.en: Mamapo is 52 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business that sell pancakes and Elei Materials printing in her community and has been doing this for three years. Mamapo has requested a loan to buy ingredients to make pancakes, including flour, sugar, baking powder and cooking oil, plus materials for her Elei business such as fabric materials, fabric paints and  brushes. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mamapo will use the profit from her business to support her needs every day life and to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes.

loans.name: Vaeluaga

texts.en: Vaeluaga is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Vaeluaga has requested a loan to buy equipment for her plantation such as a mist blower, chemicals, bush knives, rakes, and a knife sharpener. She also wants to buy school uniforms for her kids and to pay their school fees. She has been a member of SPBD for three years. With her profits, Vaeluaga hopes to reinvest in her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, rakes, s mist blower, chemicals and knife sharpener for her plantation plus pay school fees and school uniform costs

loans.name: Gaudy

texts.es: Gaudy, 30 años de edad, casada desde hace ocho años, ella se dedica a vender todo tipo de calzado Nicaraguence desde hace dos años, ella consigue estos zapatos en una distribuidora ubicada en Paso Canoas, donde le venden al por mayor, su madre le ayuda a vender algunos zapatos y la acompaña a realizar las compras de los pedidos que realizan. La compra y distribución se le facilita porque ella maneja y cuenta con un vehículo para trabajar más rápido. Doña Gaudy desea este crédito para comprar más mercadería y poder cubrir los encargos que le realizan; ya que tiene suficiente clientela que la prefiere por la buena calidad de los zapatos y los cómodos precios que ofrece.Ella eligió a Fundación Mujer ya que vive en una zona de difícil acceso donde es la primera vez que llegan a ofrecer créditos para micro empresarias con pocos requisitos y bajas tasas de interés. En un futuro ella planea exhibir diferentes zapatos desde su casa y contar con suficiente mercadería para ofrecer a toda su clientela
texts.en: Gaudy, who is 30 years old, has been married eight years and has worked the last two years selling all kinds of Nicaraguan footwear. She acquires all of these shoes from a wholesale distributor located in Pasos Canoas. Her mother helps sell her make some sales and also accompanies her while making purchases for orders she has made. She is able to easily purchase and make pick ups because she drives and has a vehicle that allows her to work more quickly. Gaudy is applying for this loan in order to purchase more merchandise and to cover these costs, seeing as she has sufficient customers who prefer her for high quality and reasonably prices shoes. She selected Fundación Mujer because she lives in an area with difficult access, and this is the first time they have visited to offer loans to small business owners. They offer low interest rates and minimal requirements. In the future Gaudy plans to display many different shoes from her home and have plenty of merchandise to offer all of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Charley

texts.en:
As a teenager, Charley watched, learned and helped his father, who was a carpenter, build homes.  A Vietnam and Desert Storm veteran who retired from the military in 2004, Charley taught in the Houston school district when he returned home and soon after began working for large construction companies and as an independent contractor. 

Charley later moved to Dallas to continue to serve his country, working for L-3, a company that works to enhance government intelligence and security. Charley works overnight specifically with black boxes, which hold recorded information about airplane performance parameters. During the day, Charley continues what he learned from his father as a carpenter creating wooden furniture to sell.  He plans on using the funds to help him with start-up costs, lumber purchases and to cover the costs of a specialty woodworking course.

Before getting a loan from Accion Texas Inc., Charley had already invested more than $1,500 for a banner, tools and equipment that he needs for his business, and he has secured a site to sell at the First Monday Market Place in Canton, Texas. To improve the amount of items he has to offer, Charley is using his loan to take that specialty class with his wife, who will cover the stand while he is working. The class will also provide Charley and his wife with additional equipment and wood to jumpstart his business.

loans.use: to pay for start-up costs and lumber purchases and to cover the costs of a specialty woodworking course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hay.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
To support his family, Jose entered the janitorial business more than 17 years ago, cleaning facilities as a side job. Born and raised in Carrollton, Texas, just northwest of Dallas, Jose is familiar with the hustle and bustle of city life and excited about officially working as owner of his self-titled cleaning business.

While listening to the radio one day, he learned about Accion Texas Inc. and all the organization can do to help him start his own business.  He quickly inquired about applying for a loan, and after he submitted his application, was approved for a loan. Jose understands that his Accion loan will provide more business as the van he purchased with it will help expand his clientele. He works alone at the moment but would like to hire a full-time and one part-time employee in the near future.  

Without the Accion loan, Jose could not have started his cleaning business as quickly.  He continues to work with his current clients and plans to obtain other clients to increase business.

loans.use: to purchase a van.

loans.name: Becy

texts.es: Becy, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una colonia de San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida. Ella lleva dos años de tener su propio negocio en su casa, donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, churros, pan, huevos, manteca, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, productos de limpieza y otros abarrotes. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 12,000 Lempiras con el fin de comprar más productos alimenticios para la venta como granos basicos, carnes, productos de limpieza y otros abarrotes. para tener siempre surtido. Ella tiene como meta ampliar su negocio y surtirlo más, y con las ganancias poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Becy, 30, lives with her husband and their two children in the community of San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida.  For two years she has been running her own business from home, where she sells food products such as basic grains, fritters, bread, eggs, shortening, meats, sausages, dairy products, cleaning products and other groceries.

She has decided to request her second loan through ODEF in the amount of 12,000 HNL in order to buy more food products, such as basic grains, meats, cleaning products and other groceries to keep her store well stocked.  Her goal is to expand her business by offering more items in an effort to earn more profit to help her family.

loans.use: To buy food products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Angel Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Ángel   tiene 59 años casado tiene tres hijos, el Sr. Ángel  se dedica  a la   fabricación de variedad de Calzados, para mujeres, tiene su taller en la zona Marcelo Quiroga la  ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, el Sr. Ángel  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material para la fabricación de calzados como cuero por mayor y otros materiales que necesita para la  fabricación de sus calzados  y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, el Sr. Ángel  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, el Sr. Ángel  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada,  su deseo es poder producir en mayor cantidad y ofrecer sus productos a distintos mercados  y ferias de los distintos departamentos a nivel Nacional.
texts.en:
Ángel, 59, is married and has three children.  He manufactures a variety of women's shoes in his workshop located in the Marcelo Quiroga area of the city of La Paz.  This is his first loan through the institution and Ángel plans to use the loan to buy wholesale leather and other materials he needs so he can offer a variety of products to his customers.  His goal is to improve his business and invest his profits in buying more materials.

Ángel is a very hard worker and grateful for this opportunity.  His goal is to produce more products and expand his market through different national trade fairs and markets.

loans.use: To buy leather.

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Norma, es una mujer casada no tiene hijos aun, su negocio es la venta de frescos en uno de los mercados de Managua, es su único medio de ingresos, ya que su preparación académica fue hasta 6to grado de primaria no pudo continuar estudiando porque tenía que trabajar, su esposo labora en una zona franca como operario; así esta pareja intenta salir adelante, el mayor sueño de Norma es poder hacerle unas mejoras a su hogar, es por eso que está experimentando el sistema de crédito para empezar a construir la parte trasera de su casa que esta forrada de laminas viejas y oxidadas de zinc, que representan un peligro para su salud y bienestar, mas ahora con las fuertes lluvias del invierno.
texts.en:
Norma is married but has no children yet.  She sells fresh produce at one of the markets in Managua, which is her only source of income.  She went to school only through the sixth grade because she had to work and could not continue her education.  Her husband works as an operator in the tax-free zone and between the two of them they are able to make ends meet.  

In an effort to carry out home improvements, which is her main goal, Norma is requesting a loan so she can begin work on the back of the house.  The old, rusty metal sheeting on the outside walls pose a health risk, especially now that winter will bring the heavy rains.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, iron and blocks.

loans.name: Gloria Beatriz

texts.es: Gloria de 62 años de edad, se dedicó por más de ocho años a la confección a terceros, pero desde hace cuatro años decidió dedicarse al alquiler de andamios debido a la demanda en su sector por este servicio. Labora diariamente en compañía con su esposo de 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de andamios con el fin de ampliar su servicio y mejorar sus ingresos. Su mayor deseo es reunir el dinero necesario para la compra de su propia vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: 62-year-old Gloria made a living for more than eight years by dressmaking, but four years ago she decided to dedicate her time to renting out scaffolding due to the demand in the sector for this service. She works daily with her spouse from 6:00am until 8:00pm. She is now requesting a loan, which she will invest in purchasing scaffolding with the goal of expanding her services and improving her earnings. Her greatest wish is to get together the necessary money to purchase her own home and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Orlanda

texts.es:
Orlanda de 58 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de la confección desde hace muchos años. Diariamente lucha por ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Labora diariamente desde su casa lo que le permite estar pendiente de las labores del hogar. Su mayor sueño es comprar una vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Con el propósito de incrementar la productividad en su taller, Orlanda se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará insumos (telas, hilos), mejorando de esta manera su condición económica.
texts.en:
58-year-old Orlanda has made a living from dressmaking for many years. Every day she strives to offer her family a better quality of life.

She works every day from home, which allows her to attend to her housework. Her greatest dream is to buy a house so she can improve her living conditions.

Orlanda is requesting a loan with the goal of increasing the productivity of her workshop. She will use it to buy supplies (fabric and thread), thereby improving her economic condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fabric, thread)

loans.name: Malaea

texts.en:
Malaea is a 42-year-old woman who is married with five children. 

She operates a small bingo business to assist her financially. She has been running this business for four years. Malaea needs a loan to buy more bingo packets and bottles to maintain her bingo operation and assist with her children's school fees and school uniforms. 

She will use her profits to save some money in the bank for the family's needs. Malaea joined SPBD two years ago to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy more bingo packets and bottles and help pay for school fees and school uniforms.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a 36-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest child is 18, while the youngest is four. 

She is engaged in hog raising. She has been raising hogs for three years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed and additional piglets. 

In the future, Emilia would like to expand her hog raising business, be successful and at the same time send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Fausto Yair

texts.es: Fausto, tiene 40 años y es padre de dos hijos menores de edad. Cuenta con un taller de confecciones, el cual creó gracias al apoyo de su familia. Labora diariamente con su esposa de 8:00 am a 7:00 pm, con el fin de generar el sustento para el hogar y la ecuación de sus hijos. Asegura que uno se sus mayores deseos es ampliar su capacidad de producción y garantizarle a varias personas de su localidad un empleo digno. Con el fin de alcanzar su propósito, Fausto se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina plana e insumos como telas e hilos.
texts.en: Fausto is forty years old and is a father to two children, both of whom are under the age of eighteen.  Fausto has a tailoring workshop, which he started with his family's support.  He works with his wife every day, from 8am until 7pm so that he can support the household and pay for his children's education.  Fausto tells us that one of his biggest wishes is to increase his production capicity and guarantee a decent job for some people in his local area.  In order to achieve this, Fausto is applying for a loan to invest in a flat sewing machine and supplies such as threads and materials.

loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine and supplies such as threads and materials.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon,Bohol. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells goods like coffee, canned goods, pouch vinegar, soy sauce, soaps and toiletries. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 10 years now.

Emma requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more goods to sell like soft drinks, beverages and condiments. In the future, Emma would like to expand her business to support her family and to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell like soft drinks, beverages and condiments

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 51-year-old married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation business, which grows taro and bananas. She has been doing this for four years. 

Telesia has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, a mist blower, a rake, fertilisers and knife sharpeners for her business and also to pay for her children's school fees. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. With her profits, Telesia hopes to expand her plantation and also assist in her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, a mist blower, a rake, fertilisers and knife sharpeners and also to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Dolores De Jesùs

texts.es:
Dolores, tiene 68 años de edad y es una mujer a la que le sobran ganas de trabajar. Cuenta con un almacén desde hace algunos años, negocio que construyó con el fruto de su arduo trabajo, Inició su actividad comercial con la venta de helados y tortas desde su casa. Posteriormente con sus ahorros decidió montar un almacén dedicado a la venta de artículos varios. 
Con el fin de adecuación su negocio, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en reparaciones y mejoras a la planta física garantizando de este modo un servicio de calidad.
Su mayor sueño es compartir con su familia, gozar de una vida tranquila y sin preocupaciones económicas.
texts.en:
Dolores, 68, is a woman who loves to work.  For several years she has been running a shop that took her years of hard work to establish.  She first got into business by selling ice cream and cakes from home, but eventually saved enough money to open a gift shop.

In order to renovate the shop, she is requesting a loan to make repairs and improvements so she can guarantee optimum service.  Her goal in life is to enjoy her family, live a peaceful life and not have to worry about financial issues.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements in her shop.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos, de 59 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia. Cuenta con un taller de mecánica para motocicletas, ubicado en su residencia desde hace más de un año. Asegura que aprendió la actividad de manera empírica y siente gran felicidad por las bendiciones recibidas. 
Gracias a su negocio, ha logrado sacar su familia adelante y garantizarle mejores condiciones de vida. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de repuestos, con el propósito de continuar con el desarrollo de la actividad y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 59 years old and is very hard-working and dedicated to his family.  For over a year now he has been running a garage, at his home, where he repairs motorcycles.  He learned this trade on his own and feels very happy to be so blessed.

Thanks to his business, Carlos has managed to help his family prosper and can guarantee them better living conditions.  He is applying for a loan to buy spare parts so that he can continue with his work and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has nine children. The oldest child is 25, while the youngest is 10. 

She operates a buying and selling business. She sells purified drinking water to customers in the community. Aside from selling purified water, she also sells medicines to augment her income. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more gallons of purified water and various medicines to resell. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to expand her business to support her family and to finance the study of her children.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of purified water and various medicines to resell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 53-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three children aged 29, 21 and 15 years old respectively. 

She is engaged in a buying and selling business. She sells dried fish. She has been selling dried fish for almost eight years now. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish to be dried. This will help Lourdes gain more capital and enable her to continue to earn for a living. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to expand her buying and selling business to provide her family with good food and to save for the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to be dried

loans.name: Diana Yulied

texts.es: Diana tiene 38 años de edad. Su negocio consiste en la confección y venta de pijamas, así como en la comercialización de gorros, bufandas y guantes. Vive en la capital de la República de Colombia, en la linda Bogotá, con su conyugue y un hijo de 13 años de edad. Desde hace cuatro años inició las confecciones de pijamas como una respuesta a la necesidad que presentaban los clientes al visitar su negocio de venta de bufandas, gorros y guantes, que le preguntaban que si vendía pijamas. Diana visionó esto como una oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos, y contribuir en una mayor proporción con la sostenibilidad de los gastos de su hogar, para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Su proceso productivo inicia con la compra de telas e insumos como botones e hilos, hace los diseños, los corta, confecciona, empaca, y los coloca en el punto de venta. La venta es diaria y de contado. Compra también de contado en almacenes de telas y de insumos de confecciones.  Diana ha recibido dos créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; su primer credikiva lo usará para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, gorros, guantes, bufandas, una máquina plana y una cortadora. Con esta inversión espera aumentar su producción y sus ventas, para más adelante ver cumplir sus sueños de crecimiento del negocio con dos puntos de venta.
texts.en:
Diana, 38, has a sewing business and sells pijamas, hats, scarves and gloves.  She lives in the beautiful capital city of Colombia, Bogotá, with her husband and 13-year-old son.  For four years she has been making pijamas in response to the demand by customers who, when visiting her business, would ask if she sold pijamas.  Diana saw an opportunity to expand business, increase her income and contribute more to the household economy in an effort to improve the family's lifestyle.

Her manufacturing process begins with the purchase of fabric and supplies such as buttons and thread; then she designs, cuts, sews, packages and puts her products up for sale.  She sells every day on cash basis.  She also pays in cash when buying fabric and supplies.

Diana has received two loans through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She used her first CrediKiva loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, hats, gloves, scarves and sewing machines.  With this investment she plans to increase production and sales so in the future she will be able to reach her goal of opening a second sales point.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to increase production and sales.

loans.name: Darim

texts.en:
Mrs. Darim is 62 years old and lives with her three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land.

She has been running a grocery store for three years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her grocery store is located in a central city area and over the years, she has secured permanent customers.

Now, she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam, as well as to pay for house renovators. As a result, she and her daughters will live in a comfortable and warm place. 

More importantly, due to the renovated house, the family will reduce their coal consumption; thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere, which contributes to the clean air efforts. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is 46 years old and married with three grown-up children. 

She has been engaged in a hog raising business for five years. Flor is a very hard-working person, she makes sure that she can provide for the needs of her family. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and additional piglets for her business. 

In the future, Flor hopes that her business will expand, so she can provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and medicine

loans.name: Edarlina

texts.en:
This is Edarlina. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy materials needed in her business to expand her product inventory, such as paper and varnish. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the raw materials used to make her handicrafts. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She dreams that her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration God.

loans.use: to buy raw materials used to make her handicrafts.

loans.name: Namuun

texts.en:
Mrs Namuun is 22 years old and lives with her brother in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The siblings reside in their own house on a plot of land. 

She has been working as a foreign relations manager and translator at a private business entity for one year and she says she is learning a lot of things from her colleagues. Her brother works at a construction site. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair work because in winter time, they are chilled to the bone. So she is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles and a metal door. 

Installing those items into her house will create a comfortable and warm place to live. Also, the renovated house will reduce their coal consumption; thus releasing less pollutants, which contributes to the clean air efforts. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles and a metal door

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming corn, mangoes and bananas in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lourdes has been farming corn, mangoes and bananas for 25 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and selling roasted chicken.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham grows rice crops in their village. Through this activity he is able to finance the daily expenditures of his family. Abraham works hard to generate more income for his seven children. According to him, having that number of children is really difficult, thus he is working double time. To continuously provide for the needs of his family especially his children, Abraham wants to request a PHP 20,000 loan from KIVA lenders. Abraham said that this amount is essential for him to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so that he can increase his yield. He hopes that the lenders will be generous enough to help him improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Pureza De Dios Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras exitosas una de ellas es Flor mujer de 55 años de edad su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortillas negocio que viene realizando desde hace 11 años, es soltera y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales tiene a su cargo uno de 23 años de edad, ella y una trabajadora que le paga le ayuda en el negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cal, gas butano, frijoles crudos etc. Delia tiene 25 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio, Geyly tiene 33 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Katy tiene 24 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon comida rápida y refrescos naturales.
texts.en: This group has four successful and enterprising members.  One is 55-year-old Flor.  She has had a business making and selling tortillas for eleven years.  She is single and has seven children - one of whom is 23 years old - who are all still under her charge.  Flor has a worker whom she pays to help with her business. Flor will invest this loan in buying corn, lime, butane gas, raw beans and more.  Delia is 25 years old and has a grocery store that she runs out of her home. Geyly is 33 and sells new clothes.  Katy is 24 years old and has a business selling Avon products, fast food and natural soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, butane gas, raw beans and more.

loans.name: Ganmyagmar

texts.en: Mrs. Ganmyagmar, 49 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been running a meat sales business at the food market for almost three years and has secured many permanent customers. Her husband renders a taxi service to local people using his own automobile. The house they live in has deteriorated walls, windows, roof and floors. She purchased some building materials herself but couldn't afford to buy large items. So she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles and fiberglass. Using these items, her husband can renovate their house back to its original state. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and release less pollutants, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles and fiberglass

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is engaged in the livestock business. He has run this type of business for 30 years. Franklin is married to a teacher and they have been blessed with four children.

Franklin's previous loan has been of great help for the continuous growth of his business. Currently, he raises two sows and two piglets. He is grateful because through his determination, patience and proper management of his business, he was able to make a better income. He still aims for a more progressive business and he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 which he will use to purchase stocks of feed and provide the essential vitamins for his hogs to ensure their proper nutrition. In this way, he can sell his hogs for a greater price enabling him to support his children's education, improve their standard of living and save some of their income for future use. He hopes that the KIVA lenders through ASKI will grant his loan request.

loans.use: to buy stocks of feed and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Sabougnouman  sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent ensemble dans le quartier de Hamdallaye dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le commerce d’habits (bazin riche et moyen riche) teintés. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont connu intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 13eme  cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Rokia (3ème  femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bazin teintés. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 mètres de bazin riche et 10 boîtes de couleurs et d’indigos pour la teinture.  Le bazin teinté est vendu au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant dans le quartier à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Rokia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge le complément de condiments du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women in the Sabougnouman group are married and most of them live in monogamous families. On average, they are 35 years old and have three children. They live together in the Hamdallaye neighbourhood in the region of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through being relatives, neighbours and in-laws. 

The members of the group sell dyed clothing (high-quality and medium-quality bazin cloth). In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. This is their 13th solidarity loan cycle.

Rokia (pictured standing third from the right) has a great reputation in the dyed bazin trade. She is hoping to use her loan to buy 20 meters of high-quality bazin and 10 boxes of colours and indigos for dyeing the cloth. She sells dyed bazin for cash and on credit, both from home and as a travelling vendor, to her customers in the local neighbourhood, the majority of whom are women. 

Rokia hopes that with this loan she can make an average of 40 000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to reinvest in the business and buy additional food supplies for her household.

loans.use: to buy bazin cloth and dyes.

loans.name: Lidia Flor

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 30 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camana, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Lidia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lidia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de arado, sembrado, cosecha y otros, Lidia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Lidia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para reforzar y tarrajear las paredes de su hogar, de esta manera Lidia tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 30-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Camana. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who strives to get ahead. Unfortunately Lidia could not study towards a degree due to a lack of economic resources and because she had to work from a very young age to help her parents. In her free time she likes to walk through the friendly streets of her city and sometimes she cooks a delicious chicken to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Lidia works as a field worker on a farm in her city. She does ploughing, sowing, harvesting, and other kinds of work. Lidia works every day for approximately ten hours and she thinks it is going well because of her good work performance and because of her friendliness towards the others.

Lidia is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to them she will be able to make improvements to her home. She wants to buy building materials to strengthen and plaster the walls of her home so she will have greater security and well-being. She will continue working and endeavouring to achieve her great dream of completely finishing her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Cheourn's Group

texts.en:
Cheourn is 61 years old and married. She strives for a living via paddy rice farming on a five hectare area and supplements her income with bean growing on a three hectare area as well as cow raising. She has been involved in the current business for ages. Cheourn has been with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) for the past five cycles. The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has generated better income than before from her business to maintain good living conditions for her family. 

For this cycle, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and to buy rice seed, potash, and insecticide for her farmland. She has high hopes that she can grow a healthy and fruitful cash crop with an expected high crop output.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, and to buy rice seed, potash, and insecticide.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa est d'origine Maure, elle est marié et mère de famille. Elle agée de 51 et évolue dans la commercialisation du Tabac, elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cet activité.Elle commence sa journée à 8h et la termine à 18h. Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais d'scolarités de ses enfants. Awa sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 125000F pour acheter du tabac et le revend en détails dans le marché, A l'avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique et diversifier ses produits
texts.en:
Awa is of Moorish origins. She is 51 years old, married and a mother. 

Awa is developing her tobacco business, in which she has more than ten years experience. She starts her working day at 8am and finishes at 6pm, and uses her profits to help her husband with day-to-day expenses and their children’s school fees. 

Awa is requesting a loan of 125 000 francs to purchase tobacco, which she will resell to individuals at the market. In the future she would like to open a shop and diversify her products.

loans.use: to buy tobacco to resell at the market

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru:
Азам мужчина, в возрасте 42 лет, женат, имеет четверых детей.   Он занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота в течении 20 лет, имеет большой опыт.   Азам покупает крупно рогатый скот с базара, откармливает  3, 4 месяца и продает их мясникам.   Кроме этого он дополнительно занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной продукции и имеет 2 га земли.   Старший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, и по возможности присылает деньги своим родителям.   Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве.  У них в семье основной доход от выращивания скота, поэтому  Азам старается развивать этот бизнес.  
На данный момент Азам хочет приобрести скот но у него на руках нету  достаточной суммы. Он решил подать заявку на кредит и обратился в организацию Арванд. У него очень большие планы на будущее, он мечтает обучить своих детей и дать им достойное образование, поэтому он работает день и ночь,чтобы осуществить свои планы.   
На полученный кредит Азам хочет купить скот и увеличить стадо.
texts.en:
Azam is 42 years old and he is married with four children.  He has been raising livestock for 20 years and he has much experience in this area.  He buys cattle at the bazaar, feeds them for two or three months and then resells them for meat.  He also supplements his income by raising crops on his two hectares of land.  His elder son is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation and he sends money to his parents whenever possible.  Azam's wife works on an orchard farm.  Their main income is generated from the cattle raising, which is why Azam is trying to expand his business.

At the moment, Azam wants to purchase cows but he does not have enough cash in hand for this.  He decided to apply for a loan from Arvand.  Azam has big plans for the future; he dreams of being able to give his children a good education, which is why he works day and night to fulfill his plans.  On receiving the loan, Azam plans to purchase livestock and increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nely Vicenta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nely Vicenta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Nely Vicenta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice grain business.

Nely Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through the past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio es un joven de 30 años que está casado con Mariela y reside en su casa construida a base de adobe junto con sus 2 Hijos de 4 y 10 años de edad respectivamente.Trabaja desde hace 10 años como agricultor y este es su principal sustento económico. Cuenta siempre con el apoyo de su esposa quien aparte de atender a sus pequeños hijos trabaja con el en el campo.Para mejorar la calidad de sus productos usa abono orgánico y trata de que sus plantaciones estén libres de maleza.Cuando cosecha sus productos los lleva a la ciudad para venderlos y obtener muy buenas ganancias.Su principal objetivo es comprar otro terreno agrícola para ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao y empezar a cultivar plantas frutales.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.En está oportunidad desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Artemio is a young man of 30 who is married to Mariela.  He lives in his own home, which is built from adobe, together with his two children who are 4 and 10 years old.  Artemio has been working as a farmer for 10 years and this is his main financial means of support.  He can always count on the support of his wife who, in addition to caring for their young children, also works with him in the fields.  In order to improve the quality of his crops, Artemio uses organic fertilizer and tries to keep his plantations weed free.  When he harvests his produce, he takes it to the city to sell and makes very good profits.  His main goal is to buy another plot of farmland so that he can expand his cacao plantations and start growing fruit.

This is Artemio's first loan through Kiva and he feels very grateful for the financial support that he is receiving as it will allow him to keep making progress.  On this occasion, he is requesting 500 soles to buy organic fertilizer with which to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is 22-year-old young mother of one little child from Moung Russey district of Battambang province where her residential area is. She is a local farmer who does rice cropping as her main business to earn a decent income to support her entire household. The current business has returned about 25,800 KHR per day. Sreymom is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). She has fully repaid her past loan with success in order to upgrade her living conditions. 

Now, she leads a group of eight to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her entire group is 5,500,000 KHR of which 500,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain double the yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 43 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Nieves is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nieves has been farming corn for nine years and earns additional income from rice retailing and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Al Limite Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por 4 socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Sonia mujer de 46 años de edad, acompañada, con cinco hijos de 30, 27, 24, 19 y 11 años de edad. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, destace de cerdo , hecha y venta de nacatamales, esta actividad tiene 10 años que se dedica a esa actividad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada en sabanas, pantalón de mujer, pantalón de varón, camisas de varón, camisetas, blusas, faldas, etc., materia prima para nacatamal carne de cerdo, hoja de chagüites, mecates, papas, tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, ajos, sal, achiote, arroz, leña, maíz, cal etc. Luisa tiene 30 años de edad su negocio es destace de cerdo y venta de pasteles, Elba tiene 23 años de edad su negocio es la venta de almuerzo, hecha y venta de tortillas y Juana tiene 23 años de edad su negocio es la venta de fritanga y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four successful, entrepreneurial women.  One of them is 46-year-old Sonia.  Sonia lives with her partner and has five children who are 30, 27, 24, 19 and 11 years old.  Her businesses are selling used clothing, slaughtering pigs, and making and selling tamales.  She has been in business for 10 years.  Sonia will use her loan to buy used clothing (ponchos, men's and women's trousers, men's shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, etc.)  She will also buy raw materials for preparing tamales such as pork, banana leaves, string, potatoes, tomatoes, onion, sweet pepper, garlic, salt, annatto, rice, firewood, corn, lime, etc.)

Luisa is 30 years old and her business is slaughtering pigs and selling cakes.  Elba is 23 years old and her business is selling lunches, and preparing and selling tortillas.  Juana is 23 years old and her business is selling fried food and new clothing.

loans.use: to buy used clothing (ponchos, women's and men's trousers, men's shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts), and raw materials for making tamales such as pork, banana leaves, string, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, garlic, salt, annatto, rice, firewood, corn, lime, etc.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Narantuya, 47 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Kherlen, the eastern-most town of Mongolia. The family resides in an old apartment. She has been working as a railroader at a private business entity since 1985. Her husband has a job with a building company. The apartment they live in has vulnerable windows, walls and floor, so she is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floor and fiberglass. Her husband will install these items into their apartment and make their living conditions better. The renovated apartment won't lose heat through its walls and windows and will preserve energy. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floor and fiberglass

loans.name: Layland

texts.en:
Layland works hard to support her family. She has a business selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. Layland has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of phone accessories to sell.

Layland successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her phone accessories business. In the future, Layland would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan worked abroad for eight years. Wanting to be with her family, Susan decided to go home and build her own business. Currently, Susan operates her carinderia and boarding house businesses. She has run her carinderia for eight years and she has managed the boarding house for nine years. Susan and her husband are blessed with four children, two of whom are already working while the other two are still studying. Susan aims to have a stable source of income and provide her family with a better way of life. Aside from that, she wants her other two children to finish their College studies. For her goals to be realized, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 which will be used to buy kitchen utensils, raw meat and various kinds of vegetables to keep her carinderia profitable. Susan believes that her requested loan will be granted through the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, raw meat and vegetables for her carinderia business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business. Leonora has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns income from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her restaurant and general store business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, soap, chips, sugar, etc., for her general store business.

Pacita has been in this business for 7 years. Pacita earns more income from buying and selling jewelry.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, soap, chips, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Fifty-five year old Chea is a father of eight children living in the Moung Ruessei district of Battambang, with his wife and their children. As a village chief, Chea is a hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts a lot of effort into helping the village people as well as his family to get ahead in their businesses. Aiming to change the financial position of the family, he is dedicated to his farming business growing rice on his own farmland of around 2 1/2 hectares. Thanks to his own hard work, and with help from his wife and children, he is able to generate a better net income of KHR 26,800 per day to cover the family’s expenses.

Chea is very grateful to Kiva donors as the loan will be a great help so he will be able to purchase building materials and hire people to construct a bathroom where it will be comfortable for the family to wash or bathe. It’s important for him to keep his family in a living environment that is clean and hygienic.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and hire people to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Rorn is a 59-year-old mother of eight children. For her family, five hectares area of paddy rice growing is the sole business that she has had since she was 39 years old. She is able to earn about 27,000 KHR per day from this current business. Including this loan, she is the fifth-time borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) and she already repaid her past four loans. 

The loans have upgraded her living at a good pace, better than before. Now, in a group of two female members, she is a group leader.  She is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Rorn will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay for reaping fees and plowing fees. She hopes to gain more income so that she can expand her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay reaping fees and plowing fees.

loans.name: Ana Elvia

texts.es:
Ana de 63 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración manual de  artesanías en lana e hilo, actividad que inició hace más de 40 años como un entretenimiento, y con el tiempo se convirtió en su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus cinco hijos. Su trabajo es ampliamente reconocido en su municipio debido a que a la calidad de sus productos. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que  invertirá en la compra de insumos (lana, hilos, aguja). Espera que con dicha inversión pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Uno de sus mayores retos es crear conciencia a sus clientes del trabajo que requiere la elaboración de sus bordados, ya que muchos requieren los productos a muy bajos costos.
texts.en:
63-year-old Ana makes a living by making handicrafts out of wool and thread. She started doing this more than 40 years ago as a pastime, and over time she turned it into a source of income to sustain her five children. Her work is widely recognised in her municipality due to the quality of her products. She is requesting a loan, which she will invest in purchasing supplies (wool, thread, needles). She hopes that with this investment she will be able to improve her quality of life.

One of her greatest goals is to make her clients aware of the work that goes into making her embroidery, since many of her clients want the products at very low prices.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (wool, thread, needles)

loans.name: Stefanny Isbell

texts.es: Stefanny es una joven de 19 años de edad, soltera. Desde hace dos años se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de bisutería, es estudiante de décimo año en un colegio nocturno, sus deseos de superación y ganas de generar sus propios ingresos la llevan a confeccionar diversidad de artesanía, desde pulseras, collares, aretes, atrapa sueños, camisetas, cortinas, sábanas con decoración estilo hippie. Su clientela se basa en estudiantes y turistas de la zona Sur. Su producto llama la atención porque es algo que no pasa de moda y gusta mucho por su calidad. Stefanny es una joven muy creativa, ella necesita este crédito para comprar suficiente mercadería y confeccionar su diferente artesanía. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y la buena atención que se le brinda. En un futuro ella desea capitalizar, crecer y mantenerse con el tiempo ya que esto le permite continuar sus estudios y lograr obtener un trabajo con salario estable.
texts.en:
Stefanny, 19, is a young, single woman. She has been making all kinds of accessories for two years. Stefanny studies in a night school and she is in 10th grade. Her will to get ahead and generate her own income motivated her to make different types of handicrafts, such as armbands, necklaces, earrings, dreamcatchers, t-shirts, curtains and sheets with hippie-style decorations. Her customers are mainly students and tourists that visit the region. Her products are attractive, since they are of good quality and never go out of style.

Stefanny is a creative young woman. She needs this loan to buy materials to make her handicrafts. She chose Fundación Mujer because of the low interest rate they offer and their good customer service. In the future, she hopes to have more capital, grow and make her business sustainable. This will help her to continue with her studies and to have a job with a stable salary.

loans.use: to buy materials for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Carlos Urbano

texts.es:
Carlos, es un hombre emprendedor y amante a su trabajo. Desde joven aprendió el oficio de mecánica y decidió dedicarse a esta labor, con el fin de sostener su hogar compuesto por su esposo y tres hijos. Con el fin de mejorar su actividad y aumentar su volumen de ventas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de repuestos, ya que las ventas han disminuido considerablemente en los últimos días. 
Su mayor sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar y garantizarse a sus hijos el acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Carlos is an entrepreneurial man who loves his work.
