He trained to become a mechanic at a young age and decided to work in this field in order to provide for his household (his wife and three children).  Carlos is requesting a loan to invest in buying spare parts with the goal of improving his business and increasing his sales volume as sales have decreased considerably recently.

Carlos' biggest dream is to improve his family's quality of life and guarantee his children access to higher education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: mario de 36 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, es un hombre muy responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, mario desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú  como pollo, arroa, carne, refrescos, frutas, verduras, etc. y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Mario, 36, lives with his wife and three children. He is a responsible man that makes sure his family has everything they need. He works selling food, close to where he lives. He has been doing it for two years and has a good customer base, since his prices are attractive.

Mario wants to enlarge his establishment. He will buy tables, chairs and ingredients to offer a more varied menu, such as chicken, rice, meat, beverages, fruits, vegetables, etc. This way, he hopes to increase his income. However, his current income is not enough to cover this investment and this is why he is requesting a loan to buy these things. He will make better profits and give his children everything they might need.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and ingredients such as chicken, rice, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Luordes lives in Caralucod, Isabela. She is married and blessed with four children; all of them attend school. She does poultry farming for a living; this has been her occupation for ten years. 

Luordes found out about ASKI through a friend; she wants to expand the capacity of her business. She seeks a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy chicks and chicken feed. She plans to grow her business and provide employment for many people. The challenge she faces is the contagious nature of sickness that affects poultry. 

She is getting this loan to attain food security, and to improve the be living standards for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel cultivates her 1.4 hectares of rice field, and she has been in this field for more than ten years.  Maribel is married, and blessed with four children;  two of whom are already studying.  Aside from farming, Maribel is also managing a variety store for additional income.  

Maribel would like to seek the financial assistance of KIVA lenders through ASKI for a loan of PHP 30,000 that will allow her to buy necessary farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizer, and insecticides. 

She knows that through this loan, she could further improve her farming business which will enable her to earn greater profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
Age 42 and a widowed mother of six children, Khan is a villager from Battambang province. To tackle the daily cost of living, she does rainy season paddy rice farming on a five hectares area. She has had this business for ten years, and it has given her about 26,100 KHR per day. 

Khan has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle. She has repaid her past loan wisely, and it has improved her livelihood. 

Now she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. 

She hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.es:
Gildardo, inició su negocio hace cinco años con el fin de autoemplearse, debido a que necesitaba generar los recursos necesarios para la alimentación y la educación de su hijo. En un principio inició ayudándole a un amigo en un puesto de comidas rápidas, y desde hace cuatro meses se independizó y siente que ha tenido muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes.
Con el fin de seguir creciendo dentro del sector de alimentos, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, una parrilla y surtido.  
Sueña en un futuro cercano tener su propio local y aumentar su nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Gildardo started his business five years ago in order to give himself work, because he needed to earn income to feed and educate his son. At the beginning he started by helping a friend with a fast food spot, and four months ago he went off on his own and he thinks he has been well accepted by the customers.

In order to keep growing within the food sector, he is asking for a loan that he will invest in buying a fast food cart, a grill and some merchandise. He dreams of having his own locale and increasing his sales in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart, a grill and some merchandise

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 44 years old; she is married and has five children. She lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. 

To make a living, Fely has a shop that sells groceries and beverages. She has had this business for ten years, and earns a monthly income of 9500 PHP.

Fely is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional stock, such as ten boxes of assorted groceries and ten cases of beverages.

Fely has been a member of Paglaum MPC for nine years.

loans.use: To purchase ten boxes of assorted groceries and ten cases of beverages.

loans.name: Sokim's Group

texts.en:
Sokim is a local farmer from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Besides her paddy rice growing business on 1.5 hectare of farmland, her husband also supplements the family income by fishing. 

Sokim has had her current business for 11 years. This business gives her about 31,700 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Sokim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  After the successful loans that she has repaid completely, she feels confident she can pay her loan back on time, and upgrade her living in a gradual manner.  Additionally, she can afford to build a new, decent house for her family. 

Now, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, potash, and to pay for a plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, potash, and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: María Mariela

texts.es:
María tiene 66 años de edad y desde hace algunos años decidió dedicarse a la venta de helados con el apoyo de uno de sus tres hijos quien se capacitó en esta actividad. Gracias a la calidad en el servicio su negocio se encuentra altamente posicionado en el sector. Razón por la cual hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y adecuaciones locativas. 
Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 66, decided some years ago to start selling ice cream with the help of one of her three children, who received some training for this activity.

Thanks to the high quality of the service, this business is now highly positioned in the area. For this reason, María is requesting a loan to invest in stock and to make some improvements to the establishment. Her biggest wish is to expand her business and increase her income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business and make some improvements to her establishment.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell for her business.

Paterna has been in this business for 40 years; she earns additional income from a general store.

Paterna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is 43 years old,  and the mother of three children.  She is already a widow, and solely provides for the needs of her children. To finance their needs, she is in the vending business. She sells different kinds of vegetables through house-to-house sales; she is able to generate PHP 3,000. 

To meet the demands of her valued customers, she decided to ask for additional capital.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000,  with which she intends to buy string beans, potatoes, cabbage, onions, garlic, ginger, and squash. 

She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase string beans, potatoes, cabbage, onions, garlic, ginger, and squash

loans.name: Joselito

texts.es: Don Joselito de 45 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador. Don joselito está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía  ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Joselito is 45 years old. He lives with his life's companion and his son. He has worked in agriculture for several years. He grows corn and beans and by selling his crops, he is able to pay for his household expenses. He is a responsible, honest and hardworking man. Joselito is asking for a loan to be able to buy materials for his crop, such as fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc., as seen in the photograph. What he earns isn't enough to cover his expenses and this way he will have better income and better finances for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Lorng's Group

texts.en:
Lorng, 25, is married with two children and is residing in a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district, Cambodia. For the past several years, she has been farming rice on 1-hectares of farmland while her husband works as a paid worker. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR per day after daily expenses.

Lorng’s group consists of three members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Lorng wants to use her portion to build a latrine for her family’s use. She hopes to have a decent latrine for her family so as to better her standard of living conditions.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her family’s use

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing, rice retailing and fishing. Virginia is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional pigs, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a farmer and she is 49 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba.

To make a living, Lilia grows assorted crops (such as corn, vegetables, etc.) to sell. She has been doing this for 13 years with a monthly income of 3,600 PHP. Lilia is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer.

Lilia has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Lilia hopes that God will give her a good harvest so that she can save more for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres De Choxbajan Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Irma de estado civil casada, tiene 23 años de edad, curso 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos que no estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, inició este negocio por la necesidad de superarse económicamente y hasta la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo, comprando mas medicina natural para la venta, en el futuro desea tener un capital mas amplio para poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Irma is 23 years old, married and has 3 years of primary education. She has 2 children, who are not in school. She sells natural medicine. She started this business out of a need to get ahead financially and so far she has 7 years' experience. She has her husband's support; he is a merchant.

She is a group organizer and she is asking for a loan which she will use to increase her working capital, buying more natural medicine to sell. In the future, she wants to have more capital so she can improve her income. The other members of the group work as merchants.

loans.use: to buy and sell natural medicine.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 52 years old and married with three children.

Angelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, spices, chips, etc.

Angelita has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Angelita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, spices, chips, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Alba Yeny

texts.es:
Alba de 43 años, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad. Asegura que desde muy joven se interesó por el oficio de la confección, por lo cual decidió capacitarse e iniciar su vida laboral en un pequeño taller de su localidad. Desde hace cuatro años decidió emprender su propio negocio, ya que la empresa entró en crisis y realizó un recorte de personal en donde Alba se vio afectada. 
Hoy agradece haber atravesado esta dificultad, debido a que esto le permitió convertirse en una microempresaria, mejorando su condición económica y ofreciendo dos empleos directos en su localidad. 
En la actualidad desea ampliar y mejorar su servicio por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos y adecuaciones locativas. Sueña con garantizarle a su hijo mayor el acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en:
43-year-old Alba is a single mother with two children who are 17 and 12 years old.  She says that she became interested in sewing when she was very young and decided to train in this field.  She started her working life in a small workshop in her town.  Four years ago, she decided to set up her own business because the firm she was working for experienced difficulties, laid off some staff and Alba was directly affected.  

Alba is now grateful that she faced this difficulty because it allowed her to become a micro-businesswoman.  She has managed to improve her financial situation and offer two direct jobs to people in her town.

Alba would like to expand and improve her service, so she is requesting a loan to invest in buying supplies.  She will also make some structural improvements to her work space.  She dreams of guaranteeing that her eldest son has access to higher education.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fabric and thread) and to make some structural improvements to her work space

loans.name: Sandra Cecilia

texts.es: Sandra de 41 años de edad vive con su hija, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona de mucho comercio desde hace varios años,  tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, Sandra  desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hija lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Sandra is forty-one years old and lives with her daughter.  She is a fighting and responsible woman so that her family never lacks what is necessary for subsistence.  

Presently, she works selling food close to where she lives, in an area where there is a lot of business.  She has been doing this for several years and has  many fixed customers; she offers a good price for a plate of food.  

Sandra wishes to grow her stall by buying tables, chairs, and more basic ingredients so that she can vary her menu and have a little more income.  However, she does not have a sufficient income to cover this investment.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase the said items, and to thereby improve her profits and give her daughter everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and basic ingredients, like chicken, rice, meat, drinks, beans, etc.

loans.name: Kok's Group

texts.en:
Kok is 38 years old and married with four dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district. Kok works as a paid worker in a garment factory and her husband is a nurse in the village. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Kok is the leader of a two-person loan group. This is her group's first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Kok will use her 170,000 KHR loan to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She will need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, and other items. Kok hopes that her loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use and will improve their health and living standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a decent latrine

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy is 29 years old and married with four children. She is a villager from a rural area located in the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district. Channy is a rice farmer and her husband is a paid worker in the village. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to feed their family and meet their needs. Channy has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her previous loan that helped her improve her family’s living conditions. 

Channy is the leader of a group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy material for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile drainage, and other items. Channy hopes her loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a latrine

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 23 years old and married. For the past ten years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, laundry soap, bath soap, and other items. Angie works very hard to provide for her family.

Angie is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, laundry soap, bath soap, and other items. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, coffee, sugar, detergent, and bath soap

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is married with one child. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Bessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans through NWTF.

Bessie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, oil, sugar, soap, chips, bread, and other items for her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, oil, sugar, soap, chips, and bread

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 46, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She is the married mother of two children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family’s income comes from leasing a rice paddy of 6 hectares. She has been in this business years to make a living for 25 years. From this business, she can earn about 75,000 KHR per day.

Sokhom has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she completely repaid the first loan. With the loan from VisionFund, she successfully supported her living. She is now applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR, which she will use to pay for plowing the paddy field. With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business, thereby earning more income to fulfill her dream of opening a new grocery business.

loans.use: to plow her paddy field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Rath is 30 years and married with two children, who are still small. For the last ten years, she has been selling grocery items while her husband is a fisherman. With the current business, they can earn about 16,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Rath is just a member with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy materials to support their fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish that she can sell for a good price, thus increasing her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to support her family's fishing business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 32-year-old  married woman with four children. Her oldest child is eight and her youngest is two. Mercy is from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a motorcycle transport service and also raises hogs.  

Mercy is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed and two additional pigs. In the future, she would like to expand her business to support her family and finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pigs

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a 58-year-old widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past ten years, Estrella has run a general store in the Philippines.

Estrella is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell such as canned goods, bread, egg, noodles, and other items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bread, egg, noodles, and other items

loans.name: 33-Villa Olmos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 33-VILLA OLMOS está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones, se dedican a distintas actividades, este banco se reestructuró quedando así pocos integrantes entre ellos el Sr. Marcelino quien sigue siendo el presidente del banco por ser una persona responsable, sigue con la misma actividad que es la fabricación de muebles en su carpintería, cuenta que con el anterior crédito le fue bien ya que lo utilizo en la compra de materiales para su actividad, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, para la fabricación de muebles, el Sr. Marcelino se siente feliz y agradecido por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito, ya que está creciendo en su actividad.
texts.en:
33-Villa Olmos Communal Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men who earn their livings in a variety of jobs.  This bank was restructured and few members remained, including Marcelino.  He continues as the president of the bank because he's a responsible person.  He works in the same job, making furniture in his shop.  He says that the previous loan went well for him because he used it to buy work materials.

Now he's requesting a loan to buy wood to make furniture.

Marcelino's happy, and he's grateful for this new opportunity from the loan because he's growing in his business.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
As a teenager, Denise struggled to find an organic, mineral-based makeup that matched her individual skin-tone. After she completed her MBA program, she knew this was exactly the kind of product she wanted to create, and Real Natural Beauty was born with a mission to provide quality mineral and organic makeup designed for the multicultural woman.  

Denise’s primary goal for her business is to create a change in how we see ourselves and others. She believes strongly in the importance of self-confidence and strives to empower young women through her volunteer work and her business. As a volunteer with several middle school after-school and Young Life programs, Denise inspires and motivates young girls to realize their natural beauty, helping them discover that true beauty comes from within. 

Starting her business just last January, Denise has already experienced and overcome several challenges. One major challenge was finding local chemists, or makeup mixers, that could produce the unique color combinations needed to match and enhance the skin tones of her target market.  Through this whole process she has tried to work locally in every part of her manufacturing process, as partnering with local businesses is intrinsic to Denise’s business model.

Her $8,500 Kiva loan will enable Denise to pay for her start-up inventory and strategic marketing. Your help will also enable Denise to continue reaching out and empowering women to embrace their unique natural beauty.  

In the future, Denise hopes to develop innovative initiatives to empower women internationally, working with local and international organizations geared towards women and child development.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Denise from United States

loans.use: to pay for her start-up inventory and strategic marketing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena de 38 años de edad casada, doña Elena tiene una tienda donde vende variedad de productos como, venta de lácteos, embutidos, golosinas, aguas gaseosas, jugos,  galletas, también pastas, arroz, maíz, frijol. Doña Elena tiene ya 13 años de tener su tienda y ahora ya maneja un capital mayor. Ahora desea seguir invirtiendo y de igual manera tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ahora tiene una meta y sueño, ya que su hija estudia desea poder ahorra para su estudio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 38 years old and is married. She has a store where she sells a variety of products such as: dairy products, deli meats, candies, soft drinks, juices, biscuits, also pasta, rice, corn and beans. 

Elena has had her store for 13 years already, and she now handles a larger amount of resources. Now she would like to continue to invest in the same way to have a greater variety to offer her clients. 

She now has a goal and a dream: Her daughter studies and she would like to be able to save money for her education. 

She is requesting this loan to buy foodstuffs for daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for daily consumption to sell.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en: Primitivo is a 53-year-old widower from Talibon, Bohol. He has two grown children. He provides videoke services to customers. He has been in this business for five years. He applied for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy a mixer and additional microphones, to be able to provide his customers with the best service. In the future, Primitivo would like to expand his videoke services, in order to be successful and to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a sound mixer and  additional microphones for his videoke business.

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en:
Musarat is 46 years old and a hardworking mother of five children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and children. 

She is a very skilled woman and she is very expert in stitching dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for seven years. All the people in her area are very well satisfied and happy with her work. She provides her services at a very reasonable price, and that's why her work is increasing day by day.

Musarat, as a member of a two-person borrower group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently in less time with a new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children. In the picture Musarat is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and married. She has five children. With three children currently in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, snack foods, soft-drinks, shampoo, milk, coffee, etc. 

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 37, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband offers sheltering services. Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Rukhsana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 29-year-old energetic woman living in a remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has one child and her husband is working as a carpenter. The monthly income of her husband is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Therefore Shazia is helping her husband by doing her own business.

She has been successfully running her business of selling ornamental items for eight years.
  
Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She would purchase a large quantity and new variety of bangles, bracelets, necklaces, key chains and other ornamental items and sell them at a profit. This could increase her sales, her monthly income and her savings and she could support her family in a better way. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bangles.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional nail polish and other equipment use for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional nail polish and other equipment used for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 48 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella posee un negocio de venta de pupusas  la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores pupusas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; Margarita es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene delante de  la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, tomates, etc. margarita tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: 48-year-old Margarita lives with her husband and three children.  She has a business selling pupusas which is very well known in her town.  She has a lot of customers because she sells the best pupusas.  They are nice and warm, the service is really quick and her prices are very affordable.  Margarita is an entrepreneurial woman who has a desire to make progress in life.  She has a winning attitude and, for this reason, always stays one step ahead of the competition.  She believes that when somebody wants something they know that they must run risks.  Margarita would like to run a risk in growing her business and so she is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow her to buy corn wholesale, as well as beans, chicharrón (seasoned, shredded pork), quesillo (fresh soft cheese), tomatoes, etc. Margarita hopes that this will enable her to provide her household with financial security and provide a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, as well as beans, chicharrón (seasoned, shredded pork), fresh soft cheese, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es: Rosario de 34 años es casada con 02  hijos menores de edad, ella pertenece al  grupo “Estrellas De Fátima” la cual está conformada por 09 madres trabajadoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Rosario se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, siendo sus mayores clientes familiares  y vecinos de la zona. Anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante de   costura. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Rosario ha logrado mejorar su vivienda.  El deseo de Rosario es de poner su propio taller de costura ya que tiene conocimientos sobre ello. Su último crédito  lo destinará para la compra de productos de belleza como talcos, perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. El grupo “Estrellas De Fátima” agradece a los personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Rosario está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chompa ploma.
texts.en:
Rosario, 34, is married and has two minor children.  She belongs to Estrellas de Fátima Group, made up of nine hardworking mothers who are looking to improve every day.

Rosario makes a living selling beauty products, her major customers being family members and neighbors in the area.  Previously she worked as a sewing assistant.  Rosario has managed to improve her house with the fruit of her effort.  Rosario wants to set up her own sewing workshop because she has knowledge of the work.

She will invest this latest loan in buying beauty products such as talcum powder, perfume, creams, and costume jewelry to sell to her customers.

Estrellas de Fátima Group thanks the people who made this loan possible.

Rosario's the second from the left in the back, wearing a gray sweater.

loans.use: to buy talcum powder, perfume, creams, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is married and has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 55 years old and has two children who are in school. Carmelita has a candy-making business in the Philippines. Carmelita applied for a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Carmelita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Nazreen

texts.en:
Nazreen has been doing tailoring work for 10 years and she has excellent tailoring skills. 

A loan of 20,000 PKR would help Nazreen to to get a new sewing machine for her daughter so that she could help her in her work. 

With the help of her daughter, she would be able to stitch more dresses, resulting in an increase in her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is very happy with her Kiva loan because with it she was able to buy materials to make her artisan crafts. She sold her craft work, satisfying her customers' needs. 

Now Abida is dedicating all her attention to her son and her business as she is no longer working for another business. She is happy with this because she is able to give other unemployed people the opportunity to earn an income. 

Abida sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the loan. It has benefited my family and me greatly." 

Abida is currently applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy artisan materials like stones, quartz, glass, beads, needles, laces, clothes  wire, small pieces of wood, glue, and paint.

loans.use: To buy artisan materials like stones, quartz, glass, beads, etc.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 59-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, three daughters and two sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2003, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that his wife, Razia, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store like flour, sugar, pulses and detergent to satisfy his clients more professionally, as well as to increase his net income. Razia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase general store items.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jerlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending and raising livestock. Jerlyn is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, sardines, soap, spices, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

Jerlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, sardines, soap, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira, 30 years old, is a hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and three daughters. All of her children are studying in school. She and her husband have owned a fast food business for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Now, for the further growth of their business, Saira has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some crockery and chairs for the restaurant. As their family expenditures are much higher as compared to their monthly income and savings, she therefore wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount. As a result of this, they can increase their monthly income as well as savings. 

She dreams for the higher education of her children, and she is very much thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and crockery for the restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es: Doña maria de 50 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella es una mujer  muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, doña maria desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María, 50, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her children.  She's a very responsible woman whose main priority is to get her two children ahead.

She has a tortilla business in her house where she makes tortillas every afternoon and evening.  María very much wants to be able to improve her business because it gives her very stable profits that allow her to support her family.

This is why she's requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime so she can make tortillas in quantity, especially on the weekend.  This is when her demand increases, because other tortilla shops are closed and she can get better profits to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 38-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons. Her husband and both of her sons are running a car decoration and spare parts shop. This is the only source of income for her family. 

Currently they are facing many problems in business as the current stock of car accessories is almost finished and they have no funds available to purchase more stock. 

Gulzar has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business and purchase a new variety of car accessories and decoration kits like engine parts, alloy rims, car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights, etc. With the profit amount she is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son and for the expansion of their business. She is very hopeful that the loan would be productive one for them and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories and spare parts.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 49 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives is Dalumpinas, Sapang Dalaga.

To make a living, Consolacion is enagaged in buying and selling bananas. She has had this business for six years, earning a monthly income of 4,200 PHP. 

Consolacion has been a member of Paglaum MPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase 1,000 kilos of raw bananas.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a businesswoman who lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She is 29 years old, married, and has five children. 

To make a living, Alfreda has a shop that sells grocery items. She has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of 3,200 PHP. 

Alfreda is requesting a new loan to purchase additional stocks to sell such as five boxes of assorted groceries. Alfreda has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2006.

loans.use: To purchase five boxes of assorted groceries.

loans.name: Nodari

texts.en:
Nodari is 32 years old. He lives in Gurjaani District with his wife and pensioner mother. Nodari requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nodari works as a fitter at a local cable TV company, and his mother works as a baker locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nodari requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Nodari has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Nodari will open a bakery. After the bakery is opened, they will be able to bake Georgian bread for selling. As his mother has a rich experience in this field, Nodari thinks that the business will be profitable. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items like eggs, noodles, cream soap, etc., to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Letecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like eggs, noodles, cream soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is a 28-year-old married woman who has 12 children. She lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she owns and manages a farm, growing vegetables for sale. She's been in this business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, she joined GDMPC and gained access to microfinance services. She recently applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional seedlings and fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to expand her garden in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer, such as manure, for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en: Originally from a rural village in Kandal Province’s Ponhea Leur district, Channy is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by farming rice, to feed and support her family members. Her husband complements her income by working as a paid worker in the local area. Having been in business for almost ten years, they are able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 6,000 each day for their future needs. Channy is a first cycle client with VisionFund. She is leading her group of five to apply for a loan of 170,000 KHR each. As the leader, Channy will use her portion to buy materials to build a decent latrine, including a latrine bowl, tile draining and sewage. She hopes this loan will enable the family to have a healthy latrine, so as to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a decent latrine, including a latrine bowl, tile draining and sewage.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive tiene un hijo de 1 año y vive con su papa y su mama en casa propia, es muy conocido en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicado  a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que lo buscan y lo prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que el cliente  solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: The client has a one-year-old son and lives with his father and mother in his own home. He is well-known in the area where he lives because of his humility and his dedication to his work. He has never allowed himself to be defeated and he has always moved forward with his difficulties. With effort and dedication, he has a store in which he sells basic goods, like basic grains, milk, eggs, and rice, among other things. He is very dedicated to his work and very attentive when he sells. This is why he has customers who seek him out and prefer him because of his products. He needs to stock his store a little more due to increased demand and he doesn't have the capital to do it. This is why the client is applying for a loan to buy more products like basic grains, instant goods, candies, drinks, etc. He trusts in God that the help he has asked for will be delivered soon, and he will not have any more worries about bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant goods, candies, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Los Eucaliptos Group

texts.es: Dúo los Eucaliptos, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Elida Bricelda de 34 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo diario, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, esta muy contenta porque con el credito anterior ella pudo surtir un poco mas su tienda, y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario para la venta,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Dúo los Eucaliptos (Eucalyptus Duo). This group is made up of Elida Bricelda, age 34. She sells everyday edible goods. She has worked in this business for several years. She is very happy because with the previous loan she was able to stock her store a little more. This is why she is asking for this loan: to buy everyday foodstuffs to sell. She hopes that you all can help her with the loan she has applied for.

loans.use: to buy everyday foodstuffs.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Don nelson de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, don nelson necesita invertir en insumos pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. el está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Nelson, 43, lives with his wife and two children in his own home. He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and sorghum. He has worked in this sector for many years and he has gained valuable experience, which lets him get better harvests. The land where he grows is located in an agricultural area. He trades in all the nearby areas and has many loyal customers. These people always prefer his product because it is quality and at affordable prices. Nelson needs to invest in supplies, but he doesn't have enough capital. This is why he is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, tools, etc. He is sure that he will be able to pay off his loan on time, and he is also confident that he will be able to give his family the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Catalina applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell. Catalina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is a 49-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. She engage in making “panggal” (crab traps). She makes crab traps out of bamboo. Her husband is a farmer. His income would not be enough by itself for the family. Saturnina applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy bamboo and nipa palm, to produce more crab traps. In the future, Saturnina would like to invest in other businesses to be able to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and nipa palm to use in making "pangal" (crab traps).

loans.name: Saba

texts.en: Saba is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother to her three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. For this reason, Saba has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Saba is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: Wendy, es casada una joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante, con mucho sacrificio pudo terminar sus estudios de enfermería con la ayuda de sus padres, hoy en día continua siendo su medio de trabajo, el crédito que solicita es para continuar invirtiendo en su hogar en esta ocasión necesita levantar una pared de la parte trasera de la vivienda, ya que la zona donde habita hay mucha delincuencia y para el bienestar de la familia se requiere hacer esta mejora.
texts.en: Wendy is a young married women with a great desire to succeed. With great sacrifice and the help of her parents she was able to finish her nursing studies. She still works as a nurse. She will use this loan to continue to invest in her home. She needs to raise a wall in the back of the home, since there is a lot of crime in her neighbourhood. For the sake of her family's well-being, she needs to make this improvement.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising livestock. Elvira is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable-vending business. Elvira has been maintaining her business activities with her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham Province, Vann is 58 years old and married. She and her husband have eight children. They earn a living by farming rice and planting cassava, and they have been in this business for 39 years. They complement their farm income by buying and selling cows and buffaloes in the village. With Vann’s current business, she is able to earn approximately 31,000 KHR per day to support her family. This is the first loan for Vann from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for her farm and will use a portion of it to buy cows for resale. She hopes to make better crop yields and sell for good prices, so as to improve her life style.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Donato

texts.es: El Sr. Donato tiene 53 años,  el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Palmira, tambien se dedica a la ganaderia, este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Donato va a utilizar  este préstamo para los gastos que implica la cosecha de papa  y lo que implica el transporte a los distintos mercados de venta,  sus productos los comercializa directamente del productor al consumidor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siguiente siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Donato enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Donato is 53 years old.  He works as a farmer, planting a variety of vegetables, such as potato, yucca, and corn, on his farm land.  The land is located in the community of Palmira.  He also raises livestock.  

This loan is his first with this institution.  Donato will use this loan to pay the costs of harvesting potatoes and transporting them to different markets for sale.  He sells his products directly to the consumer.  He wants to request this loan to obtain resources for the next planting and so he can support himself.  

Donato encounters challenges in his business such as bad weather, which on many occaisons ruins his crops.  He will use the benefits of the loan to improve his family's quality of life since he is responsible for all of the household expenses.  He is a responsible and hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to meet the costs of harvesting potatoes.

loans.name: Ruizan

texts.en:
Ruizan is 55 years old. She lives in a small village in Akhali Samgori, Gardabani district with her husband and son. Ruizan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family is out of their source of income at the moment.

Ruizan requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ruizan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Ruizan will start trading with clothes. She wants to purchase products at the wholesale price and resell them with the price markup among the villagers to earn some income for the family. Ruizan will work as hard as she can to make her business successful to provide a better life for her husband and son.

loans.use: To start trading with clothes

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Doña Marta de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija y su nieto, ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos lácteos queso, crema, requesón, etc. y también de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtienen logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Marta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas productos por mayor y seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marta, 64 years old, lives in her own house with her husband, her daughter and her grandson.  She has a business selling dairy products like cheese, cream, cottage cheese, etc. and also basic grains.  With the earnings that she obtains she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  

Marta is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more wholesale products and continue with her business since that is her only source of work and in this way she can give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more cheese, cream and fresh cheese wholesale.

loans.name: German

texts.es: Don german de 52 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, don german  necesita invertir en insumos pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. el está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
German, 52 years old, lives with his family in his own home. 

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of corn and beans. He has been working in this field for many years and has gained a lot of valuable experience which allows him to obtain the best crops.

The land he cultivates is located in an agricultural sector. He sells in all the surrounding areas and has many regular clients. These people always prefer his products because of the quality and the really affordable prices.

German needs to invest in supplies but does not have sufficient funds for this so he is asking Integral for a loan to permit him to buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. He is sure that he can pay off the debt on time and at the same time he has confidence that he can give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es: Jose de 39 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol.  José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 39 year old José is a very responsible man who supports his home, he has always been described as providing the best for his children. Today he lives with his spouse and two children. He is very hard working and is always happy and enthusiastic. He is a farmer and every year plants basic grains such as corn and beans in his fields. José wishes to increase his sales and therefore he visited the INTEGRAL offices to ask for a loan which will permit him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and other supplies. He hopes to count on the help from the loan since he doesn't have any other monetary income, and with it he will be able to provide for his family's daily needs without any worry.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Doña socorro de 67 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena  comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. doña socorro  tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Socorro is 67 years old and lives with her husband and son in her own home. She has a store where she sells basic needs items, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. She has had her business for many years and this has given her sales experience that allows her to have the best profits. Her store is located in her home in a high traffic area, she has many customers as she has a well-stocked store. Her customers prefer her store and they keep her ahead of the competition because she always has quality products at accessible prices and unequal service according to her customer's needs. As all good businessmen she wants to grow her business and make a new investment but she needs capital so she asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, candy, eggs, bread, beverages, etc. Doña Socorro has good payment references and assures that she will comply with the loan, and is confident that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de sus 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Leonora se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de 2 hectáreas , dentro de los cuales posee una buena cantidad de árboles cacaoteros además de  achiote y palillo. Tiene también algunos árboles frutales como coco, plátanos y demás frutos que vende en las ferias dominicales de la ciudad y le permite obtener ganancias adicionales.Fertiliza sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico , el cual compra al por mayor y a bajos precios pues considera que es una buena forma de obtener frutos de mejor calidad.En la anterior campaña ha notado que tiene varios árboles de cacao que están desfasados y no pueden dar frutos, es por ello que necesita comprar plantas de almácigo para reemplazarlos y mantener sus parcelas produciendo constantemente.
Uno de sus principales objetivos es mejorar su vivienda y construirlo con ladrillos y cemento para mejorar su calida de vida.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y espera contar el apoyo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante.Desea en esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar plantas de almácigo y reemplazar las plantaciones desfasadas de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Leonora is 54 years old.  She is a single mother to two children who live in her home made from adobe.  Leonora works as a farmer on her 2 hectacres of land where she has a quantity of cocoa trees as well as achiote and turmeric.  She also has some fruit trees such as coconut, banana, and other fruits that she sells at the Sunday markets in the city.  This allows her to earn additional income.  She maintains her land with organic fertilizer, which she purchases at wholesale for a low price since she believes it is a good way to obtain better quality fruit.  

In the last season, she noticed that she has some cocoa trees that are not able to give fruit any longer.  She wants to purchase copperwood plants to replace them and keep her land producing constantly.  

One of her main objectives is to improve her home and build it with bricks and cement to improve her quality of life.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she hopes to have the necessary financial support to move forward.  She is requesting 1000 nuevos soles to purchase copperwood plants to replace the old plants on her land.

loans.use: to purchase copperwood plants.

loans.name: Jimson

texts.en:
Jimson is a 22-year-old, married man with two children, who lives in San Juan Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, he owns and manages his farm planting bananas, fruit trees, and root crops to sell. He has been doing this for three years, earning PHP 5,000 a month. 

Jimson recently borrowed an amount of PHP 10,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. He plans to cultivate the entire farm in order to generate more income for a better future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa es una joven de 21 años , esta casada y tiene una hija de 2 años con quien vive en una casa construida a base de adobe.Clarisa se dedica a la agricultura junto a su pareja , primero se iniciaron como trabajadores ya que no tenian dinero suficiente para comprar un terreno agrícola pero hace 2 años usaron los ahorros que tenían hasta entonces y lograron comprar media hectárea de cultivo. Afortunadamente el terreno que compraron tenía plantaciones de cacao y eso les permitió obtener sus primeras ganancias fácilmente.Cuando llega la época de cosecha contrata a trabajadores del lugar para que lo ayuden en la recolección de los frutos para luego ofrecerlo en el mercado de su localidad.Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir todos sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Clarisa is a young woman, 21 years old.  She is married and she has a 2-year-old daughter with whom she lives in a house built out of adobe.  Clarisa works in agriculture together with her partner.  They began at first as workers since they didn’t have enough money to buy some farm land but two years ago they used the savings that they had up until that time and they managed to buy half a hectare for cultivating.  Fortunately the land that they bought had plantings of cacao and that allowed them to obtain their first earnings easily.  When harvest season comes she hires local workers to assist them in gathering the fruits to offer later in their local market.  

This is the second loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she has received in order to continue to get ahead.  On this occasion she wants to have 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy organic fertilizer and nourish all of her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo” SAN MARTIN” está conformado por 7 socios trabajadoras  quienes se encuentran contentos por estar pasando el segundo ciclo. Lucila tiene 55 años es soltera con un hijo aun educando. Lucila se dedica  a la venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en paradero de San Bartolomé  hace varios de esta manera a podido solventar los gastos de la educación de su menor hijo. En sus tiempos libres vende productos de belleza. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva cocina a  gas. Su mayor deseo es implementar  su restaurant. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Lucila es la primera del lado derecho
texts.en: The group ”SAN MARTIN” consists of 7 hardworking members who find themselves content in their second loan cycle. Lucila is 55 years old, single, with a son in school. Lucila sells food from a food cart on San Bartolomé. With this income she has been able to pay her youngest son's education expenses. In her free time she sells beauty products. The loan will be used to purchase a new gas kitchen stove. Her greatest wish is to open a restaurant. The group appreciates the KIVA investors in their loan. Lucila is the first person on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new gas kitchen stove

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 55-year-old, hard-working and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and six children. Only two of her children are going to school because of the financial constraints since Rabia can’t afford the educational expenses of all. Her husband is a wood cutter by profession and he has a very low monthly income.

Rabia is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for seven years. Her clients are very satisfied with her work. 

Rabia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center and needs to purchase two new sewing machines. 

She would reinvest part of the profit in her business and part of it to pay the educational expenses. She desires to send all of her children to school. Rabia is very hopeful that the loan would be a progressive one for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two new sewing machines for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband owns a restaurant which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase furniture for the restaurant. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing furniture. This will help him to attract more customers by offering a comfortable environment.

 With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to purchase a variety of vegetables and chicken for the restaurant. Razia is sincerely thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and rice retailing. 

Lilia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods, such as coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods, such as coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn works hard to support her family. Cerelyn is married and has a native bag-making business in the Philippines.

Cerelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for making native bags. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

Cerelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making native bags

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El socio Mario nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 58  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y también a la crianza de animales menores, él requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, él está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mario was born in Pilco – Grande and still lives there. He is 58 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He has seven children. Mario works in agriculture, raising cattle and other small farm animals.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He feels happy with this loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

(The community of Pilco – Grande is located in the Hauyllabamba district in Paucartambo, a province of the Department of Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta of Dinas, Sinacaban Misamis Occidental is 56 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer, and she also has a garden, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She borrowed the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to finance the costs of land preparation for gardening. 

Violeta has been a GDMPC member for five years and it helps her a lot in terms of technical and financial services. She wants to save a portion of her income as a reserve fund for her future.

loans.use: to finance land preparation for gardening

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 51-year-old married woman and an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of clothes selling for almost 12 years. She purchase clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market, at profitable amounts. 

Nasreen is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. Her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. 

To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan of 45,000pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend the part of profits on the improvement of her house. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in different varieties

loans.name: Chhoern's Group

texts.en:
Chhoern is aged 45 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, and she has seven children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been in rice farming for 22 years earns about 25,000KHR per day. 

Chhoern’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chhoern will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and all four children are in school.

Dona is in the agricultural business, buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. Dona requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.

Dona has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
