El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey está en el ciclo número 23 del programa de comité de mujeres, conformada por 15 mujeres muy activas; las mismas trabajan siempre con mucho dinamismo y unidad.
La Sra. Arminda Presidenta del grupo tiene la labor de guiarlas siempre de forma a mantener la unidad del grupo para poder darle a su familia todo lo que necesita para tener una vida digna.
Ella tiene una pequeña despensa en la que trabaja día a día desde muy tempranas horas el día, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Solicita de este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de insumos de todo tipo para surtir su negocio, como ser bebidas, comestibles, verduras y demás insumos para tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey group is in its 23rd cycle of the women’s committee program.  It is comprised of 15 very active women.  They always work in a very dynamic and unified way.

Arminda is the president of the group.  She has the job of guiding them in order to always keep the group united.  She does this in order to give her family all that they need to have a decent life.

She has a small store.  She works there, day to day, starting in the early hours of the day.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising person.

She is requesting this loan to buy all types of supplies to stock her business.  She will buy drinks, foodstuffs, vegetables, and other supplies in order to  be able to offer her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to  buy drinks, foodstuffs, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Joji

texts.en: Joji is married and a mother of three children. She is 50 years old. She lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. Joji sells dried fish. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns a monthly income of 3,400 PHP. Joji has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase three boxes of dried fish to sell. Joji has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.

loans.use: To purchase three boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Djiguignouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  riz  avec  TENEKOURA , premiere personne assise de la gauche vres la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 95.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguignouma II group are all married women. They have an average age of 50, an average of four children each, and all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, a village located in Sanankoroba, the second-largest administrative region in Mali. They all collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all their previous loans were repaid without incident.

These women work growing rice, and one of the members of the group is Tenekoura. She is the first person seated from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor needed to farm her 1.5 hectares of land. After harvest she sells her produce in a market in the village of Bougoula, and her customers are both resellers and individual consumers.

loans.use: To pay for labor expenses and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Zulfira

texts.ru: Зулфира добрая и отзывчивая женщина в возрасте 32 лет. Она прекрасная жена для своего мужа. Муж тоже любит и ценит её. Пока они не имеют детей, но очень мечтают о них. Живут они в маленьком посёлке. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на проживание Зулфира занимается своим бизнесом. Она дехканка, выращивает картофель, а потом продаёт полученный урожай и получает хороший доход. У неё есть своя площадь земли  для посева картофеля, площадь составляет 1 га. Муж Зулфиры помогает ей в этом деле, когда приходит пора собирать и продавать урожай, он организовывает эту работу. Также для получения дополнительного дохода, они выращивают скот. У них есть несколько голов скота. Зулфира по утрам сама доит корову и продаёт полученное молоко соседям. В данное время Зулфира с мужем хотят увеличить свой доход, так как в ближайшем будущем мечтают о ребёнке и для этого нужно подготовить благоприятные условия в их доме. Поэтому они хотят увеличить объём своего урожая и нуждаются в денежных средствах, чтобы закупить семяна для посева картофеля. Для этого Зулфира обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит для закупа семян. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zulfira is a kind and understanding 32 year-old woman.  She is a beautiful wife for her husband.  Her husband also loves and values her.  While they do not yet have children, they dream of having them.  They live in a small village.  Zulfira is involved in her own business to provide a consistent income for living.  She is a dekhan farmer, who grows potatoes and then sells the harvest and earns a good income.  She has her own land for planting potatoes; the size of the land is 1 hectare.  Zulfira's husband helps her with this business.  When it is time to gather and sell the harvest, he organizes this work.  They also raise livestock to earn additional income.  They have several heads of livestock.  Zulfira milks the cow by herself in the mornings and sells the milk to her neighbors.  At the present time, Zulfira and her husband want to increase their income because they dream of having a child in the near future and need to set up favorable conditions in their home.  This is why they want to increase the volume of their harvest and need money to purchase seeds for planting potatoes.  Zulfira came to Arvand for this purpose and wished to obtain a loan to buy seeds.  She thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting potatoes

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquinga  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay de Curiquinga, está formado por 9 mujeres quienes a diario laboran para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares y sacar delante de sus hijos, se dedican a varias actividades algunas laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca pero también  crían animales o se dedican a la agricultura, mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias de este banco comunal se reúnen en el sector de Maluay en Cuenca lugar que goza de exuberante vegetación y un clima frió, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Sandra tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha procreado 7 hijos, tres estudian en un colegio de la localidad, dos están estudiando en una escuelita y sus dos últimos hijos aun pequeños y pasan en casa. Su esposo se dedica al área de la construcción laborando como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia. 

La Señora. María Sandra se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidar afanosamente a sus hijos, también trabaja en el campo sembrando y criando animales. Esta actividad aprendió de sus padres y poco a poco fue haciendo su estilo de vida y ahora le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la construcción de un  galpón para pollos del cual ha sacado mucho provecho. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que quiere comprar pollos, cerdos y cuyes para continuar creciendo en esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
The communal bank Maluay de Curiquinga, consists of 9 women who work daily to improve the stability of their homes and the ability for their children to get ahead in life. They do various activities for a living. Some work in the city of Cuenca but they also raise animals or are in agriculture. They keep alive the culture and traditions of their people. The members of this communal bank meet in the sector Maluay en Cuenca where they enjoy lush greenery and a cool climate. Its architecture is a mix of old and new.

One of the members of this group, María Sandra, is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. Three study in the local school, two are in elementary school and the last two are young and stay at home. Her husband does construction, working as a mason for a living. The house that they live in is their own.

María Sandra does household chores and diligently cares for her children. She also works in the fields farming and raising animals. She learned this trade from her parents and little by little was making this her lifestyle and it now allows her to cover her household costs.

The funds for her previous loan were invested in the construction of a chicken coup  which was very beneficial. This round she is requesting a credit to purchase chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs to continue growing in this economic activity.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Las Marias está en su quinto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de las miembros.
Una persona muy trabajadora es Eva, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Comenta que al principio le fue un poco difícil, pero que después poco a poco fue ganando clientela y confianza y de esa forma hoy en día ya es una buena microempresaria. Ella lucha y se esfuerza por mejorar sus ingresos y así ser mejor cada día.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de diferentes marcas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, atraer a más clientes y seguir trabajando. Ellas agradecen por esta oportunidad que estan recibiendo, pues les será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Marias" is in its 5th loan cycle in the Women's Committee Program of Fundación Paraguaya.  The members are taking the poverty elimination survey to understand the situation of each one of the members.

Eva is a very hardworking person who has a business selling cosmetics.  She states that at first it was a little difficult, but over time she gradually attracted customers and gained confidence, becoming the good small businesswoman that she is today.  She works hard and struggles to increase her income and improve each day.

Eva is requesting this loan to invest in cosmetics from a variety of brands.  This way, she can continue with her sales, attract more customers, and continue working.  The members of this group are grateful for this opportunity that they are receiving, because it will be a great help to them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Samart is 38 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are still school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 10 years. The current business earns them about 34,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day, and they manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Samart has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans, all of which have helped her make her living better. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Samart wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make a canoe for his business.

loans.name: Ndiawar

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiawar est un homme agé de 33ans qui habite aux environs du guichet. IL est marié et père de famille; Ndiawar évolue dans le commerce de pièces détachées depuis plus de 6ans , il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Il prend en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais scolaires des ses enfants. Il sollicite ce pret d'un montant de 500 000F pour acheter des pièces détachées qu'il revende à ses clients.A l'avenir il souhaite ouvrir un grand magasin de pièces détachées et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Ndiawar is a 33-year-old man who lives close to the local branch of this microfinance institution. He is married and a father, and has worked selling spare parts for more than six years. He starts work at 8 am, and finishes his day at 6 pm.

Ndiawar is responsible for his family’s daily expenses and the cost of his children’s education. He has requested this loan of 500,000 francs to buy spare parts, which he will resell to his customers. In the future, he would like to open a large spare parts store. He also wants to increase his income, so that he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Mingueras Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Mingueras Solidarias lleva por nombre este grupo de Ciudad del Este, se formo con 14 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas del barrio, están en su sexto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres y también están haciendo la encuentra de eliminación de pobreza, que les permite conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Dorila es la única que según la encuesta esta con un nivel de ingresos muy bajos, ella es consciente que la única forma de crecer es por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo, es por eso que está poniendo todo de sí. Ella es ama de casa, pero esta emprendiendo el negocio de la venta de comidas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos, harina, y demás insumos para poder empezar a emprender en su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
"Mingueras Solidarias" is the name of this communal bank from Ciudad del Este.  The group consists of 14 women who are all friends and neighbors from the same area.  They are in their 6th loan cycle in the Committee of Women program in the Fundacion Paraguaya.  The members are taking the poverty elimination survey to understand the situation of each one of the members.

Dorila is the only one who, according to the survey, is at a very low level of income.  She is aware that the only way to see growth is through her efforts and hard work, and so for this reason she is putting everything she has into her work.  She is a housewife, but she is also starting up a business selling food.  She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, flour, and other supplies she needs to start up her business and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, flour, and other supplies

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
This is Felina. She previously accessed a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) that she used buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of school supplies. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Felina hopes that her business will grow and that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for office and school supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 33-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has a clothing business. With the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and to promptly provide basic needs to his family. The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and set up sustainable income generating activities for each of them. Unpredictable customer preferences coupled with inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business growth. His dream is to own a modern boutique.

Moses intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a repair shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials and equipment for her repair shop business.

Nelly has been in this business for 17 years. Nelly earns additional income from a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Choijkhuu

texts.en: Mrs. Choijkhuu, 36 years old, lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They reside in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a noodle packer at a noodle factory since 2011. Her son goes to high school and is currently in seventh grade. She divorced her husband seven years ago. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, foam, and planks. As a result, she and her son can live in a comfortable and warm house after repairing and insulating their house using those materials. The renovated house will reduce their coal consumption and release fewer pollutants into the air, contributing to efforts to reduce air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma  tiene 22 años es soltera, es de la ciudad de Lambaré, comenta que tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad donde confecciona y vende prendas de vestir para damas, y demás tipos.
Irma se dedica a la costura desde el año 2005 y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás, y con ello seguir con su producción. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante para poder crecer.
Agradece por la oportunidad que ella está recibiendo, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Irma, age 22, is single and from the city of Lambaré. She says that she has a shop in the central part of town where she sews and sells women’s clothing and other types of garments.

Irma has been sewing since 2005 and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other items so that she can continue her production. She is a very hardworking young woman who wants to move forward so that she can grow. Irma appreciates the opportunity she has received since it will allow her to continue growing and improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other items.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
8 de diciembre se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Caaguazú, ellas son madres que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y mostró que 8 miembros tienen un ingreso muy bajo.
Maria, una de las miembros,  quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, está consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo mejorara su situación de pobreza. Ella por medio de la venta de comestibles está tratando de salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende, como ser verduras, carne, huevo, harina, queso y demás, esta agradecida ya que esta ayuda le será muy provechosa a todo el grupo.
texts.en:
The December 8th group is made up of neighbours from the town of Caaguizú. They are all mothers who want to help their families by working together. They are part of a research project seeking to make poverty a thing of the past. Each of the women has shown to have a very small income.

One of the group members is Maria. In the last survey she was shown to be at Level 1 poverty, that is at a very low income level. She is aware that through effort and hard work she will be able to improve her poverty level. Maria sells groceries and through her job is trying to get ahead and improve her own and her family's standard of living. 

Maria is seeking a loan to buy more food products such as vegetables, meat, eggs, flour, cheese etc. She is grateful as this financial assistance is very beneficial to all members of the group.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, meat, eggs, flour, cheese etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines for 15 years, earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear products to sell.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorielice

texts.en:
Lorielice is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorielice is 29 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lorielice has a native bag making business in the Philippines. Lorielice requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for making native bags.

Lorielice has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lorielice would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making native bags.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
This is Sally, a 40-year-old resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a pedicab driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sally operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

Sally is requesting a Php 25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Sally dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pora  está en su Primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer los ingresos de cada una de ellas.
Aurelia es vendedora de ropas, siempre tiene muy buena clientela porque tiene todo tipo de prendas, es muy buena vendedora, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona que quiere luchar y trabajar por su familia.
Comenta además que su meta es poder tener una gran tienda de prendas para poder seguir con sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de jeans, remeras, pantalones, camisas y demás, para que de esa forma siga con sus ventas y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Pora is in its first cycle for this group of women, where everyone is committed to working and to helping each other to be successful. They are taking part in a survey on the elimination of poverty in order to understand what each of them earns. 

Aurelia sells clothing, she always has a good clientele because she has all kinds of clothing, and she is a good saleswoman, which is why she is doing well. She defines herself as someone who wants to fight and work for her family. 

She comments that her goal is to be able to have a large clothing store where she will be able to continue with her sales and to improve her earnings. She is asking for this credit in order to purchase jeans, T-shirts, pants, shirts and other items so that she can continue with her sales and improve her earnings.

loans.use: purchase jeans, T-shirts, pants, shirts and other items to sell.

loans.name: Eddy Pablo

texts.es:
Eddy nació en la ciudad de Colquepata pero vive en la ciudad de Huancarani, él tiene 23 años pero aun no tiene hijos. 

Eddy es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica es la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, roperos y otros más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como madera, clavos y cola. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(Las ciudades de Colquepata y Huancarani son distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Eddy was born in the city of Colquepata, but he lives in Huancarani. He is 23 years old and does not have any children yet.

Eddy is an enterprising and hardworking young man who moves ahead with effort and dedication. His business activity is making wooden furniture, such as tables, chairs, closets, and more. He has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He belongs to the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank. He needs this loan to buy work materials such as wood, nails, and glue. He is grateful for and appreciates this loan, and he is committed to paying his monthly installments.

(The cities of Colquepata and Huancarani are districts in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy work materials such as wood, nails, and glue.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Rory es de la Ciudad de Santaní, de una de las zonas alejadas, que luchan por crecer y salir adelante, se encuentra en el 1º ciclo y está integrada por 18 señoras, ellas saben que viven en lugares muy distantes, pero quieren que algún día puedan mejorar las condiciones de su barrio y comunidad.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elva, quien se dedica a la cría, faena y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás, y por medio de ese trabajo esta ayudando a su familia teniendo y procurando los ingresos para ellos. Como es una zona rural les es más difícil todo, pero está luchando por salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory communal bank is from the city of Santaní, from one of the remote areas. The members fight to grow and move forward. The group is in its first cycle and is made up of eighteen women. They know that they live in very distant areas, but they hope that someday they will be able to improve the conditions of their neighborhood and community.

One of these members is Elva, who makes a living by raising, slaughtering, and selling farm animals, such as chickens, pigs, goats, and others. By means of this work, she is helping her family by bringing in an income for them. Since she lives in a rural area, everything is more difficult, but she is fighting to move forward.

She is applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of animal feed so that she can continue with her work, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
Bruno es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es un joven con muchas ansias de salir adelante y ser un profesional exitoso, el esta estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, en una de las mejores universidades del País. Cuenta que su mayor objetivo es poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios, para poder retribuirles todo lo que hicieron por el.
Su mama es quien lo inspira, por ser ella una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se esforzó para ayudarlo. Bruno solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma le será un poco menos pesada su carrera. agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Bruno is a young man from the town of San Ignacio. He is very keen to get ahead and become a successful professional. He is studying Business Administration at one of the best universities in the country. His main objective is to be able to help his family through his studies by giving back to them what they have done for him.

It is his mother who inspires Bruno. She is a very hardworking person who always made an effort to help him. Bruno is seeking a loan to pay for his university courses which will then be a little less onerous for him. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: Pay for university courses

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta casada y cuenta que tiene una despensa en la que trabaja desde el año 2004. Cuenta que empezaron ella y su esposo con un pequeño capital que el tuvo de argentina cuando fue a trabajar. El Marido de la Sra. Juana se dedica a ser taxista, y cuenta que con este trabajo dio a sus hijos la crianza que necesitaba y hoy ya son profesionales.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante y ayudar a su marido con los gastos del día a día. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para abastecer su despensa con comestibles, bebidas, verduras, frutas y demás. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Juana is from the city of San Lorenzo. She is married and says that she has a small grocery store, in which she has been working since 2004. She says that she and her husband started up with a small amount of capital that he had from Argentina when he went there to work. Juana's husband is a taxi driver, and with this work he gave their children the upbringing they needed. Today, they are professionals.

She is a very hardworking woman who fights to move forward and help her husband with their day-to-day expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy supplies to stock her store with groceries, drinks, vegetables, fruit, and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, vegetables, fruit, and others.

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Teresa está en su Cuarto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, esta integrado por 15 señoras, pero esta vez solo 14 de ellas solicitan el crédito. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y arrojo que 2 señoras están con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Salvadora, quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella cuenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras, y les anima a que vayan creciendo. Ella por su parte se dedica a la costura y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela con quien siempre cumple con muy buenos trabajos y con eso ayuda a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en telas, ya que quiere poder cumplir siempre con los pedidos de sus clientes, también agradece por esta oportunidad que fundación paraguaya y Kiva les da.
texts.en:
The Santa Teresa group is in its fourth cycle of the Women's Committee Program. It is made up of fifteen women, but only fourteen of them are applying for this loan. They are participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey to understand the situation of each one of them. The survey showed that two women have a very low income.

One of the members is Salvadora, who is the group's president. She says that she always tries to motivate her fellow members, encouraging them to grow. She makes a living in dressmaking, and she says that she has a very good clientele. She always fulfills her orders with very good work, and she is able to help her family by means of her income.

She is applying for this loan to invest in fabric, because she always wants to be able to fulfill her clients' orders. She is also grateful for this opportunity which Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva are giving the group.

loans.use: to buy fabric for dressmaking.

loans.name: Labani

texts.es: Labani tiene 31 años de edad. Tiene un pequeña tienda de venta de celulares, MP3, Chip, accesorios para celulares como estuches, forros, displays, carcasas, SIM CARDS, audífonos, protectores, películas protectoras, y otros accesorios como parlantes, antenas, brazaletes, cable hdani, cables de datos; también presta servicio técnico de reparación de celulares, instalación de los accesorios que vende y  recargas de minutos de operadores de telefonía celular del País. Vive en la linda Bogotá, capital de la República de Colombia, con su conyugue y un hijo de 11 meses de nacido. Desde hace siete años comenzó con esta tienda, aprovechando la oportunidad y el auge que ha tenido la revolución de las comunicaciones con la constante innovación en los modelos de las diferentes marcas de celulares y sus accesorios, y aplicaciones. Tiene un punto de venta que ha logrado acreditarse en el sector donde opera, manteniendo un nivel de ventas que le permite dar sostenibilidad a los gastos familiares. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de nuevos modelos de celulares y accesorios para los mismos, aumentando el surtido para ofrecer un excelente servicio a sus clientes, y así, seguir aumentando las ventas, para que un plazo mediano pueda establecer otro punto de venta.
texts.en: Labani is 31 years old.  She has a small store where she sells cell phones, MP3 players, chips, and cell phone accessories, such as cases, covers, displays, SIM cards, headphones, protectors, screen protectors, and other accessories, such as loudspeakers, antennas, bracelets, HDMI cables, and data cables.  She also offers technical repair services for cell phones, installation of the accessories she sells, and minute reloads for the country's cell phone companies.  She lives in the city of Bogotá, capital of the Republic of Colombia, with her partner and their 11-month-old son.  She opened her store seven years ago, taking advantage of the opportunity and the growth of the communications revolution, with its constant innovation in the models offered by different cell phone brands and their accessories and applications.  She has a point-of-sale that has become a fixture where she does business and she has maintained a level of sales that has allowed her to cover her household expenses.  This is her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy new models of cell phones and accessories to go with them.  This will increase her stock so she can offer her customers excellent service and thereby keep increasing her sales so that she can open another store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new models of cell phones and accessories to go with them

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza junto a su marido, su hijo es su mayor fortaleza y el motivo por el cual esta pareja lucha. Su anterior crédito lo utilizo para la construcción de una casilla donde podrá seguir con la venta de sus bebidas.
Ella solicita nuevamente de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas en general, como ser vinos, gaseosas, cervezas y demás, lo cual le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas. Ella agradece por esta nueva oportunidad de crecimiento que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Graciela is a very hardworking and enterprising person who works very hard, alongside her husband. Their son is their greatest strength and the reason why this couple fights. She used her previous loan to build a stall where she will be able to continue to sell her drinks.

She is applying for another loan to invest in the purchase of drinks in general, such as wine, soft drinks, beer, and others. This will help her to continue with her sales. She is grateful to be given a new opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as wine, soft drinks, beer, and others to sell.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene  46 años, es madre soltera de sus 3 hijos, con quienes vive en una casa construida  a base de material noble. Su principal ingreso económico viene del campo en donde trabaja hace más de 20 años cultivando algunos de los productos más rentables de su zona como el cacao.
Desde niña aprendió el oficio de la agricultura ya que sus padres también se dedicaban al campo.
Actualmente cuenta con 2 hectáreas de cultivo y posee más plantaciones de cacao porque considera que a diferencia de otros productos de la zona este le permite obtener mejores ganancias al finalizar la campaña.Para sus tareas cotidianas contrata algunos trabajadores de lugar  quienes realizan las tareas mas complicadas como el retiro de maleza y el corte de tallos defectuosos.Cuando cosecha sus productos los seca y vende a los compradores del lugar donde recupera el dinero que invirtió obteniendo ganancias adicionales a al vez.
Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo porque puede mantener económicamente a sus hijos y enviarlos al colegio con todo lo necesario para que puedan algún día ser profesionales.Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado para seguir adelante.En está oportunidad desea solicitar 1,000 nuevos soles  para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Maura is 46 years old; she is a single mother to her three children, who live with her in a solidly built house.  Her main source of income is the field where she has worked for over 20 years growing some of the most profitable crops in the area, such as cacao.

She learned to farm she when she was a little girl, as her parents also worked in the fields.

She currently has 2 ha of crops and she has more cacao fields because she believes that, unlike other crops in the area, this one leaves her with the best earnings at the end of the season.  She hires laborers from the area for the day-to-day work and they do the more involved jobs, such as pulling weeds and cutting bad branches.  When she harvests her produce she dries it and sells it to local buyers, where she gets back the money she invested and sometimes extra.  

She is very happy with her work because she can support her children financially and send them to school with everything they need to one day become professionals.  This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the help she has received to get ahead.  This time she is asking for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
Miryan tiene 25 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, desde muy joven logró comprar una casa hecha de madera donde también viven sus padres.Se dedica a la agricultura en una parcela que le heredó su padre hace 7 años y es su principal medio para ganar dinero.Desde niña aprendió a vivir del campo y fue gracias a sus padres y hermanos mayores que le enseñaron a mantener en buen estado las plantas de cacao y café.
Actualmente cuenta con 2 hectáreas de cultivo y contrata a trabajadores del lugar para que le ayuden en algunas tareas como la limpieza de sus parcelas retirando la maleza de la cosecha.Trata de mantener sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico y para obtener una buena calidad de sus plantaciones y vender los frutos a los acopiadores del lugar para recuperar su inversión y obtener ganancias adicionales.Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En está oportunidad desea solicitar 4,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Miryan is 25 years old; she is single and she has no children.  When she was very young she managed to buy a wooden house where her parents also live.  She farms for a living on plot she inherited from her parents seven years ago and it is her main source of income.  She learned to live off the land when she was a child and it was thanks to her parents and her older siblings that she learned how to keep the cacao and coffee plants healthy.

She now has 2 ha of cultivated land and she hires local laborers to help her with some jobs, such as clearing her plots of weeds.  She tries to maintain her crops with organic fertilizer so they will be of high quality and she sells her produce to local dealers to get back her investment with additional profits.  This is her third loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial support she has received so she can get ahead.  This time she is asking for 4,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Buena Fe De Tunaja 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Rogelia es viuda, cuenta con 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de cerdos, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital propio y en la actualidad lleva 40 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servira para la compra de cerdos y concentrado para los mismos, en el futuro cercano quiere convertirla en una grnaja y dejarselo a sus hijos, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales domésticos y al tejido. En la fotografia estan 12 personas pero solamente a 10 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rogelia is a widow; she is 58 years old and she did not get the opportunity to go to school.  She has four children and two of them are in school.  She buys, raises, and sells pigs for a living.  She started this business with her own small capital and she now has 40 years of experience.

She has organized a group and she is asking for a loan to buy pigs and feed.  In the near future she wants to convert it into a farm to leave to her children.  The other group members raise domestic animals and weave for a living.  There are 12 people in the photograph, but the loan was only granted to 10 of them.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is married and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nida is 50 years old and has four children who are in school.  Nida has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening business.  Nida has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is married and has seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nida is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.  Nida has a general store business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, soap, spices,etc.  Nida has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, soap, spices,etc

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Lucia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock, like laundry soap, sugar, coffee, soft-drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.  Lucia has been in this business for ten years now.  In the future, Lucia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, like laundry soap, sugar, coffee, soft-drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn works hard to support her family. Noralyn is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Noralyn requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of used clothing to sell.

Noralyn has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Noralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Winnida

texts.en: Winnida is 53 years old and is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Winnida has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. Winnida has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Winnida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad dreams of becoming a professional, but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Soledad was accepted into Escuela Superior Simón Bolívar and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. Her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. It is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible.

With the loan, Soledad plans on purchasing much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Soledad feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a degree in business she expects to earn $10 a day. With one younger sister, Soledad hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for textbooks and school supplies

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
Lot is 63 years old.  He is married and has four children, two of whom are dependents. He lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district where crop farming a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been his family’s main source of income for twenty years. 
Lot has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The past loans have helped his family with sufficient food and better support the business. Now he is leading his group to apply for another loan. Lot wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Barromeo

texts.en:
Barromeo, age 26, is a cacao farmer from the beautiful village of San Jose. The village is located in the rural areas of Toledo District with no access to electricity. Barromeo and his wife, Josepha, together raise their two children that are currently living at home and going to school. Josepha spends most of her time with the kids and doing crafts.

Barromeo got inspired to grow cacao from the advice of his neighbors. He was also raised as a farmer growing numerous varieties of farm crops. He is happy with MMC for purchasing cacao beans from his farm. Fermentation has been a challenge he stated. Josepha says she loves harvesting and selling. Despite the fact that Barromeo faces challenges, he is happy and will expand his cacao farm. 

Barromeo is requesting this loan to pay a helper to clean the area around his seedlings and his 1000 productive trees. He has other employment, which gives him less time to focus on the farm. 

Baromeo says with this loan assistance he will be able to meet his goal. In the future, he will quit his other job and focus on the farm. He hopes that his children will get educated and get some sort of professional jobs or become a farmer.

loans.use: To clean and expand cacao farms

loans.name: Alanberto

texts.en:
Alanberto, age 28, is a cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Silver Creek. He manages three acres with 1500 cacao trees. Alanberto together with his wife Lucina raised three children - all of whom are still living at home. His wife Lucina enjoys her time with the children at home and doing farm work.

Farming is the main income for Alanberto's family. Alanberto enjoys managing his farm. He stated that cacao farming is the best and would recommend other farmers to do the same. He sees the financial benefits that assist in his family daily needs.  Pests such at ants and woodpeckers are affecting the ripe pods.  Alanberto also plants a variety of farm crops, such as corn and rice.

Alanberto will use this loan to pay workers to assist him in cleaning and pruning his productive trees.  He has outside employment in construction, which gives him limited time to manage his farm properly.
 
Alanberto’s future goal is to expand his farm with grafted cacao seedlings, quit his other job and focus on the farm. He hopes that his children will achieve a level of education to either become a farmer or have some professional job.

loans.use: To clean and prune cacao trees

loans.name: Manuao

texts.en:
Manuao is 28 years old and married with two children. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

Manuao is requesting a loan to buy flour, oil, chicken legs, onions, soy sauce, and garlic. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. In the future, Manuao hopes to earn a profit, improve her business, and help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, chicken legs, onions, soy sauce, and garlic

loans.name: Rahiema

texts.en:
This is Rahiema, 33, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is single and lives with her parents, helping them manage their household. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rahiema operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php16,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rahiema hopes that her variety store becomes a grocery store.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 39 years old and married with three children.

Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar and soap.

Perlita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years. Perlita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane has been involved in agriculture for four years. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and 3-year-old daughter. Gayane keeps livestock which currently includes a cow, five sheep and a bull. She works hard to earn income and support her family. As agriculture helps Gayane and her family to have a stable income, it is very important for her to increase her cattle breeding business. In order to enlarge the number of livestock, Gayane has applied for this loan to purchase four goats. This will help her to gather more income and improve her family's living conditions.
Gayane waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for four goats

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 39-year-old hard-working man living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He deals in cocoa farming and hopes to expand his business to other areas and also build a big coffee store. He faces a challenge of heavy rains in wet seasons which reduces his production capacity. Richard is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. 

Rowena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for ten years, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Rowena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 44 years old. He lives in a small village, Tkemlovana, in Chiatura district, with his retired parents and two children (13 and 15 years old). Several times, Koba requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Koba's family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have milk cows, bulls, two pigs, and a plot of land where haricot and maize are grown. The cows are milked every day to produce dairy products. Harvested products, along with the dairy products, are sold among the villagers. Koba also has a small grocery shop and he earns a daily income.  The family's additional income is from Koba’s parents' monthly pensions. 

Koba requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Koba has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Koba will purchase a mini-bus. He wants to start trading in fruits and vegetables. Since his village is far from the city center and it’s hard for the locals to access certain products, Koba, with his mini bus, will go to the big market in Chiatura district, purchase fruits, vegetables, and other products, and bring them to his village to resell to the villagers. 

With this loan, Koba will help his villagers and will also have increased the income of his family.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus for trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego trabaja como empleado en una Institución gubernamental de El Alto en la unidad de mantenimiento. Vive en casa de sus padres, es soltero y vive en la zona de Villa Caluyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, calaminas  etc. Así podrá  refaccionar su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida

El sueño de Diego, es de tener su casa propia.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Diego is employed in the maintenance department of a government agency in El Alto.  He lives in his parents’ house and is single; he lives in the city of El Alto’s Villa Caluyo zone.

He needs the loan to buy building supplies like cement, bricks, plywood sheets, etc. to refurbish his dwelling and improve his quality of life.  Diego’s dream is to have a house of his own.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Inin

texts.es:
Inin es madre soltera y vive en alquiler en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella estudia marketing y hace servicios de publicidad para algunas empresas pequeñas. Requiere el crédito para la compra de una cámara fotográfica profesional como  equipo de trabajo que le servirá mucho en su trabajo.

El sueño de Inin es terminar sus estudios y aspirar a un mejor ingreso para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Inin is a single mother living as a renter in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.  She’s studying marketing and provides publicity services for some small firms.  She needs the loan to buy a professional grade camera to use as working equipment; it will be of great use to her in her work.  Inin’s dream is to complete her studies and be able to earn higher income to be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a professional grade camera.

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en:
Seneuefa  is 65 years old and married with seven children. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as snacks, salt, rice, flour, chicken quarters, mutton, soft drinks, and other beverages. Seneuefa became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

Seneuefa is requesting a loan to buy tinned food, drinks, snacks, beverages, pastries, rice, washing powder, and soap. She hopes to use the profits from her loan to buy more goods to improve her shop and help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy tinned food, drinks, snacks, beverages, pastries, rice, washing powder, and soap

loans.name: Lelave

texts.en:
Lelave is 57 years old and married with four children. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

Lelave is requesting a loan to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. She will use her loan to buy bags of flour, onions, soya, meat, garlic, oil, and a large cooking pot. In the future, Lelave hopes to improve her business to help her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, onions, soya, meat, garlic, oil, and a large cooking pot

loans.name: Shehzadi's Group

texts.en:
Shehzadi is a 44 year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband owns a restaurant which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase food items for the restaurant.  They include flour, pulses, beef, mutton and chicken for preparing dishes.

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Shehzadi, as a member of a five person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing food items. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to purchase a variety of vegetables and chicken for the restaurant. Shehzadi is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase flour, pulses, beaf, mutton and chicken for cooking dishes

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is married with a little child. Together with her husband Zhora, who is also in the photo, she runs a farm. Their farm currently includes 22 chickens, a cow and a calf. Anna milks the cow and uses milk in cheese production. Zhora sells agricultural products in the market and gets income which is vital for their family's living expenses. Anna would like to enlarge the family's farming business since agriculture is their only source of income. As Anna has no financial means for doing so, she has applied for this loan. With the help of this loan, Anna will purchase 3 oxen and a calf and will be able to expand her farm. The loan is very important for Anna and her husband to gather a higher income and ensure a better life for their little child. They dream of having a profitable farm with a large number of livestock.

loans.use: to pay for 3 oxen and a calf.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés se dedica a la confección de ropas de bebe. El actualmente es soltero, vive  en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona: León de la ciudad del el Alto. 

El crédito lo requiere para compra de materia prima (tela polar) para continuar con su negocio de confeccionar ropas de bebés y así aumentara su capital mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Andrés es incrementar su negocio de tal manera que pueda convertirse en distribuidor.

Es la  primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Andrés works making clothes for infants.  He’s currently single living in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s León zone.  

He needs the loan to buy raw materials (fleece) to continue with his business manufacturing clothes for babies thus increasing his capital to improve his income and quality of life.  

Andrés’ dream is to increase business to such an extent of becoming a distributor.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fleece to make infant wear.

loans.name: Peleitala

texts.en:
Peleitala is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children. For the past two years, she has grown taro, taamu, yams, and bananas on a small plantation. Peleitala has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

Peleitala is requesting a loan to buy spades, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to earn more from her plantation and help her family.

loans.use: to buy spades, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and fertilizer

loans.name: Osmar

texts.es:
Osmar trabaja como empleado en una de  las empresas de telefonía que existen en el Departamento de La Paz; vive con su esposa y su hija recién nacida, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para el pago de pensiones y matricula en la Universidad donde estudia; de esta manera continuar con sus estudios y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Osmar, es llegar a ser profesional.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Osmar works for one of the telephone companies that exist in La Paz Department.  He lives with his wife and newborn daughter in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Río Seco zone.

He needs the loan to pay tuition and fees at the university he’s attending so he can continue with his studies and improve his quality of life.  Osmar’s dream is to become a professional.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose es soltero no tiene hijos, viven en casa en anticretico, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como socio propietario en uno de los  Radio taxis de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento en general de su vehículo (cambio de aceites y líquidos de frenos y de volante;  así mantendrá en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo.

El sueño de Jose es tener una segunda movilidad y a lo largo tener su propia cadena de radio taxis, así sus ingresos aumentaran y mejorara la calidad de vida.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José is single and has no children.  They live in a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.

He studied up to the secondary level and currently works as a member/owner for one of the city of La Paz’s radio dispatched taxi services.

He needs the loan to service his vehicle (oil change, brake fluid and steering fluid change) to keep his work tool in good operating condition.

His dream is to own a second vehicle and eventually to have his own chain of radio dispatched taxis so his income will increase and his quality of life will improve.

This is his second loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Due to the difficulties of earning a living, Ronald engages in the business of raising hogs to generate an additional income. He is 35 years old and has three school-going children. Ronald aims to attain financial stability to satisfy his family's needs and to support the educational needs of his children who are attending school. To achieve this, he has asked for additional capital for his hog raising business. He has asked for 28,000 PHP which he will use to purchase hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. Through patience and hard work, he has the strong determination to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Lidia  tiene 39 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son un varón de nueve años y una mujer de 5 años de edad que se encuentran en edad escolar,   se dedica a la producción de colchones de paja comúnmente conocidos como “payasas” ella vive en la zona de Kalajahuira, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Lidia    va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de material para su producción como paja seca  al por mayor para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para este material ya que esta época de lluvia y frio hay escases de este producto,  La Sra. Lidia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las épocas de lluvia, perjudican a la cliente ya que sus colchones lo produce con paja seca, es la razón para que necesite adquirir paja seca al por mayor y así abastecerse en época de lluvias, va a utilizar los beneficios en mejorar su producción para el sustento de su familia, la Sra. Lidia  sueña por su negocio es poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida ya ella es la única que mantiene a su familia y quiere que sus hijos tengan una vida digna y puedan superarse mediante el estudio.
texts.en: Lidia is 39 years old. She is a single woman with two children, a nine year old son and a five year old daughter. They are both school-aged. Lidia makes straw mattresses commonly known as “payasas”. She lives in the Kalajahuira zone. This is her first loan thought the institution. Lidia is going to use the loan to purchase wholesale dry straw for her business. Her reason for requesting the loan is a lack of cash available for buying the material. Since it is the rainy and cold season, there is a limited amount of this material. Lidia faces challenges in her business since it is the rainy season and it can be detrimental to the client base since the mattresses are made with dry straw. This is the reason why she needs to purchase wholesale dry straw in order to stock up on materials. She is going to use the benefits to improve her production for the support of her family. Lidia dreams that through her business she can give her children a better quality of life. She is the one person supporting her family and she wants her family to have a dignified life and overcome through their studies.

loans.use: purchase wholesale materials for her business.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is a 36-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small plantation. To earn extra income, she also has a mechanical shop. Ioana needs a loan to buy a generator, engine oil, water blaster and a compressor. She will use her profits to improve her business. Ioana joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a generator, engine oil, water blaster and compressor.

loans.name: Nafanua

texts.en: Nafanua is 37 years old, married, and has five children. She wants to start a small business in her community, making and selling vegetables and fruits. To do this, she needs a loan. She will use it to buy cabbages, cucumbers, oranges, pineapples, and mangoes. In the future, Nafanua hopes to earn more profits, to improve her business and help her kids get their educations. She joined SPBD in 2013, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to start a small business selling fruits and vegetables, including cabbages, cucumbers, oranges, pineapples, and mangoes

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
59-year-old Givi lives in Gardabani district with his wife, his 26-year-old son and 22-year-old daughter. Givi has requested for a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. Givi works at the local furniture workshop as a security guard and his son works at the Tbilisi National Airport as a cleaner. They both earn small monthly salaries, and this is the only source of living for their family.

Givi requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Givi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Givi will pay the customs fees for his car. Givi wants to start trading in cheese. He will purchase the products at a wholesale price and resell with a price markup. He will earn a good profit with his new business and will be able to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the customs fees for his car.

loans.name: Mwale Group

texts.en:
Maulid who is in his mid thirties is married with two children who are still going to school. He has been running a business of selling cold drinks and dry food for five years now. He works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maulid's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the out-of-stock items in his shop and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used his profits to buy a bed, a TV set and a radio; and paid school fees and met his household expenses. He is very happy with the loan. He will use this loan to buy more soda, juice, water, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil and rice to resell. His dream is to one day be able to own a wholesale shop for his items.

Maulid will share this loan with his loan group, Mwale, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more soda, juice, water, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil and rice to resell.

loans.name: Roxanna

texts.en: Roxanna is 23 years old and married. She has two children. She makes and sells printing materials, to earn a living. She has been doing this work for one year. Roxanna has requested a loan to buy paints, brushes, roller designs, and fabric material. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and fulfill her family commitments. She joined SPBD in 2013, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, roller designs, and fabric material

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 50-year-old, married woman, with six children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Ana has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, weed killer, a wheel barrow, and bush knives. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. 

With her profits, Ana hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, weed killer, a wheel barrow, and bush knives.

loans.name: Ake

texts.en:
Ake is a 49-year-old, married woman, with six children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Ake has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves, bush knives, and a mist blower. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. 

With her profits, Ake hopes to save for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves, bush knives, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Muga

texts.en: Muga is a 41-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Muga has requested a loan to buy bush knives, gloves, a mist blower, a wheelbarrow and fertilizer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Muga hopes to save for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, gloves, a mist blower, a wheelbarrow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Penisila

texts.en:
Penisila is a 65-year-old, married woman, with five children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Penisila has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, gloves, and a mist blower. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. 

With her profits, Penisila hopes to save in her account for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, gloves, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Siolo

texts.en:
Siolo is a 40-year-old, married woman, with five children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Siolo has requested a loan to buy a chainsaw, a mist blower, bush knives, and fertilizer. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. 

With her profits, Siolo hopes to save for family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, a mist blower, bush knives, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Atu

texts.en:
Atu is 28 years old and married, with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, flour, rice, and onions. She has been doing this for two years. 

Atu needs a loan to buy salt, sugar, flour, rice, soap, and cooking oil. She hopes to use her profits to save money in the bank. 

She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) two years ago, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, flour, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Saini

texts.en:
Saini is 39 years old and married, with three children. She runs a small business, selling pork cake in her community and she has been doing this for two years. 

Saini has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and a large cooking pot. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Saini will use her business profit to help her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and large cooking pot.

loans.name: Eme

texts.en:
Eme is 43 years old and not married, with four children. She has a small garden where she sells vegetables and fruits in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Eme needs a loan to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, shovels, gloves, and a wheel barrow. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. 

Eme will use the profits from her sales to develop her family and also to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, shovels, gloves, and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Lotutamaiti

texts.en:
Lotutamaiti is 20 years old and married, with no children. She would like to start a small business, selling elei (design material). 

In order to do this, Lotutamaiti needs a loan to buy paint board, paint brushes, fabric material, and a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to develop her family and her business. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013.

loans.use: to buy paint board, paint brushes, fabric material, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 42 years old and married, with two children. She has a small garden and grows taro, yams, taamu, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Luisa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves, a mist blower, and a chainsaw. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. 

Luisa will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and help her family's living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves, a mist blower, and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
