La Sra. Sandra es dueña de una empresa fabricadora de productos chacinados (Chorizos - Butifarras - Morcilla - entre otros), cuenta con una clientela formada de hace varios años y es gracias a esto está creciendo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia con todo lo que necesitan. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y ayudando también a otros con fuentes de trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer sus chacinados, como ser carnes de cerdo, vacuna y pollo, condimentos, verduras y demás. Agradece por esta ayuda, ya que es una gran oportunidad para ella.
texts.en:
Sandra owns a firm producing various meat based products (chorizo, pork sausage, blood sausage, among others).  She has a regular clientele that she’s had for several years and thanks to this she’s growing.

She’s a very hardworking, enterprising person who is getting ahead thanks to much effort and sacrifice; she helps her family with everything they need. Her goal is to continue growing and helping others by providing them job opportunities.

She’s asking for this loan to buy ingredients like pork, beef and chicken, condiments, vegetables and others for her products.  She is grateful for this help because it’s a great opportunity for her.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, chicken, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia es de ka Ciudad de Pilar, esta estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad, cuenta que esta estudiando en la Facultad de Ciencias Contables, la cual es una buena universidad. Al terminar su carrera será una contadora publica, y con su titulo podrá abrirse mejores caminos.
Ella lucha por ser una buena profesional, crecer y realizarse como persona y profesional. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad, esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Nidia is from the city of Pilar.  She is studying Accounting in the School of Accounting, which is a good university department.  At the end of her degree course, she will be a public accountant and her degree will open doors for her.

She is fighting to be a good professional and to grow as a person and a professional.  She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una joven de 20 años, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella es una joven que se esfuerza por salir adelante y el día de mañana poder ser una gran profesional. Está estudiando Radiología, y cuenta que estudia duro para poder destacarse y salir adelante.
Estudia y se sacrifica por su familia, ya que quiere poder ayudarlos y también poder darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades. Comenta que si todo va bien en el año 2015 ya sería una profesional recibida.
Solicita este crédito para el pago de las cuotas de la universidad, para que de esa forma pueda aligerar sus gastos y seguir estudiando y trabajando a la vez.
texts.en:
Lidia’s a young, 20-year-old from the city of San Ignacio.  She’s a young woman who strives to get ahead to become a great professional someday soon.  She’s studying radiology and she relates that she studies hard in order to stand out and to get ahead.

She studies and sacrifices for her family because she wants to be able to help them and also to give them everything they need so they won’t have to go through any want.  She comments that if everything goes well she’ll graduate in 2015.

She asks for this loan to pay her university tuition fees so that she can reduce costs and continue studying and working at the same time.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es de la ciudad de Ybycui, es una persona muy sacrificada, trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo, cuenta que esta estudiando la carrera de Administración en Gestión Pública. Con esta carrera el quiere poder ser el día de mañana un gran profesional que ayude a quienes necesiten de su servicio.
Quiere poder trabajar en una entidad publica, en la que pueda crecer y pueda también servir a su país. En el 2014 el estaría terminando su carrera y siendo un buen licenciado.
Solicita de este crédito para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda y le permitirá seguir en su carrera.
texts.en: Vicente is from the city of Ybycui.  He’s very self-sacrificing; he works and studies at the same time.  He relates that he’s studying Public Service Administration.  He hopes with this career someday to help those who need his services.  He wants to be able to work for a public entity in which he can grow and also be of service to his country.  He will finish his studies in 2014 and be a good graduate.  He requests this loan to be able to pay his university tuition fees.  He’s grateful for the opportunity he’s getting because it will be of great use and will allow him to continue in his career.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer muy sacrificada y emprendedora, ella esta estudiando la carrera de Análisis de Sistemas en la universidad Sudamericana. Ella cuenta que le inspira estudiar su familia y si hijo, ya que quiere darles todo lo que necesitan y de esa forma que no pasen por necesidades.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que con ello podrá estar un poco mas tranquila con su obligación. Ella esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que de esa forma podrá invertir en algo tan importante como lo es la educación.
texts.en:
Diana’s a self-sacrificing, enterprising woman.  She’s studying systems analysis at Sudamericana University.  She relates that her family and her son inspire her to study because she wants to give them everything they need so they will lack nothing.

She requests this loan to pay her tuition fees so that she can have a little more peace of mind with regard to this obligation.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because she will be able to invest in something that’s so important like education.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es de la ciudad de Ybycui, estudia Administración de empresas en la Universidad Católica, comenta que su sueño es recibirse y el día de mañana ser una gran profesional que sea de ayuda a las demás personas. Cuenta que su familia es la que la inspira, por ser su familia la que siempre la apoya y le da todo lo que necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma aligerar un poco la carga que tiene y también poder dedicarse mejor a sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que con ello podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Daisy’s from the city of Ybycui.  She’s studying business administration at Catholic University.  She comments that her dream is to graduate and become a great professional someday who will be of service to others.  She comments that her family is her inspiration because it’s her family and they always give her everything she needs.

She requests this loan to pay university tuition fees so she can alleviate her costs a bit and be able to better focus on her studies.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because with it she’ll be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Rory está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para ayudar a las miembros a conocer su situación económica y ayudarlas por medio de capacitaciones para mejorar. Ellas están en el ciclo 11 del programa de comité de mujeres y quieren seguir creciendo.
Catalina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es modista, y cuenta que siempre esta cargada de mucho trabajo y eso la ayuda a tener los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Se esfuerza por superarse y dar a su familia lo que necesita para tener una vida sin privaciones.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos ya que son sus principales insumos y con los que podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Kuña Rory" is taking a poverty elimination survey in order to help the members to become aware of their financial situation and get help in improving it through the trainings. They're in the 11th loan cycle with the program for women's groups, and they wish to continue growing.
Catalina is one of the members of this group. She's a dressmaker and reports that she's always faced with a lot of work, which helps her to earn profits so she can support her family. She works hard in order to better herself and provide her family with the things they need for living without hardships.
She requests this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of fabric and thread, since those are her main supplies and with them she'll be able to meet her customers' orders.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupury  es de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrada por 10 señoras muy emprendedoras actualmente están en el 2º ciclo y todas desarrollan actividades para mejorar su economía familiar.  Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Miguela, quien se dedica a la costura.
Miguela es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza y trata de dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Su meta es poder tener un gran taller de costura y dar también trabajo a las demás personas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas para elaborar prendas de invierno y de esa forma seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupury group is from the city Santani.  It is made up of ten enterprising women who are in their second loan cycle.  They all work to improve their family's financial situation.  

One of the members is Miguela, who works as a seamstress.  Miguela is a hardworking woman who makes an effort and tries to give her family everything they need so that they don't have to go without any necessities like she has had to do.  Her goal is to have a large sewing workshop and provide employment for other people. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics to make winter clothing so that she can continue working as she has been doing.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make winter clothes.

loans.name: Faaua

texts.en: Faaua is a 51-year-old, married woman, who has four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community, to earn a  living. She has three years of experience with this business. Faaua needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, a large cooking pot and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay her children's school fees and to expand her business in the future. Faaua has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, a large cooking pot and a new oven.

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en:
Sherry began displaying art for the citizens of Knoxville, Tennessee more than seven months ago.  Sherry’s goal was to enable visitors to not only understand the art displayed, but also to generate group discussions about the pieces.  Sherry believes bringing culture into one’s valuable leisure time is both beneficial and supports the initiative of the Nuance gallery—hence her business name, Gallery Nuance. 

Sherry discovered Accion Texas Inc. at an external workshop and inquired about applying for a loan for the gallery.  After applying and receiving her Accion loan, she was able to replace and purchase updated track lighting for the gallery.  The lighting within the gallery is critical to showcase the art and emphasize its beauty.  Sherry would not have been able to replace the existing track lighting without her Accion loan she says.  

Sherry will continue to provide a friendly team environment that together learn about each other and gain access to art and culture. Find out more about her business on her website here: http://gallerynuance.com/.

loans.use: to purchase new lighting.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mabel es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, cuenta que se dedica a la confección de ropas para niños, uniformes escolares y otros.
Comenta además que hace 25 años que se dedica a esto y que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Gracias a que siempre sus trabajos tienen muy buena calidad es que está creciendo y mejorando cada día. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona que trabaja duro y quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, gomas y demás, ya que estos son los principales insumos que usa para poder dar a sus clientes prendas de buena calidad. Sueña con ir creciendo y ser más conocida por mas clientes.
texts.en:
Mabel is from the city of Pilar.  She’s a very hardworking, enterprising person.  She relates that she works making children’s clothes, school uniforms and others.

She comments that she’s been in this occupation for 25 years and already has a good clientele.  Thanks to her work always being of very good quality she’s growing and improving every day.  She defines herself as a person who works hard and who wants to get ahead.

She’s asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, elastic and others because these are the main supplies she uses to produce good quality articles of clothing for her customers.  She dreams with continuing to grow and to become known by more customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es de la ciudad de Ybycui, es un joven muy sacrificado ya que estudia y trabaja a la vez. La carrera que esta siguiendo es "Contabilidad", la cual terminará en el 2014, y será un licenciado en ciencias contables. Su Meta es poder ser un buen profesional, hacer otros cursos para seguir creciendo y dar así a quienes necesiten, un buen servicio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en Pagar sus cuotas de la universidad. Comenta que lo que lo destaca de las demás es que es muy responsable y siempre cumple con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Francisco is from the city of Ybycui. He’s a very self-sacrificing young man who studies and works at the same time.  The major he’s pursuing is accounting; he’ll finish in 2014 and will have a bachelor’s in accounting science.  His goal is to be able to be a good professional, to take other courses to continue growing thus providing good service to those who need it.  He’s asking for this loan to be able to pay university tuition fees.  He comments that what sets him apart from others is that he’s very responsible and always meets his obligations.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Punipuao

texts.en: Punipuao is 29 years old and a married woman. She has two children.  She would like to start growing taro plants, to earn a living. Punipuao has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves and a mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Punipuao will spend her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools and inputs to use in starting a taro-growing business

loans.name: Pyahu Group

texts.es:
Pyahu está en su ciclo número 2do. del programa de comité de mujeres, 7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, esto se sabe gracias a que ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Graciela es una de estas mujeres, ella vende verduras frescas en su puesto, y con sus ingresos trata de ir creciendo y mejorando sus vidas. Su encuesta mostro que ella está en un nivel medio, pero pese a ello está esforzándose por salir adelante y día a día mejorar. Se define a sí misma como una persona que lucha, se sacrifica y quiere seguir creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, zanahorias y demás tipo de verduras, ya que quiere seguir con sus ventas y procurando mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus amigas reciben con este crédito.
texts.en:
The Pyahu group is in its second loan cycle of the women's communal bank programme. 7 members find themselves below the poverty line, which is known thanks to the fact that they are doing the elimination of poverty survey.

Graciela is one of these women. She sells fresh vegetables at her stall, and with the income tries to carry on growing and improving their lives. The survey shows that she is at a medium level, but in spite of that she is putting in effort to move forward and day by day to improve. She defines herself as a person who fights, makes sacrifices and wants to keep growing. 

She is applying for this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, carrots and other types of vegetables as she wants to keep going with her sales and obtain a better income. She is thankful for this opportunity that she and her friends receive with this loan.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell, such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, carrots and others.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai is a 39-year-old, married woman, who has four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Faafetai has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, taro plants, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves and a mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Faafetai hopes to expand her business, and to save more money in her account for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy inputs and tools for growing taro, including fertilizer, taro plants, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves and a mist blower

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número  2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan  y se ayudan para salir adelante. La Sra. Marina es la tesorera del grupo, tiene una pequeña mercería donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser calzados, prendas, artículos en general.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas, calzados y cosméticos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
Ella y sus compañeras están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadores [Hard-working Women] group is in its second loan cycle with the women's communal bank programme, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. 

Marina is the treasurer of the group, she has a small haberdashery where she sells all kinds of items, like footwear, garments, and general items. 

She is applying for this loan to buy clothing, footwear and cosmetics. It will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her increase her income. 

She and her fellow members are really grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, because it will help them a lot.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Lilian es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella cuenta que viene de una familia muy trabajadora, su papa es agricultor y su mama es modista, y gracias al esfuerzo que hacen han podido ayudarla y darle todo lo que necesita para ser una excelente estudiante.
Lilian esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho, en una buena universidad, su meta es poder recibirse y el día de mañana ser una buena abogada y tener su propio estudio jurídico. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella esta recibiendo y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Lilian is from the city of  Paraguarí. She has a very hardworking family. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a seamstress. Thanks to their hard work, they were able to help her and give her everything she needs to an excellent student.  

Lilian is studying law in a good university. Her goal is to graduate and in the future be a good lawyer and have her own law office. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving and is asking for this loan to invest it in paying for her college tuition, which will be a big help.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es una persona muy luchadora, que estudia y trabaja, es muy sacrificada que se esfuerza por salir adelante y crecer, según cuenta esta estudiando la carrera de escribanía publica, en una de las mejores universidades del País. Se esfuerza por ser la mejor en su aula, ya que pone todo de ella y lucha por crecer. Su sueño es poder ser una buena profesional que ayude a los demás.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en el pago de gastos de la universidad, ya que tiene muchos gastos, y quiere poder cubrirlos así. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Fatima is a very determined person, who studies and works. She sacrifices and makes an effort to get ahead and grow. She says she is studying a degree to become a notary public in one of the best universities in the country. 

She works hard to be the best in her class and puts everything she's got into it and fights to grow. Her dream is to be a good professional who helps others. 

She is applying for this loan to invest in paying university expenses, as she has a lot of expenses and she wants to be able to cover them. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving and it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to pay university expenses.

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgontuya, 43 years old, lives with her husband, mother and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their apartment. 

She and her husband both have disabilities and work at the same company, which is dedicated to providing jobs to disabled people. She is a seamstress and her husband is carpenter. Her son, after graduating from university, began working as a technician at a television broadcasting company. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

The apartment they live in came into service in 1985, and since that time, it has never received any repair. So, Otgontuya is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as wallpaper, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she will repair and insulate her own apartment. As a result, the apartment will no longer lose its heat through walls and windows, thus preserving energy. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus es un joven que trabaja en el comercio en conjunto con sus padres actualmente esta estudiando Psicología Laboral en la Universidad Nacional de Pilar, dentro de un corto tiempo al terminar sus estudios se ve trabajando en alguna institución importante desarrollando lo aprendido en su carrera.
Comenta que su sueño es ser un buen profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas, por medio de sus estudios. El solicita de este crédito para la compra de útiles para la universidad y también para sus gastos de manutención. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Jesus is a young man who works as a merchant with his parents. Right now, he is studying occupational psychology in the Universidad Nacional de Pilar. Within a a short time, when he finishes his studies, he sees himself working in some important situation developing what he learned in his major. 

He says that his dream is to have a good career helping other people through his education. He is asking for this loan to buy supplies for college and also to pay for living expenses. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving, which will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for college and to pay for living expenses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria desde muy joven trabajo para poder pagar sus estudios porque quiere llegar a ser una buena profesional para triunfar en la vida. Su inspiración es su familia que siempre le demuestran su apoyo incondicional para el logro de sus objetivos, ya que aspira a llegar muy lejos.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniera en Mecatrónica, en una de las mejores universidades del país, y cuenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere salir adelante y también ayudar a su familia. Solicita de esta crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de clases, y también para gastos de manutención. Agradece por esta oportunidad que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
From a very young age Maria has worked to be able to pay for her studies because she wants to become a good professional to triumph in life. Her inspiration is her family who always shows her unconditional support to achieve her objectives, so she aspires to go far. 

She is studying a Mechatronics Engineering degree in one of the best universities in the country, and says that through her studies she wants to get ahead and also help her family. 

She is applying for this loan to invest in paying her class costs, and also her living costs. She is grateful for this opportunity which will really help her.

loans.use: to pay class costs and living costs.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, 40 years old, lives with his wife, mother and children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Batbayar began working as an assistant carpenter just one year ago, and now he became a fully pledged carpenter. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. His wife works at a hospital. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So, Batbayar is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he will repair and insulate his house. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and cooking. It will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is 21 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, salt, onions, soy sauce, chicken legs and a cooking pot. 

Amanda hopes to have her own store in the future. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, onions, soy sauce, chicken legs and a cooking pot.

loans.name: Bujidmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bujidmaa, 41 years old, lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Bujidmaa has been working as a janitor at a private business entity for one year. Her husband also works as a sentry at the same entity where she works. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. A natural gas vehicle has cleaner emissions and less fuel waste compared to other engine-powered automobiles. So, purchasing this environmentally friendly automobile should be encouraged everywhere. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Urantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Urantsetseg, 42 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two daughters both attend high school. Mrs. Urantsetseg has been running an eyeglasses business for eight years. She has secured many permanent customers. 

With a previous loan, Mrs. Urantsetseg built a house on her land. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials, including planks, bricks, and cement. She wants to build an extension to her house in order to stop the heat loss that occurs through the walls. As a result, the family will reduce its coal consumption drastically and release less pollutants into the atmosphere. The construction will contribute to clean air efforts. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: La Costanera - San Jose Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres forman este grupo llamado La Costanera - San Jose, estan en su primer ciclo, ellas estan dispuestas a trabajar juntas y por medio de las capacitaciones ir creciendo y mejorando la vida de las integrantes. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para saber la situación de cada una.
Teresa es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de medina natural, como ser yuyos los cuales son muy consumidos, ya que las personas lo usan para el tereré y mate, que son bebidas típicas del Paraguay. Cuenta que con su trabajo y esfuerzo esta creciendo y tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Teresa solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
13 women make up this group, called La Costanera (The Boardwalk) - San Jose. They are in their first loan cycle. They are prepared to work together and, through the trainings, to continue growing and improving the lives of the members. They are taking the poverty elimination survey in order to find out about the situation of each one of them.

Teresa is a member of this group. She sells natural medicines such as herbs, which are very popular since people use them for tereré and mate, typical Paraguayan drinks. She says that with her work and effort, she's growing and has the means to be able to help her family.

Teresa is asking for the loan to buy natural remedies in order to continue with her sales and in that way increase her income.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento, las integrantes están en zonas distantes y tratan de crecer para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Lucia es una de las integrantes, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de Repostería en el que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y lucha por salir adelante. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su repostería, como ser harina, huevo, vainilla, manteca y demás, para poder seguir con sus ventas. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras," from the city of Concepción, is in its 4th loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees of Fundación Paraguaya.  They meet in an area that is still growing, which is located outside of the central part of the city.  These members come from outlying areas, and they are trying to grow to help their families.

Lucia is one of the members.  She has a small pastry shop where she works every day from the early hours of the morning.  She is striving to get ahead.  She hopes that over time, and through the help of everyone in her neighborhood, they can improve their environment and in this way offer better security to their families while also providing them with a better future.

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her pastry shop, such as flour, eggs, vanilla, butter, and other items.  This way, she can continue with her sales and grow her business, enabling her to provide for her family's needs so that they can have a life free from deprivation.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, vanilla, butter, and other supplies

loans.name: Las Joyas Group

texts.en:
Rosa Leticia is a 19-year-old member of the “Las Joyas” (meaning “The Jewels”) Trust Bank. She is a single woman who graduated from high school last year. She is enrolled in college for her first semester, studying to be a teacher. Rosa, along with two of her family members, have a weaving and embroidery business. They create the beautiful and colorful textiles that are so valued in Guatemala and beyond.

Because Rosa wants to expand her business, she has applied for a loan of approximately $384 with Friendship Bridge. She will use the loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to create more textiles and earn more income. With the additional funds that are generated, Rosa will be able to support her family, pay an employee and pay her tuition. She hopes to earn her degree in three years. She is quite excited about the loan!

Rosa finds the monthly meetings quite valuable. She learns from the other women in the Trust Bank who are older. She looks forward to the additional training that she will receive during this loan cycle. Subjects to be discussed include business administration (budgeting, money management, costs) as well as several topics relating to women’s health and family.

The Trust Bank, “Las Joyas” is looking forward to making progress in their lives as a result of these loans from Kiva investors. They intend to work diligently to create a better and more prosperous future for their families and community. They understand what a wonderful business opportunity this is and plan to repay a portion of the loan on time each month. They express their gratitude to Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mariatu S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school located in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 10,000,000 in order to meet their most immediate and pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Mariatu is the featured leader of this team. Mariatu is 32 years old. She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children. Mariatu has been a school teacher since 2010. In addition to her profession as a school teacher, Mariatu also sells drinks in her kiosk. She has applied for this loan in order to buy crates of drinks to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grains, animal feed, and other supplies.

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en:
Minaya is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person), and she lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She was displaced from Fuzuli.

She has dedicated 18 years of her life to agriculture. She plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant, and other vegetables and fruits. Her monthly income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. Minaya has big plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation. She is looking forward to an increase in her sales in the coming summer season, because people purchase fruit a lot in summer.

She has applied for a loan of 1900 AZN from Aqroinvest. She will use this loan to buy new fertilizers and seeds. These inputs will help her to grow more vegetables and fruits, and thereby earn more revenue in the coming summer. Thus, the loan will help her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the township of Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. This group has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 5,600,000 in order to buy or invest in projects that their salaries do not allow for. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan; it is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the deductions from their salaries for the repayments.

Abdul is the featured leader of this team. Born in 1969, Abdul is married to a housewife and the father of four children – three in primary school and one in secondary school. Abdul has been a school teacher for many years now, and he has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children and renovate his dwelling house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and renovate his dwelling house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more working materials so that he will be able to sew a larger quantity of clothes to sell

loans.name: Abdul L.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of school teachers from the township of Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT to apply for a loan of 8,900,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to solve their most immediate financial needs. They can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries at the end of each month. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Abdul is the featured leader of this group. Abdul is the 45-year-old husband of a businesswoman. The couple has four children, who are attending primary, secondary, and tertiary academic institutions. Abdul has been a school teacher for many years. However, he is currently pursuing further studies at the Port Loko Teacher’s Training College. Abdul has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees and other college charges.

loans.use: to pay his college fees and other college charges

loans.name: One Word Vi Group

texts.en:
Sorieba is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sixty-year-old Sorieba was born in Kambia, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has eight children, seven of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For more than 21 years now, Sorieba has been a tailor and he also sells wool cloths.

With the help of this loan, Sorieba and his group members will be able to buy more inventory to add to their respective businesses. Sorieba is going to use his share of the loan to buy sewing materials and cloths in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and cloth in large quantities

loans.name: Good Sababu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you the members of the "Good Sababu" group for the second time. This group of entrepreneurs is applying for a second SMT/Kiva lenders loan. With the help of their previous Kiva lenders loan, these small-scale entrepreneurs expanded  their business inventories. This increased their level of sales and profit-to-sales-margins. 

Featured leader Isatu, for example, was able to buy cattle and a piece of land out of the profit she made from her business. Today, her greatest challenge is to earn enough to build a house for her family. Isatu is currently working hard to realize her dream: providing her children with the best education she can provide. She has reapplied for this new loan in order to expand the size of her inventory. She will buy more palm oil, gari (cassava grits), honey, dishes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, gari (cassava grits), honey, dishes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano se encuentra en el Ciclo 12 del programa cuenta con 13 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo muy responsable, solidario, se ayudan entre sí , agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por las capacitaciones que reciben, ya que es una gran oportunidad para todas ellas.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Francisca de 57 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de chipas (alimento típico paraguayo) desde hace ya varios años, trabajo con el cual puede sostener económicamente a su familia. Comenta que con los ingresos que genera ayuda a mantener la casa y cubrir los gastos que surgen. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas, para poder venderlas y de esa forma seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Group is in its twelfth loan cycle and currently has thirteen members. It is a responsible group, caring, and they help each other. They are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the training they receive, as it is a great opportunity for all of them.

One of the stories that stands out is that of Francisca. She is 57 years old and she has been selling chipas, a typical Paraguayan food, (corn bread made with cheese) for a number of years, working so she can provide financially for her family. She says that the income she earns helps maintain the household and cover the expenses that come along. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of chipas, in order to be able to sell them and thus to continue earning income for her family.

loans.use: to buy chips to sell

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
El comité  Nueva Vida, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Maria;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el 4to ciclo, con trece (13) integrantes, queda 50 km de Curuguaty, en la localidad de Ybypyta II,  comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajaran y se ayudaran para salir adelante. Ellas son de una zona aun rural y que esta en crecimiento, con grandes riesgos y pocos medios de comunicación.
Maria cría animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás, los vende o faena, y por medio de ese trabajo intenta salir adelante y crecer para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que pese a muchas dificultades está saliendo adelante y demuestra que con esfuerzo se puede salir adelante.
La sra. solicita de este crédito para la compra animales para la cría, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria started the Nueva Vida community bank which is currently in its 4th loan cycle.  It has 13 members who live about 50 kilometers from Curuguaty in the town of Ybypyta II.  The women in the group all work and help each other to get ahead.  They are in a rural area with many risks and few means of communication.

Maria raises small animals such as chickens, pigs, goats, and others and sells them.  She intends to move forward and grow to give her family what they need with this work.  She is a person who makes sacrifices.  In spite of many difficulties, she is getting ahead and showing that with effort it is possible to succeed.

She is requesting this loan to purchase animals to raise, which will help her realize her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Brillantes 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of Las Estrellas Brillantes (Shining Stars) Group 1, 2, 3, and 4, which consists of 20 micro-entrepreneurs from Samana. Samana is a tourist city located in the northeastern part of the country.

Rosa is the mother of two children. She lives with them and her long-term partner. She sells groceries at her food market, which is called a "colmado" in the Dominican Republic.  There she sells daily meals to her neighbors. She started her business almost seven years ago with her own savings. Now she is requesting her sixth loan. The loans have been improving her business. She will use this loan to buy flour, cooking oil, butter, rice, beans, sugar, and other goods.

Rosa wants to save her profits to reinvest into her business and build a house with a better structure than the one she currently has. 

Rosa and her group thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, chicken, flour, sugar, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Ybyrapyta Group

texts.es:
El comité  Emprendedoras Ybyrapyta, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Norma;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el 5to ciclo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde (6) seis  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy escasos, pero lo cual no les motiva más a seguir trabajando.
Norma vende tapetes, se considera a sí misma como una persona que lucha y trabaja, siempre se esfuerza por innovar y traer mejores productos para poder crecer. Ella se esfuerza por mejorar su vida y la de su familia, ya que por medio de eso no tendrán que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
La Sra. solicita de este crédito para la compra de tapetes, con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas, tener mejores ingresos e invertir en su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Norma started the Emprendedoras Ybyrapyta community bank, which is currently in its 5th loan cycle.  They are responding to the poverty elimination survey.  Six members are below the poverty line, which means that they have very low income, but this motivates them to continue working.

Norma sells rugs.  She considers herself to be a person who fights and works hard.  She always makes an effort to innovate and have better products so that she can grow.  She makes an effort to improve her life and that of her family since her work means that they do not need to experience any hardship.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rugs, which she will use to continue with her sales so that she will have a better income and be able to invest in her small business.

loans.use: to purchase rugs to sell.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Fortaleza es un grupo que se acaba de formar, las integrantes ven una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de comité de mujeres, quieren capacitarse y mejorar, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fidelina, presidenta  del grupo, quien por medio de la venta de comidas tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia. Este es su principal fuente de ingresos, se levanta todos los días a preparar sus comidas desde muy tempranas horas. Cuenta además que ya tiene muy buena clientela y que quiere seguir creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, huevo, harina y demás, que son  sus principales ingredientes y los que necesita más. Agradece por esta oportunidad que no desaprovecharan ella y sus compañeras.
texts.en:
La Fortaleza is a group that has just formed. The members are getting together as a great opportunity to progress in the program of committee of women. They want to train and improve, not only financially, but also as people.

One of the members is Fidelina, president of the group, who by selling food has the means to provide for her family. This is her main source of income. She gets up at an early hour every morning in order to prepare the food. She already has good customers and she wants to continue growing.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, seasonings, eggs, flour and more, as these are the principal ingredients that she needs the most. She is grateful for this opportunity that she and her companions will not miss out on.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, seasonings, eggs, flour, and more.

loans.name: Asiga

texts.en:
Asiga is a 40-year-old, married woman, who has seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants, to earn a living. She has been doing this work for many years.

Asiga has requested a loan to buy tools and inputs for cultivating taro, including fertilizer, a bush knife, boots, gloves, and a mist blower. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Asiga hopes to save for her family's future daily needs.

loans.use: to buy tools and inputs for cultivating taro, including fertilizer, a bush knife, boots, gloves, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Tenari

texts.en: Tenari is a 48-year-old, married woman, who has four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants, to earn a living. She has been doing this work for many years. Tenari has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, bush knives, gloves, a wheel barrow and a mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tenari hopes to save for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bush knives, gloves, a wheel barrow and a mist blower, for growing taro

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres forman este grupo, como su nombre lo dice son "Mujeres Unidas" que trabajan juntas y decidieron ayudarse, hoy ya estan en el ciclo 6 del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas estan haciendo la encuentra de eliminación de pobreza, con el que pueden saber la situación de cada una de ellas. 2 de estas mujeres estan en el nivel rojo, con ingresos muy bajos, pero ellas igual se esfuerzan mucho por ir mejorando.
Porfiria es un ejemplo de lucha, es una persona muy sacrificada, empieza su día desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene que poner todo en orden en su pequeña, pero bien surtida despensa. Cuenta que su familia siempre la apoya y que estan con ella en todo lo que necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar verduras, frutas, productos a granel, lácteos y demás, ya que quiere surtir su despensa con todo tipo de productos. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que ellas estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas committee is made up of 15 women who work together and decided to help each other.  Today they are in their 6th cycle with the committee of women program.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey so that they can know the situation of each member.  Two of the women are in the red level, with low income, but they make an equal effort to improve themselves.

Porfiria is an example of that effort since she is a person who makes sacrifices.  She starts her day very early in the morning since she has to organize her small but well stocked store.  She says that her family always supports her and that they are everything that she needs.

She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, fruits, grains, dairy products, and other items since she needs to stock her store with all types of products.  She is grateful for this new opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, grains, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: Gataiala

texts.en: Gataiala is a 45-year-old, married woman, who has seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants and banana trees, to earn a living. She has been doing this work for four years. Gataiala has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, shovels, a wheel barrow, a mist blower, gloves and bush knives. She has been a member of SPBD for three years. With her profits, Gataiala hopes to save more money and to grow her business bigger.

loans.use: to buy tools and inputs for cultivating taro and bananas, including fertilizer, shovels, a wheel barrow, a mist blower, gloves and bush knives.

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en: Faafili is 65 years old and has six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas and yams. She has been doing this work for many years. Faafili has requested a loan to buy a mist blower, bush knives, planting tools, chemicals and fertilizers. She has been a member of SPBD for three years. With her profits, Faafili plans to reinvest into her business, and also to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy tools and inputs for farming, including a mist blower, bush knives, planting tools, chemicals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Televise

texts.en: Televise is a 32-year-old, married woman, who has five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, taamu and yams. She has been doing this work for four years. Televise has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, gloves, shovels, and a mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD for two years. With her profits, Televise hopes to improve her business and grow it bigger.

loans.use: to buy tools and inputs for farming, including fertilizer, a wheel barrow, gloves, shovels, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en:
Meet the current members of Munafa Group, from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan. Their loan amount is SLL 800,000 for each (SLL 2,400,000 in total). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions.

Bor Feremusu is the featured leader of this group. The 25-year-old is married to a motorcycle taxi driver, and together they have two children. The children are attending primary school. Bor Feremusu sells clothes and other merchandise, like shoes and cosmetics. She has requested this loan in order to buy inventory, in bulk, to add to her stock, including clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy inventory, in bulk, to add to her stock, including clothes, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Les  9 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le gombo  avec  AMINATA, 3 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 25.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The nine members of the  DJIGUIGNOUMA III group are married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Aminata, grows okra. In the photo, she is in the sitting row, third from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Bougoula market.

She is expecting to make a profit of 25,000 CFA francs at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Las Manzanas Group

texts.en:
Ten very sympathetic and cheerful women belong to the "Las Manzanas" (the apples) group. They are located in a small neighborhood called Panimá, which is in Totonicapan, Guatemala. They describe their community as: "Totonicapán, land of apples, pines, and beautiful women." Totonicapán is one of the leading producers of popular Guatemalan crafts, which are in high demand because of their variety and quality. 

Las Manzanas is in its sixth loan cycle. Some of its members have stayed with the group and others are relatively new. 

An enthusiastic member of the group is Mrs. Santos. Her name is derived from the fact that she was born on Holy Thursday, a holy week in Guatemala. She is 62 years old and has nine children, three girls and six boys. Her business involves dying yarn. She purchases raw yarn, makes a variety of dyes. and produces finished yarn in different colors and in large quantities. She started her business 24 years ago when she learned it from her husband’s family. She has now taught her children the technique. 

Santos will use the loan to buy raw materials in bulk because the price is favorable. She has a good demand for her products. One of her main customers wants to have orders delivered every 15 to 20 days. This request is for a customer 3½ hours away from Santos's home. The demand makes Santos very happy because there are currently three people working for her business but if she has higher demand it might be a possible to employ more people. 

Santos is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for providing her with the opportunity to improve her business.  The loans are not only helping the women because the profit that they make will also benefit their children.  

Las Manzanas is grateful to Kiva investors for the loans they are giving. Thanks to these microloans they can move forward. They are aware that the economic situation in the country and around the world is difficult and are thankful that people trust them and are allowing them to boost rural development.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. Toafa has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, shovels, a wheelbarrow, chainsaw, gloves and mist blower.

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Toafa will spend her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, a wheelbarrow, chainsaw, gloves and mist blower.

loans.name: Simalua

texts.en: Simalua is a 57-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Simalua has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, shovels, mist blower, bush knives, gloves and fertilizer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Simalua hopes to save in her account for her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovels, a mist blower, bush knives, gloves and fertilizer.

loans.name: Djiguiyagnouma Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIYAGNOUMA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  MINATA ,5 personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the DJIGUIYAGNOUMA IV group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

The featured borrower, Minata, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, fifth from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Bougoula market.

She is expecting to make a profit of 100,000 CFA francs at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Logologo

texts.en:
Logologo is a 38-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

Logologo has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, gloves, shovels, a wheelbarrow and chainsaw. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Logologo hopes to save for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, gloves, shovels, a wheelbarrow and chainsaw.

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tuna has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, shovels, gloves and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Tuna hopes to save for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, shovels, gloves and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número  1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están trabajando juntas y tienen como meta poder crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza,  para conocer la situación económica de cada una.
La Sra. Graciela es una de las integrantes, ella es macatera (vendedora ambulante) y con su crédito que solicita desea comprar ropas de temporada para su posterior venta. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias.
Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben, ya que podrán invertir en sus labores y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
"United Women" is in its first cycle of the program of the women's committee. They are working together and have as a goal to be able to grow not only economically, but also as people. The are doing the survey of elimination of poverty, to get to know the economic situation of every member. 

Graciela is one of the members. She is a street vendor, and with the loan that she is requesting she wishes to purchase seasonal clothing to sell afterward. She hopes that as time passes, through the help of all the people in the area, they will be able to continue improving their surroundings and in that way offer better security for their families. 

They are thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving, since they will be able to invest in their work and continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Djiguignouma V Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le arachide  avec   OROKIA ,1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000 CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the DJIGUIGNOUMA V group are married women who, on average, are 50 years old and have six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

The featured borrower, Orokia, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the sitting row, first from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Bougoula market.

She is expecting to make a profit of 100,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Feseetai

texts.en:
Feseetai is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Feseetai has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, gloves, chainsaw and bush knives. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Feseetai hopes to save for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, gloves, a chainsaw and bush knives.

loans.name: Mohamed S.'s Group

texts.en:
Meet with this group of primary school teachers from the village of Fadugu, near Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of able and dedicated staff have come to Kiva field partner SMT to apply for a loan of 4,500,000 SLL for the entire team in order to solve their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. This is the second loan that this group of teachers has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Previous Kiva loan made a huge impact these borrowers.

Nancy is the current featured leader of the group. A native of Fadugu, the 53-year-old woman is married to a farmer and they have 4 children, 2 of whom are attending primary school and 2 in of whom are secondary. Nancy has been a school teacher for 32 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mohamed S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They’ve come to SMT, Kiva’s local field partner, to apply for a loan of 7,000,000 SLL in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Musa is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Musa is a native of Madina village. He is married to a farmer and the couple has 4 children – 3 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Musa has been a school teacher for 12 years now. He has requested this loan in order to invest in business. This will help him earn more income to add to his current monthly salary. He will use it to buy local produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy local produce to sell.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les  3 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA VI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec FATOUMATA , 3 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The three members of the DJIGUIGNOUMA VI group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

The featured borrower, Fatoumata, grows millet. In the photo, she is standing third from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Bougoula market.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les  5 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA VII  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  riz  avec  DJENEBA BREHIMA  , première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the DJIGUIGNOUMA VII group are married women who, on average, are 50 years old and have six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

The featured borrower, Djeneba Brehima, grows rice. In the photo, she is standing first from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Bougoula market.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Noupagagnon 1 Group

La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec  Assetou debout au milieu.

La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

The featured borrower, Assetou, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and at the Sikasso market, to a customer base which consists of men and women. 

She is expecting to make a profit of 100,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.
