loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна работает и живет в Мелитополе. Она - торговец на рынке, где она реализует трикотажные изделия. Татьяна разведена, у нее двое детей. 
Татьяна планирует закупить сезонный трикотаж (трусы и майки) и чулочно-носочные изделия под реализацию летом. Для этого ей необходима сумма в 15 000 гривен. Вложив полученные средства в бизнес, Татьяна надеется получить дополнительный доход и вложить прибыль в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tatiana works and lives in Melitopol. She trades goods in the market where she sells knitwear. Tatiana is divorced and has two children. 

She plans to buy seasonal clothing (shorts and t-shirts) and hosiery for the summer. To do this she will need 15000 Hryvnia. After investing the funds in her business, Tatiana hopes to generate additional revenue and invest the profits to further business development.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing (shorts and t-shirts) and hosiery.

loans.name: Flor De Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, “Flor de Esperanza” or “Flowers of Hope,” consists of 11 members who are applying for a new loan from Kiva, administered by Friendship Bridge. During the previous loan cycle, the women successfully made their monthly payments on time. In addition, they participated during their monthly training sessions and learned about women’s health, children’s rights and business administration. The trainings were taught by the staff of Friendship Bridge.

Previously, we reported about Gladys, one of the hardworking women who supports herself, her two daughters and her sick father. Gladys had a convenience store and connected well with her customers with her great personality and cheerful demeanor. With her previous loan, Gladys was also able to purchase pigs to fatten up and sell. Recently, she got a one-year job as a cleaning lady from an organization in her community. Because of this, she closed her store but continues to sell food and snacks called “refacciones” in the front yard of her home to local residents every weekend. At the current time, Gladys has requested an additional loan, which she will use to purchase additional ingredients to make snacks. She also plans to buy a bull to fatten up and sell.

Gladys is the secretary of the Board of Directors of the Trust Bank. She is hopeful that Kiva investors will decide to show their confidence in the group by providing the funds for a new loan cycle. She knows that the women in her group will act responsibly by making their monthly payments on time as they did in the previous loan cycle. She states, "On behalf of the group, I thank the many people around the world who have placed their trust in each of us. We appreciate the trust that they have in us and their thoughtfulness in saving some money to invest in our businesses. We know that we face a better and more prosperous future because of this. God bless them.”

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make snacks and to buy a bull.

loans.name: Josue Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank “Josue” is located in the outskirts of Quetzaltenango, Guatemala, in an agricultural area called Llanos del Pinal. The group was formed approximately two years ago and consists of 10 ladies, three of whom are new to the group. These hardworking women are engaged in various businesses including the manufacture and sale of traditional clothing, or the sale of embroidery thread used for the beautiful and traditional textiles of the region. Others are the owners of storefronts or involved with animal husbandry.

Ana is one of the new members of the Trust Bank. She is the 35-year-old mother of five children. She proudly tells us that four of them are in school. Since Ana became widowed two years ago, she has the sole responsibility of providing the basic needs to her children who range in age from 7 to 17.

Ana raises animals and currently has two dozen chickens and three pigs. She is able to generate an income for her family but wishes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to buy more chickens and four more pigs. With the loan, she will be able to purchase feed for fattening up the animals, which she will sell in the nearest market, 20 minutes from her community.

Ana says that this loan means a lot to her since it is the first time she has been able to secure a loan. She has learned a lot about effective business practices including how to budget and manage working capital so that she can make a profit and grow her business. She appreciates the encouragement and support of the other women in her Trust Bank.

In her own words, “I dream of a better future and I understand that it will not come along by itself. We need to work hard to make our dreams come true. I dreamed of having a business but I did not have enough capital. Now that I have a loan, I can work hard, earn an income, keep my children in school and have a better future.”

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Here is Fatu, a small-scale businesswoman in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Fatu sells palm oil, salt, tomatoes, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 20 years now. With a loan of 2,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones), she will buy palm oil, salt, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.  

Fatu is a native of Kabala town. She is married to a clerk, and the couple has three children who are attending tertiary institutions.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, salt, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Greetings are coming to you from the borrower Sarah. Sarah is very pleased to inform Kiva lenders that her business has been successful ever since she started receiving loans from Kiva lenders. Having finished repaying her last Kiva loan of 3,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) successfully, she is again requesting a new one of SLL 5,000,000 to further improve her business. Sarah will buy a wider variety of medicines and in a larger quantity to add to her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy a number of medicines to add to her business.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Here is Alima, a small-scale businesswoman in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Alima sells drinks, fried meat, and other cooked/fried foodstuffs. Alima has been a businesswoman for 14 years now. With a loan of 5,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leones leones), Alima will be able to expand her business. She will use it to buy cooking ingredients in a large quantity. This will enable her stop buying such items on a retail basis.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in a large quantity.

loans.name: Kindi

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from Kindi, an SMT/Kiva borrower who has just finished repaying her last Kiva loan successfully. Kindi is very pleased to inform you that the previous Kiva loan she received has been very helpful in boosting her business. Kindi used that loan to buy additional spare parts to include into her shop. This made her shop very attractive to buyers, boosted sales and increased the profit margin.

Having finished repaying that 3,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leones leones) loan, Kindi is requesting for a new one of 5,000,000 SLL. This will further help Kindi to add more spare parts into her current stock.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like sprockets, outer tires, inner tubes, parking lights, brake shoes, etc., in a large quantity to add into her business.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
In Nepal, large supermarkets are rare. Instead, most items can be found in the small, densely packed 'pasals' that line the streets of every city and village. Piled high with utensils, paper goods, and anything else one could need, these stores are your one-stop shop in Nepal. Although usually packed into a space no larger than 100 square feet, these stores carry a sizeable and diverse inventory. 

With the help of a Kiva loan, pasal owners are able to keep their inventory up and their customers happy. Competition is fierce, but with extra capital and a bit of creativity, the opportunity for profit is there. 

Babita is 35 years old. She is married and has one child, who is six years old. In 2002, she established her kitchen utensil store business. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used them to increase the inventory of her store. 

In the future, Babita plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for her business

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en:
Nitu is 31 years-old. She is married and has one child, aged 9. In 2006, she set up her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy food for her business.  

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu, or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a 'chiya pasal', these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be bought for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. 

In the future, Nitu plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buys ingredients for her tea shop business

Naminata and Sanata were not present when the photo was taken, which is the reason why they are not pictured with the group.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's Group is comprised of two hardworking women. Sarah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business which is selling fresh fish. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fishing net and baskets to be used in fishing as well as will help Sarah to generate greater profits and take care of her children. Sarah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to become a powerful  business woman in town. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and baskets to be used in fishing.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jesca has been working hard to manage her small market business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Jesca has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such as raw bananas for selling, and will help Jesca to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Jesca hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve on her family's standards of living. 

Jesca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such as raw bananas for selling.

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila is 23 years-old. She is married and has one child, aged 3. In 2010, she set up her goat raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

Lila has asked for her first loan to buys baby goats for her business.

loans.use: to buy baby goats

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha's Group is comprised of five hardworking women. Martha is 15 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past year, Martha has been working hard to manage her small business which sells soft drinks, sodas and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Martha has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as sodas and snacks to resell as well as will help Martha to generate greater profits and have a better life. Martha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand into a retail shop. 

Martha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as sodas and snacks to resell.

The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale as well as will help Angella to generate greater profits and improve her family standards of living. Angella hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build rental houses.

The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale as well as will help Aisha to generate greater profits and buy an umbrella for shelter where she sells her clothes. Aisha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to live a better life. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and bread. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as sugar, bread and cooking oil to sell, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Lydia hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her family's standards of living.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair their autorickshaw to provide better transportation services

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Shamim has been working hard to manage her clinic which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs such as Panadol and other treatments needed for the clinic as well as will help Shamim to generate greater profits and acquire more profits so as to invest in other businesses. Shamim hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a bigger clinic. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drugs such as Panadol and other treatments needed for the clinic.

texts.en:
Agnes is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells plastic shoes. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for selling, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Agnes hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

The loan will be used to buy more clothes for selling, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Florence hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes for resale

loans.name: Aituava

texts.en:
Aituava is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Aituava has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, shovels, gloves and a chainsaw. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Aituava hopes to save for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, shovels, gloves and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Danaya I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DANAYA I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Thyla, un des villages de la commune de Kaladougou,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame.. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, GNA  première personne à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Kaladougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the DANAYA I group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Thyla, one of the villages of the Kaladougou commune in the Dioïla Cercle, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their farming activities at the start of the rainy season. Among other crops, they grow groundnuts, millet, okra and sesame.  They are on their sixth loan with the institution. 

In the photo, Gna, the featured borrower, is the first person from the right in the sitting row.  She plans to use this new loan to cover the cost of plowing and to buy agricultural inputs and small tools to maintain 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land on which she grows millet and groundnuts.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in the town of Kaladougou to a customer base which consists of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of about 60,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and plowing and to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and small tools.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past one year, Winfred has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Winfred has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for selling, and will help Winfred to generate greater profits and take good care of herself. Winfred hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Winfred is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Hafisa

texts.en:
Hafisa is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past one year, Hafisa has been working hard to manage her clothes store, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Hafisa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for selling, and will help Hafisa to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Hafisa hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her clothes business into a wholesale shop. 

Hafisa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Aisha is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and bread. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as bread and cooking oil for the store to sell, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and improve her family's stardands of living. Aisha hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a powerful businesswoman in town. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as bread and cooking oil for the store to sell.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's group is made up of six hard working women. Betty is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks, sodas and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks, such as soda, and snacks to sell. This will help Betty to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful business woman in town. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and snacks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy parlor items for her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's group is made up of two hard working women. Jane is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Jane has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks, sodas and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Jane has asked for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy snacks and more drinks such as sodas to sell in her shop. This will help Jane to make bigger profits, and buy another fridge for the business. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children up to university. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and snacks to sell

loans.name: Noupagagnon 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Tiewarala, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali :. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  Kadia debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 115 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of NOUPAGAGNON 5 Group are married women averaging 40 years of age and four children. They all live in polygamous families in Tiewarala, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming business during the rainy season. They are seeking their fifth loan from the MFI, and the previous ones were repaid without problems.

Kadia is the woman standing in the center in the photograph. Her crop is peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 115'000 (ca US$ 230) per farming cycle, which will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Danaya Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DANAYA II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Thyla, un des villages de la Dioïla,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, BAYE  deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The five members of DANAYA II Group are married women who average 40 years of age and four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Thyla, one of the villages in Dioïla, Dioïla Prefecture, in Koulikouro Region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. Their crops include, among others, peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. The group is seeking its sixth loan from the MFI.  

In the photograph, Baye is the second one from the left in the sitting row. She intends to buy farm inputs and small equipments, and pay for plowing to maintain about 1.5 hectare of millet and peanuts.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Dioïla, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) per farming cycle.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and small equipments, and pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Elizabeth is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her fast food business. To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more irish (potatoes) and cooking oil for the business, and will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more irish (potatoes) and cooking oil for the business

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Resty has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feeds and chicken for the business, and will help Resty to generate greater profits and improve her business. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to save her money for future use. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feeds and chicken for the business

loans.name: Saj Group

texts.en:
Saj is a group composed of three Lebanese women living in a village in Mount Lebanon. They live close to each other and have strong friendship bonds. Their difficult living conditions made them join hands and form the group in order to acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua. Maha is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 40-year-old married mother of two children, standing in the center of the picture. Her husband owns a small business where he makes and sells pastry, and she works there in order to help him with the baking and to maximize the profit. However, because they live in a small village, their revenue is limited to the number of customers. They earn barely enough to provide for their children, especially since they are both enrolled in private schools, which means that the schooling fees are somewhat of a burden. She decided to acquire a loan in order to purchase ingredients and machines that would facilitate the baking process.

Ines is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, standing on the left in the picture. She owns a hairdressing salon in the village. Her husband owns a pick-up and earns his living my fulfilling requests. Both her children are enrolled in a private school, which means that she has to settle the schooling tuition on top of all her other expenses, while the family's total revenue is relatively low. She decided to acquire a loan because she needs to purchase a hair kit for her salon.

Nahida is a 55-year-old married mother of one child. Her husband owns a bakery, and she is employed there. She decided to join the group and acquire a loan in order to enhance the bakery and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and machines to facilitate the baking process

loans.name: Zahraa Group

texts.en:
Zahraa is a group composed of three Lebanese women who have been friends for a while now. They decided to join hands and form the Zahraa group in order to acquire a YOUTH group loan from Al Majmoua. Falak is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 23-year-old married mother of two children, standing at the left in the picture. She works as a concierge in the building where she and her family live. Her husband works at a small bakery. Their combined revenue is below the average line for a healthy life for a family of four. Their socioeconomic situation, combined with her very low education level, makes it impossible for them to be able to think about their ambitions. The group loan from Al Majmoua might be her last hope to get some financial support. In fact, she needs the loan to purchase a closet, as a well as a TV and a TV set.

Nisrine is a 24-year-old married mother of two children, standing in the center of the picture. She and her husband both work at a printing house. She takes care of the final covering finish work, while he takes care of the printing process. She decided to acquire a loan in order to buy furniture for her living room.

Zeina is a 25-year-old married mother of two children, standing on the right in the picture. She works as a hairdresser in her own hairdressing salon. Her husband works at a printing house. She needs the loan in order to purchase a work kit that ranges from shampoo to creams to hairdryers.

loans.use: to purchase a closet, a TV and a TV set

loans.name: Al Jawad Group

texts.en:
Al Jawad is a group composed of three Lebanese women. They decided to form the Al Jawad group in order to support each other financially by acquiring a group loan from Al Majmoua. 

Najwa is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 35-year-old married mother of seven children, standing on the left in the picture. She owns a small business where she sells lingerie, perfume, and creams. Her husband is a retired military officer, and their combined revenue is not even enough to provide for three people, let alone for the four others. Her family is in an extremely dire situation, and Al Majmoua is most probably her last escape out of misery and poverty. In fact, she needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to purchase merchandise to enhance and expand her business, which might raise her revenue, and would allow her to provide a better life for her seven children.

Nisrine is a 36-year-old divorced mother of one child, who is still living under her protection and care. She owns a small international call center shop. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to expand and enhance her business by purchasing merchandise for her business, as well as installing perfuming machines in the shop.

Norma is a 25 year-old single lady. She owns a small hairdresing salon where she is in charge of the hairdressing section. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to purchase creams and shampoos for her saloon.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Farid is a Palestinian 44-year-old married father of four children. He lives with his family in a Palestinian camp in the South of Lebanon. He owns a small business where he is in charge of the maintenance of house electrical ware. His wife is unemployed, which makes him the only financial resource of his large family. All his children are enrolled in private schools under the care of the UN so they will have broader opportunities than their parents. The highest education Farid ever had was elementary school, which means that his chances of obtaining better positions are very low. Even his actual revenue is not sufficient to provide for the six people that are living under his roof. His house is in very bad shape for healthy living, which is why he decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan. In fact, he needs this loan to do cement work in his house and paint the walls. As for the future, Farid wishes to expand his business in order to raise his revenue.

loans.use: to do cement work in his house and paint the walls

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah's group is comprised of two hard working women. Faridah is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her small market business selling raw bananas. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more raw food such as matooke, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Faridah hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a powerful businesswoman in town. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase more raw food such as matooke, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes,

loans.name: Talaitupu

texts.en: Talaitupu is a 24-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Talaitupu has requested a loan to buy plants, a wheel barrow, shovels, fertilizer, a chainsaw, gloves and mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD for many years. Talaitupu will spend her profits to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plants, a wheelbarrow, shovels, fertilizer, a chainsaw, gloves and a mist blower.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 68 years old and married with seven children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling German buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, sugar and a new oven. In the future, Maria hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, sugar and a new oven.

loans.name: Mafi

texts.en: Mafi is 27 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling Elei Materials in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy fabric materials, paints, brushes, a design board, threads, needles and a new sewing machine. In the future, Mafi hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials, paints, brushes, a design board, threads, needles and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Irene has been working hard to manage her brick business, which does brick laying. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy firewood and also to pay her workers, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful businesswoman in town. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to pay her workers

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is divorced, and has one 14-year-old daughter. Irina sells clothing at the central market in Melitopol town. She has more than 10 years of experience, with many repeat clients that bring her a steady income. During the summer season, Irina opens another location to sell her inventories. It is located close to a local resort that has many tourists in summer. Irina is asking for a loan of 5,000 hryvnas to purchase additional summer clothing such as bathing suits, towels, blankets and hats for her summer business.

loans.use: to purchase additional summer stock

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past three years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her clothing store. To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and support her family in basic needs. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful  businesswoman in town. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is married, with two adult daughters. Galina's family has lived in their house for many years without fixing it. The house is old and needs renovations. Galina is asking for a loan to fix the floors, walls and windows of her house. To start with, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions. The new windows will not just look nice, but will help to save energy in winter.

loans.use: to fix the floors, walls and windows of her house

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en: With the remaining five members, the Sinar Rejeki group continues its loan. They are requesting an additional loan of 7.5m IDR, with each member receiving 1.5m IDR. Dewa Ayu will use the loan to buy three superior quality piglets. Besides having a sow, she will fatten these three piglets. She hopes that she will get a satisfactory result so that she can be independent and continue the business with her own capital.

loans.use: To buy three superior quality piglets

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working in furniture painting for six years. A year and a half ago, he started his own business in order to increase his family's income and improve their living. Ahmad's wife works as a tutor from their house in order to help with their family's increasing expenses. Ahmad is also responsible for his sister's needs, which is why he works harder to make sure that his income can fulfill everyone's needs.

He is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business capital with special paints, and other necessary needs. He will also use part of the loan to pay for his sister's wedding expenses. He is very happy for his sister and hopes that she finds happiness in her new start. 

Ahmad hopes to open a new business where he sells special furniture paints, which will increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase special paints and pay for his sister's wedding expenses

loans.name: Flavia's Group

texts.en:
Flavia's group is comprised of four hard working women. Flavia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her piggery farm. To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more piglets for the farm to sell, and will help Flavia to generate greater profits. Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for the farm to sell

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Union está en su Sexto Ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Susana , quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, con ingresos muy bajos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. El trabajo que ella hace es la venta de productos de limpieza, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  producto de limpieza, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Union" is in its sixth loan cycle through the women's program.  All the members work and help each other get ahead.  According to the Poverty Elimination survey they are taking, three members are currently below the poverty line.

One of the members is Susana who registered a level one poverty level on the survey, because of her low income.  Through her efforts, continuous work and the application of a successful woman's vital behavior traits, she is improving her economic situation.  She sells cleaning products and is requesting a loan to buy more products to help stabilize her business plan in an effort to increase her income.

It is important to point out the work of the counselors who are continually following up on the training and encouragement of the woman as they struggle to overcome poverty.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Perpetuo Socorro está en su quinto ciclo, ellas se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  10 mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y trabajan por luchar y crecer.
Albina es una persona muy sacrificada, que lucha y se ha esforzado por crecer u mejorar su vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo y también a la venta de comestibles, y ya que siempre está bien surtida es que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. Comenta que su meta es poder tener un gran puesto de ventas y así seguir obteniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Albina solicita  este crédito para la compra de Frutas y verduras, también la compra de materias primas para su negocio de Venta de Comidas cada tanto; lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Perpetuo Socorro" is in its fifth loan cycle and all the members help each other to get ahead.  The poverty elimination survey they are participating in shows that ten of the women are below the poverty line and working to improve their situation.

Albina is a very self-sacrificing person who struggles to grow and improve her lifestyle.  She sells all kinds of fruit and other foods, and has many good customers because of her wide variety.  She says her goal is to have a large food stall one day so she can earn more to help her family.

Albina is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, as well as supplies for her food business.  This will help her stabilize her business and improve her income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Fadwa is a 41-year-old married woman from Kufr Kalil, a small village near Nablus. She is a mother of seven sons and five daughters. Her husband drives a taxi. This is a profitable business but still not enough for their big family.
Fadwa has requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Fadwa's husband to pay the costs of the license and the insurance policy for his taxi. By taking this loan it will allow Fadwa to help with the urgent expenses of the family.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the license and insurance policy for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a young, single Palestinian, who is 22 years old. For the past year Ali has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him. Ali is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the costs of having allowance and policy insurance on the taxi he drives. Ali is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the allowance and policy insurance for his taxi.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 59-year-old married father of five children. He owns a small convenience shop in his neighborhood. His wife is currently unemployed, while two of his children help him out in the store. All his children live under his roof, which means he has to provide for seven people including himself. His three other children are enrolled at private high schools and universities. The low revenue of the family combined with the tuition fees and other family expenses are a great burden for the family to live a healthy life. This is why Hassan decided to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua for the fifth time in a row. In fact, he needs the loan in order to settle the upcoming tuition fees of the schools and universities where his children are enrolled. As for the future, Hassan hopes to find job opportunities for his children.

loans.use: to settle the upcoming tuition fees of the schools and universities where his children are enrolled.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha is a 30-year-old mother with two sons. Her husband is an employee who earns a decent salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs. Rasha has been operating a beauty salon, which has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover the cost of living. Because of this Rasha is requesting USD loan from FATEN to help her to cover the cost of expanding her salon by buying more equipment and beauty products. She needs this to make the salon more profitable and improve their living conditions. Rasha is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the costs of expanding her salon.

loans.name: Bahjat

texts.en: Bahjat is 28 year-old single man. For the past three years Bahjat has had a very successful barber shop. It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover his living costs. Bahjat is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing the needed furniture and new decorations for his barber shop. This will improve Bahjat’s income positively and provide better living conditions for Bahjat. Bahjat is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the costs of purchasing the needed furniture and new decorations for his barber shop.

loans.name: Zeid

texts.en: Zeid is a 34-year-old married man and a father of 3 sons and 1 daughter. All of his children are under 18 years old and are students in school. Zeid is a military officer who lives in Jenin in a small house with a decent level of income that doesn’t cover the needed expenses. So Zeid is requesting a USD loan from FATEN in order to have an insurance policy on his car. This will help Zeid and his family to be safe under any unexpected conditions. Zeid is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the insurance expenses for his car.

loans.name: Wafaa'

texts.en: Wafaa' is 45 years old, and a married woman with 3 children. Her husband transforms rickshaws in Dier-El balah in Gaza city. The decent income of her husband only covers the expenses of the family, not of completing the house. So Waffa’ is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to install doors and windows to make their house ready to use. Waffa’ is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing her new home.

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Mbarete está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, el grupo se conformó en fecha 11 de abril del 2011, mediante  la Sra. Mirian quien había formado parte de un grupo. Hoy ellas se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Mirian tiene una peluquería, y cuenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela, ofrece siempre un buen servicio a sus clientes y gracias a eso está creciendo. Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere invertir en mejorar su negocio y crecer, para que también pueda dar trabajo a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y demás insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Mbarete" is in its fourth loan cycle through the women's program.  It was established on April 11, 2011 through Mirian who used to belong to another group.  Now all the members are working together harmoniously to help each other get ahead.

Mirian runs a beauty salon and has many good customers.  She always provides good service thanks to which business continues to grow.  She is a very hard worker who wants to invest in her business so she can expand and offer employment to other people.  The loan she is requesting is to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair color, creams and other supplies needed to continue offering a good service.  She is grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, conditioner, hair color, creams and other products.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñepytyvo está en su ciclo número   2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 integrantes van a estar recibiendo sus capacitaciones de Autoestima en la Mujer, Nutrición y Cuidados de la Salud, Presupuesto entre otros con lo que podrán superar aquellos indicadores en los que no están muy bien.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Myrian, quien hace Artesanías en barro que ella suele exponer en casi todas las ferias que organiza la Fundación Paraguaya, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Myrian Solicita  este crédito para la mandar construir su propio horno  lo que le ayudará a aumentar la producción y a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que podrá independizarse de esa forma.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ñepytyvo" is in its second loan cycle of the women's program, where all the members work and help each other get ahead.  They are taking a poverty elimination survey and four of the members are receiving training in Women's Self-esteem, Nutrition, Health Care and Budgeting, among other categories, to help them improve in areas where they are not doing very well.

One of the members, Myrian, makes clay crafts that she usually exhibits at the fairs organized by the Fundación Paraguaya.  She is requesting a loan to buy her own kiln so she can increase production and improve her income.  She is grateful for this opportunity because it will help her become independent.

Worth mentioning is the work carried out by the counselors who conduct permanent follow-up of the training and encouragement given to the women in an effort to help them out of poverty.

loans.use: To build a kiln to bake clay crafts.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a Palestinian single young man who is 25 years old. His father, Tareq, is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Tareq is a university student, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Tareq to do his homework and reports, and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Tareq and improve his living conditions. Tareq is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mirvat is 39 years old and married with one son. Her son is a student who is studying at a university. She and her family live in a humble house in Dir-El Balah. 

Mirvat is requesting a loan from FATEN in order to pay to finish building their house. This loan will help Mirvat to purchase the needed construction materials to make the house ready to live in. 

Mirvat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

loans.use: to purchase the needed construction materials to make a house ready to live in.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 26-year-old married man from Deir El-Balah. He lives in a small, old house with his wife. Fadi is a worker who earns low wages. This income is barely enough to cover the family's needs. 

Fadi would like to complete his new home by installing windows and a door. 

Fadi took a Murabaha loan from FATEN to complete his new home by buying windows and a door. Taking this loan will provide him with better living conditions and enable him to enjoy living in his house. 

Fadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy windows and a door to install in his house.

loans.name: 29 De Enero Group

texts.es:
Las 20 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas están sacrificándose por mejorar en sus emprendimientos. Isabel es una de estas mujeres, quien por medio de la venta de bebidas que hace, está saliendo adelante.
Isabel se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Cuenta que le está yendo bien en su negocio, ya que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. Los fines de semana son los días que más vende, ya que siempre hay más personas. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana tener una bodega de bebidas bien surtida.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cerveza, vinos, whiskys y demás, y con ello poder surtirse y seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes. Ellas están contentas por esta oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 20 members of this communal bank work in a variety of business activities and each woman sacrifices herself to improve her situation. 

One of the members, Isabel, sells liquor for a living.  She defines herself as a very hard-working, determined person.  She claims business is going well and she has a very good customer base.  Her highest sales volume usually occurs on the weekends when more customers come around.  Her goal is to continue growing so that one day she can have a well-stocked store.

She is requesting a loan to buy beer, wines, whisky and other beverages.  This is in an effort to have enough inventory to fill customer demand.  

All the members are grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy beer, wine, whisky, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 18º  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan y se esfuerzan por dar a sus hijos lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer en qué situación cada una se encuentra.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Reina, quien realiza confección de ropas de todo tipo y sobre pedido de sus clientes,  también se debe destacar el gran esfuerzo que ella pone, asistiendo a las capacitaciones y tratando de mejorar día a día.
La Sra. Reina  Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas e insumos para surtir su negocio, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called Kuña Guapa, is in its 18th cycle of the Women Committee program. They are all women that are head of the family and struggle to give their children what they could not have for themselves. They are taking part in a poverty elimination survey aimed at knowing their current situation. 

One of the members is Reina. She tailors all kinds of clothes that her customers order. It is important to highlight that she works hard and goes to all the training sessions in order to improve more every day.

Reina is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and other supplies to stock her business. This will help her to realize her business plan and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La Sra. Laura es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está acompañada, tiene un hijo. Ella es dueña de una despensa bien surtida, en su casa ya hace tiempo, trabaja en forma familiar con su esposo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por medio de su negocio es que están ayudándose con su pareja. Cuenta que su hijo es su principal razón de lucha, y a quien el día de mañana quieren ver convertido en una gran persona y profesional.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, frutas, verduras, productos a granel y demás insumos para poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura is from Encarnación. She lives with her partner and has a son. Laura owns a well-assorted grocery store located at her home. She has had it for some time now and works together with her husband.

Laura is a hardworking person and she and her partner make a living from this business. She says that her son is her main motivation to continue fighting and that she would like to see him as a great person, personally and professionally speaking.

She is requesting a loan to buy beverages, fruits, vegetables and some supplies in bulk in order to continue investing in her business and offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, fruits, vegetables and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 40-year-old married father of two children. 

He owns a small bakery, while his wife is a teacher in a public school. Samer first opened his business five years ago, with the help of the Al Majmoua loan, and has been a loyal and active customer since then. 

His low revenue is a burden to his family, which is why enhancing his business is a priority to him. Thus, he decided to contact Al Majmoua again in order to buy the raw materials for his business. 

This would help him increase his number of customers and expand his business. As for the future, Samer hopes to renovate his bakery.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for his business

loans.name: Alwan

texts.en:
Alwan is a 24-year-old married young adult, living with his wife on a farm in the Bekaa valley. 

He trades and sells sheep for a living, as well as sheep cheese, milk and wool. His wife is a housewife and is currently unemployed, which means that his small business is the family's only financial resource. 

He graduated from a vocational school. In order to establish a family and have children, he believes that he should expand his small business and enlarge the farm. 

Thus, he contacted Al Majmoua in order to acquire a YOUTH loan and purchase sheep, nurture them and then sell them in order to raise revenue. This might help him settle down and open up a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase sheep, nurture them and then sell them in order to raise revenue

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is a 30-year-old young adult living in a small village in Mount Lebanon. 

He is an employee in a statistics department and has been working there for five years now. He also happens to own a small studio, where he makes his own music and composes music for Lebanese artists. 

As an ambitious person, Bahaa wishes to develop his musical career and gain a good reputation. However, as a first step, he needs to enhance his current studio, which is why he decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a YOUTH loan. In fact, he would use this loan to purchase a new sound system that is up to date with the latest technology for better results. 

As for the future, Bahaa wishes to completely dedicate himself to his studio, which is why he believes that he should completely renovate it, with the help of Al Majmoua, of course.

loans.use: to purchase a new sound system that is up to date with the latest technology for better results.

loans.name: Panambi 2 Group

texts.es:
en su noveno ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres está este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas son mujeres luchadoras, que se han unido con la esperanza de poder crecer y salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Nilsia es una de las mujeres que integran este grupo, ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en el que hace todo tipo de servicios, como ser maquillajes, manicura, y arreglos en cabellos. Ella es una persona muy talentosa y que esta saliendo gracias a la habilidad que tiene. Ella quiere ir agrandando su negocio y el día de mañana poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, maquillajes y demás, con lo que podrá tener los insumos que necesita para poder seguir prestando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradecen por la oportunidad que ellas y sus amigas estan teniendo.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación is in its ninth cycle of the women's committee. These women are fighters and they have united with the hope of being able to grow and get ahead. They are participating in the survey to eliminate poverty in order to know about the situation of each one of them. .

Nilsia is one of the women who make up the group. She has a little beauty salon where she performs all kinds of services such as makeup, manicures, and hair styling. She is a very talented person who is getting ahead thanks to her abilities. She wants to enlarge her business and in the future be able to provide work for other people. 

She is asking for this loan to be abel to invest it in buying nail polish, dyes, shampoo, conditioners, makeup and more. This way, she will have the supplies she needs to keep offering a good service to her customers. They are all grateful for the opportunity they and their friends are getting.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, dyes, shampoo, conditioners, makeup and more.

loans.name: Las Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Trece ciclos llevan juntas las integrantes de este grupo, como se ve, ellas con su trabajo y su esfuerzo es que están creciendo, y por medio de la ayuda de la fundación esperan seguir creciendo y dando su mejor esfuerzo para dar a sus familias lo que necesitan. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, ella tiene una chipería en su casa, donde hace deliciosas chipas y las vende (Alimento típico paraguayo) y  el crédito que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las chipas , en su última encuesta se encontraba con buenos ingresos, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada trabajando por seguir creciendo.
 También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder progresar continuamente.
texts.en:
The members of this group have been together for thirteen cycles. As you can see, with heir hard work and efforts they have grown. With the help of the foundation, they hope to keep growing and giving their best effort to give their families what they need. They are participating in a poverty elimination survey in order to know the situation of each of them. 

One of the members is Silvia. She makes chipas (a traditional Paraguayan food) in her house. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies to make the chipas. In the last survey she had good income, but she still is enthusiastic about working in order to keep growing. 

It is also worth noting the work of the consultants, who do a permanent follow up of trainings and verifications that can be required and at the same time motivate the women to fight to be able to keep progressing.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make chipas, such as corn meal, eggs, lard, anise and more.

loans.name: Lafia I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe LAFIA I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Tinimbougou, un des villages de la commune de Dioïla,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (Culture de l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame). Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, GNA première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the LAFIA 1 group are married women, 43 years old on average, and have an average of five children.  They live mostly in polygamous families in Tinimbougou, one of the villages of the commune of Dioïla, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being able to organize their businesses better at the beginning of the winter season. They plan to grow, among other things, peanuts, millet, gombo, and sesame.  They are on their sixth loan with the institution.
With this loan, Gna, the first person from the left in the row of those standing up, plans to buy fertilizer, small equipment, and to pay labor costs for working about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 
The produce is sold in the city of Marka Coungo, to male and female customers.  She plans to earn an average monthly income of 45,000 CFA per field.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seed, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding,  and small equipment.

loans.name: Bahija

texts.en: Bahija, a 50 year-old married mother of three children, lives in a small village in the south of Lebanon with her family. She and her husband both own a grocery shop where they sell and trade all kinds of vegetables. The grocery store is their only source of financial revenue, which is why enhancing it means raising their revenues. Thus, Bahija contacted Al Majmoua because she decided to acquire a loan and purchase merchandise for her store, as well as maintain the family car. In the future, she wishes to enlarge the grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store, as well as maintain the family car.

loans.name: Elianne

texts.en:
Elianne, a 23-year-old married mother of one, has been selling fruits and vegetables for a year in order to help her husband, a soldier, in making their living. Elianne is a hard worker with a very good reputation because of the quality and prices of her products.

She is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business capital in order to open an additional branch. This new branch will definitely increase her family's income and help enhance both their social and economic well-being.

loans.use: To increase her business capital in order to open an additional business branch

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Miguel” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. La señora Mariana, una de ellas se dedica a la cría  de gallinas, con el crédito que solicita lo quiere invertir en la compra de balanceados para poder seguir alimentando a sus animales.
Ella se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por mejorar su vida y sus condiciones económicas, ya que ella vive en una zona rural muy alejada y con escaso acceso a medios de comunicación.
texts.en:
The committee "San Miguel" was formed when various neighbors in the city of Santaní got together. The members are part of a very close-knit group who often complete activities together that strengthen their teamwork. 

Ms. Mariana, one of the members, raises chicken. She would like to use the loan for which she is applying to invest in chicken feed in order to continue to feed her animals.

She defines herself as a hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who fights to improve her life and economic conditions, since she lives in a very isolated rural zone with little access to modes of communication.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Esperanza está en su ciclo número 15° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde 7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, esto se sabe, gracias a que todos están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es un medio muy útil para ayudar a estas mujeres.
María, una de las integrantes, es una persona que quiere crecer, siempre se esmera y participa de las capacitaciones, tiene su pequeño ahorro y día a día se esfuerza por ir creciendo y mejorar la vida de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que el carbón es más económico y la gente lo prefiere y tiene buena venta
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón para poder seguir con sus ventas y que no le falte su principal producto. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
This group, called ”Esperanza” [Hope], is in its 15th cycle of the Women Committee program. Seven of its members live below the poverty line, according to a poverty elimination survey they took part in. This is a very useful means to help these women.

María, one of the members, is a person who wants to grow. She is a fighter and she always comes to the training sessions. She saves some money and works hard every day to continue growing and improve her family’s life. She sells charcoal and says that she does well since it is cheaper and people prefer it, which means that there is a good demand for it.

María is requesting a loan to buy charcoal in order to continue selling it and avoid shortages. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en: Hamed, a 30-year-old married man, lives in Dir-El Balah in Gaza city in a very humble house with his wife. Hamed is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to complete their house by adding tiles so they can enjoy living more comfortably there.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing his home

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is an 18 year-old single adult who has been working as an electrician for three years to help his parents in making their living and covering their expenses. While young when he started working, Ayman at the same time was able to finish his technical school studies.

Very ambitious and well known in his region, Ayman is applying for a Youth loan from KIva's partner Al Majmoua to buy industrial machines necessary for developing his business and improving his income. He is working hard to buy his own car which will make his working procedures easier and faster; it will also help him to expand his working region.

loans.use: to buy industrial machines necessary for developing his business and improving his income

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Neri Bruna ella es soltera y tiene 53 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de joyas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the “Patrón de San Jerónimo” communal bank which is located in San Jerónimo District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Neri Bruna, 53, is single and has two children.  She works in a grocery store where she sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She works from 6am until 10pm and has been in business for 8 years.  In her free time she likes going out with her children.  Her dream is to expand the grocery store.  She’s requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil. By this means she thanks those who share her dream and commits to make her payments as scheduled.  The other members sell jewelry, clothes, groceries and beauty products. The borrowers that are pasted into the group photo could not come to the loan meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.name: Arcoiris 2 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ARCOIRIS 2 Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Joselin  tiene 21 años, se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.
