Joselin va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Joselin va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Joselin es una persona joven y muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Arcoiris 2 Communal Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men.  The president of the bank is Joselin, 21.  She makes a living selling cosmetics via catalogue.  She sells her products on foot, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of Santa Cruz.

This loan Joselin's first sequence with the institution.  She's going to use the loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale that are on sale.  This way she'll be able to offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her profits.  She's requesting this loan to continue improving in her business.  Joselin's going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of beauty products.

Joselin's a very hardworking young person.  She's happy about this opportunity being offered her and her group members because in some cases they support their families alone.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, es un hombre emprendedor que comenzó desde muy joven a trabajar. El tiene un negocio de venta y fabricación de escobas. Este negocio lo comenzó desde hace 15 años atrás y ahora es una de sus fuentes de ingreso para mantener a su familia.   

El hace las escobas desde las 08h00 hasta las 18:00. También tiene un trabajo que lo realiza en turnos rotativos. Las escobas que el vende las hace desde y las vende a una fabrica que se encarga de venderlas. El tiene una discapacidad en sus piernas que no le permite caminar bien, pero esto no le dificulta trabajar ya que el es el sustento de su hogar. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que las escobas la hace artesanal. Por eso quiere el préstamo para poder incrementar su producción comprando palos de madera y serdas para escobas.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  He is an enterprising man who started working when he was very young.  He has a business of making and selling brooms.  He started this business 15 years ago, and now it is one of his sources of income to support his family.

He makes the brooms from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  He also has another job that he does on rotating shifts.  He sells the brooms that he makes to factories who sell them.  He has a disability with his legs that does not allow him to walk well.  However, he says that this does not make working difficult for him as he is the support of his household.

He has a lot of aspirations with his business because he handcrafts the brooms.  Therefore, he wants the loan to be able to increase his production.  He will buy wooden sticks and bristles for brooms.

loans.use: to buy wooden sticks and bristles for brooms.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha de 49 años de edad, es comerciante desde hace algunos años. Después de separarse de su esposo, esta mujer debió ingeniarse la forma de generar recursos para sostener a sus tres hijos y brindarles educación. Razón por la que empezó a vender ropa a sus a sus familiares y amigos como actividad económica. En la actualidad gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logró crear su propio almacén, lo que le ha permitido aumentar las ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local. Sueña con brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de ingresar a la educación superior y graduarse como grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old; she has been a businesswoman for some years. After separating from her husband, she had to come up with a way of generating resources to support her three children and give them an education. 

It was for this reason that she began selling clothing to her relatives and friends as an economic activity. Currently, thanks to her efforts and dedication, she succeeded in starting her own store, which has allowed her to increase her sales and improve the quality of life in her home. 

Now, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of supplies, with the goal of continuing to grow within the local market. She dreams of giving her children the opportunity to enter into higher education and graduate as professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothes store

loans.name: Fathiyeh

texts.en:
Fathiyeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Fathiyeh is a 45-year-old married mother of four from Al Nosirat, near Deir el Balah city. She and her husband are public sector workers whose salaries do not cover all of the family needs. Fathiyeh has requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help the family complete their new home by installing tiles.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing their new home by installing tiles.

loans.name: Cabildo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cabildo está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité ellas están empezando a trabajar juntas y tienen la esperanza de que por medio del comité crezcan y mejoren sus emprendimientos. Son muy sacrificadas y quieren seguir creciendo.
Un ejemplo a seguir es la Sra. Patricia, quien humildemente se dedica al reciclado de productos como ser cartones, plásticos, aluminio y otros artículos, también los compra y vende al por mayor y de esa forma tiene mayor ganancia. Cuenta que está orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y no tiene que hacer nada deshonroso para ayudar a su familia. Su ejemplo es su mayor enseñanza.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de plásticos, aluminio, cartón y demás, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Cabildo Group is in its first cycle of the committee program. These women are starting to work together, and they hope that they will be able to grow and improve their businesses by means of this committee. They are selfless women who wish to continue growing.

Patricia is an example that should be followed. She makes a humble living recycling products such as cardboard, plastic, aluminum, and other materials. She also buys and sells these materials wholesale to earn a better profit. She says that she is proud of what she does, because it is a decent job and she does not have to do anything dishonorable to help her family. Her example is her greatest lesson.

She is applying for this loan to buy plastic, aluminum, cardboard, and other items so that she can continue growing. She is very grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy plastic, aluminum, cardboard, and other materials to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa con su esposo, poco a poco les ofrecieron ropa a sus vecinos, amigos, conocidos. Fue asi que fueron abriendo clientela para asi ahora tener una cartera de clientes. 

Trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 12:00 y de 14:00 hasta las 22:00 tienen dos horarios debido al almuerzo. En la actualidad su esposo no la ayuda tanto como cuando comenzaron porque el se dedica a la profesión de taxista para tener asi mas ingreso para el hogar. Ella tiene una discapacidad en sus manos por eso en ocasiones se le hace un poco difícil trabajar al 100%.

Ella tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio por eso quiere comprar ropa, accesorios para vender a sus clientes y asi tener mas variedad en su mercadería.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  She started her clothing business with her husband and gradually sold clothes to their neighbors, friends and acquaintances.  This is how they started to acquire customers and now have regular ones.  She works from 8am until noon and from 2pm until 10pm.  They have a split schedule due to lunch.  Her husband isn’t helping her as much now as when they started because he’s working as a taxi driver to earn more household income.

She is disabled (a handicap of her hands) which causes her to sometimes not be able to work at 100%.  She has many hopes for her business which is why she wants to buy clothes and accessories to sell to her customers and have more variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en:
Oussama is a 28-year-old single man who has been tailoring and selling curtains since 2008. At the beginning Oussama had a few problems because he didn't have enough experience in this field, but today he is very skilled. A hard worker with a very good reputation, he puts much effort into developing his business based upon customer need.

Oussama is requesting a Youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with special released summer designs and necessary accessories. He is planning to expand his business and increase his number of employees to meet growing customer demand.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special summer designs and necessary accessories.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Acción está en su ciclo 21º con la Fundación Paraguaya dentro del programa de comité de mujeres. Es un grupo que como se observa es muy trabajador, es por eso que ya están en un ciclo muy alto. Ellas quieren seguir creciendo y capacitándose, es por eso que están esforzándose.
Gladis es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una persona muy hábil que desde joven ha trabajo y ha luchado por mejorar su vida. Por medio de la costura tiene los ingresos que su familia necesita para poder crecer. Cuenta que ya tiene una clientela fiel que siempre le lleva trabajo, pues es conocida por ser buena en lo que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, para poder seguir utilizando en su taller de costura y cumplir con  los pedidos que sus clientes le hacen. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y su familia están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres en Acción" ("Women in Action") group is in its 21st cycle of the women's committee program with Fundación Paraguaya. This is a very hardworking group, as shown by the fact that they are in a very high cycle. They want to continue growing and training, which is why they are working very hard.

Gladis is one of the members of this group. She is a very capable woman who has worked and struggled to improve her life from a young age. Through her sewing, she earns the income that her family needs to be able to grow. She says that she already has a fixed clientele who always bring in work for her, since she is known for being good at what she does.

She is applying for this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other items to use in her sewing workshop to fulfill her clients' orders. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her family are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 21-year-old single man from Deir el Balah. He owns some stores and gets rent from them every month.

 Mahmoud and his brother are university students. They would like to buy laptops for their studies. So Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Mahmoud to buy two laptops for himself and his brother. This will help them in their studies.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two laptops for himself and his brother

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem is a 36-year-old married man from Tulkarm city. He is a father with three sons and one daughter. Naeem is a worker in Israel with a low and not stable wage. Naeem's wife works in her home sewing clothes to help her husband with part of the family expenses.

Naeem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Naeem to buy a new sewing machine for his wife. This will raise the quality of the clothes she produces.

Naeem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Sufian

texts.en:
Sufian is a 56-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin. He is a father with seven sons and one daughter. Sufian is an employee in the public sector and he gets a low income.

Sufian took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve the family's living conditions by buying new furniture. Taking this loan will offer Sufian comfortable furniture so he can enjoy living in his house.

Sufian appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for the family home

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en:
This is the seventh loan for the Tegal Sari group. They still need the loan because most of them need the training and education from the vet or FO. They want to be successful pig breeders. 

Now they have nine members, but one couldn’t attend the meeting because of being sick. They each receive the same loan amount. Beside using the loan for purchasing piglets, they also use the loan to fixing the cages.

Ni Ketut is happy to receive her loan and use it to purchase two superior piglets and quality feed. Still with the fattening programs, she hopes this time she will earn more profit. All the profit is used for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets and quality feed

loans.name: Leokadia

texts.en:
Leokadia  is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (her late brother's daughter). She has a business of selling fresh cassava and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of cassava. She doesn't have any other income generating activity. She works at the market and works on a retail basis only six days out of every week. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she can sell on wholesale only and also start growing cassava. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.
 
 Note- She is not a teacher but they do sit in classrooms for their weekly group meetings.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his son appears in his Kiva profile photo.

Akram is a 68-year-old married man with five sons and three daughters. He lives in a humble old house in Deir El-Gsoon, a small village near Tulkarem. Akram works as an employee with a low wage that barely covers the family needs. 

Akram took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Akram to pay the cost of completing the family's new home. With this loan, the living conditions for the family will be better.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing the family's new home

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a resident of Nakasagazi zone, Sembabule. He is 38 years old with four children, all in primary schools. He is a farmer dealing in cattle rearing and applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to plant 3,000 trees of coffee to expand his income. However, he meets some challenges like changes in prices. His target is to be able to meet all his family demands like tuition, since his children will be soon joining higher institutions of learning. He is a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and hire laborers to plant 3,000 trees of coffee.

loans.name: Level One Group

texts.en:
John, who is in his early 30s, is single with one child who is still small. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years now.  He works from 8.30 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be John's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock of fruits and vegetables. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell. He dreams of having an individual loan and leaving the group loan.

John will share this loan with his loan group Level One which has nine members (one lady has been cut in half by the photograph). The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flying Eagles Youth Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of Flying Eagles Youth Group which is located in Butula on the outskirts of Kyotera town. He is a single father with six children and he is 40 years old. He lives in a village in Rakai district with his children; five of his children still attend different schools around the area.

He is a businessman and a farmer too. His main business is bark-cloth selling and he has been in this business since 1997. He is also a farmer who deals in coffee growing.

He works six days a week and each day he works for 7 hours. He started this business in order to earn money for paying school fees for his children and to satisfy their day-to-day needs.

He has acquired this loan in order to buy more stock (to re-stock) of the bark clothes. He sells his products to traders in the city. His dreams are to build rentals in a nearby trading centre which can be of more help to his children and to educate the children to the highest level of education. His main challenge is changes in fuel prices which makes transport to the city very costly and this forces him to sell his products from his home at low prices.

He describes himself as an honest and hard working man.

loans.use: To buy bark-cloth

loans.name: Kombo Group

texts.en:
Furaha, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has three children who go to school.  

She has been running two businesses. She has a grocery and she sell spare parts for motorcycles. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Furaha's 17th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the grocery inventory by buying more crates of beers, sodas and water. She also increased the stock of the spare parts for the motorcycles. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

She is really a happy woman. Her children can now go to better schools and her family is enjoying the loan. She used the profit to pay for school fees, household expenses and to build her house. 

She will use this loan to buy more spare parts for motorcycles. Her dream is to one day be able to build another house.

Furaha will share this loan with her loan group, "Kombo," with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Msisiri Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her mid-30s, is married and has two children. One child goes to school and another child is still small.  

She has been a food vendor since 1999. She works from 4:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items. She has paid all her loans back successfully.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and to cover household expenses. 

She will use this loan to increase the food stock by buying more rice, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, salt, and Irish potatoes. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group, "MSISIRI," with nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the food stock by buying more rice, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, salt and Irish potatoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khanga Group

texts.en:
Veronika, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children. One of the kids goes to school and the other one is still young. She has been a food vendor since 2008. She works from 6.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Veronika's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to increase her food stock. She dreams of owning a hotel. 

Veronika will share this loan with her loan group Khanga, which has thirteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Triunfadoras fue constituido para poder cada una crecer en sus labores, ellas inician sus actividades desde muy tempranas horas, realizan sus compras en el Mercado y se abastecen así.
Maria, una de las miembros, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de insumos de primera necesidad, como ser harina, azúcar, aceite y demás, ella lucha por dar a su familia todo lo que necesita. Y que de esa forma no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de aceite, azúcar,  harina y demás, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad y las capacitaciones que están recibiendo, que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 'Las Triunfadoras' committee was created so that every one of its members could grow in their work.  The ladies start work very early in the morning, making their purchases and stocking up at the market.  

Maria, one of the members of this group, says that her business is selling basic household products such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.  She works hard to provide her family with everything they need so that they don't have to suffer the same hardships she did.

Maria is requesting this loan to invest in buying oil, sugar, flour and other products.  This will allow her to continue making her sales as she has been doing up to now.  She is grateful for the opportunity and for the training that they are receiving as it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene su taxi con el cual trabaja todos los días y se esfuerza por tener los ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del día a día. Cuenta que gracias a su crédito anterior de Kiva pudo reparar su vehículo el cual es su fuente principal de ingresos.
El esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la reparación de su taxi, ya que necesita de un mantenimiento para poder seguir funcionando. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sergio is a hardworking and enterprising person. He owns a taxi in which he works every day and struggles to make the income he needs to cover his day-to-day expenses. He says that thanks to the previous loan from Kiva he could repair his vehicle, which is his main source of income.

Sergio is requesting a new loan to repair his taxi, since it needs maintenance in order to continue to work. He is grateful for this new opportunity, which will be of great help for him.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Malak Group

texts.en:
Nouhad is the featured borrower of Malak's group. She and the other group members applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Nouhad is a 34-year-old married mother of four children. She works in mouneh, the business of preserving food from one season to another. She sells the food upon request. She is the woman on the right. 

Nouhad is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy seasonal food products to preserve and sell upon request in the coming autumn and winter seasons.

Lina also works in the mouneh business. She is a 42-year-old married mother of four children. Her loan will be invested in business development and increasing production. She is the one standing in the middle.

Salam is a 37-year-old married mother of four children. She works as a tutor in order to help her husband in their family's living. Her  loan will be invested in covering necessary family needs.

loans.use: to by seasonal food to preserve and sell later.

loans.name: Giri Puteri Group

texts.en:
Perancak village is quite far away from the city, so the pig business is in great demand in this village. Ni Made, who is a housewife with one child, also developed pig farming at her home.

With the group loan amounting to 2M IDR per person, Ni Made plans to buy four piglets for fattening at a price of 400,000 IDR per piglet, to renovate the cages, and to meet the feed requirements for the next six months. Ni Made expects a profit of 400,000 IDR per month.

Ni Made plans to use the profits for the purposes of the family and to set aside to add to her capital. This needs to be done because her husband's income as a farmer is not enough to meet the needs of her family. Because her son had to go to school this year, Ni Made needs to further improve the results of fattening pigs.

Ni Made also hopes MUK can help in terms of counseling her group about how best to raise pigs.

loans.use: to buy four piglets for fattening and renovate the cages.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Abena is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Abena will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells provisions in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a carpenter, and together they have four children. Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Abigail decided to set up her own vegetables business in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). With over three years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more vegetables for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a clergy member) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tia Rosa Group

texts.es:
Tia Rosa se llama este grupo que está empezando a trabajar, ellas quieren aprender nuevas actividades y  también invertir en las que ya tienen. Quieren ayudar a sus hijos y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien y ayuden a los demás.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia, quien está consciente de que por medio del trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo podrá lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dará un mejor bienestar a su familia. Ella es peluquera, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Delia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales para ampliar su negocio, ya que quiere ofrecer una mayor comodidad a sus clientes lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
'Tia Rosa' is the name of this group that is just starting to work together.  The members want to learn new business activities as well as invest in the ones they already have.  They want to help their children so that they can become upstanding citizens and help other people in turn.

One of the members of this group is Delia.  She is aware that, through her work and efforts, she is capable of achieving total success and improving her family's well-being.  Delia is a hairdresser.  She would like to give a shout out to the loan officers for their work, permanently monitoring training sessions and making necessary checks whilst, at the same time, encouraging the women to work hard so that they can work their way out of poverty.

Delia is requesting this loan to buy materials with which to extend her business [premises].  She would like to offer her customers more comfort and this loan will help her to realize her business plan.  It will also help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to extend her hairdressing salon

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek and the group members of Pangkung Lip-lip Indah continued borrowing to increase the number of pigs and their quality. They are joined in groups to make it easier to coordinate and receive training and loans.

Ni Kadek is using the loan to buy three piglets for fattening. She’s very happy to always be assisted in terms of capital for her business. She is hoping to get the maximum results in order to save money and have her own capital to continue her pigs-raising business. 

When the disbursement came, two members could not attend because they needed to attend a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to buy three piglets.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children. She has received some schooling, till the end of junior high school. Currently, Sarah sells second-hand clothes in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about two years now. Her husband is a carpenter. Sarah’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Sarah will use the loan to increase her existing second-hand clothing inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Sarah plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing second-hand clothing inventory.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cassava and eggplant in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for a number of years. Esi is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cassava and eggplant. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of cassava and eggplant.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married with six children. Her husband is a security officer. For the past four years, Ekua has sold vegetables in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. She received some schooling through primary school. Ekua's income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Ekua is requesting a loan to buy additional vegetables. With the profits from her loan, she plans to develop business and venture into new markets.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she sells second-hand clothing in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coasat. Abena's business has grown substantially since she began six years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. Abena has identified growing customer demand for her clothing, but is unable to meet this demand due to her limited inventory capacity. 

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase more second-hand clothing to sell. With the profits from her loan, she wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her children will be given the opportunity to further distance themselves from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Yaa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling bread in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Yaa is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards supporting herself and her extended family. 

Yaa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bread. In the long term, Yaa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of bread.

loans.name: I Made

texts.en:
I Made, 42 years old, pursues a pig farming business with his wife. This effort has been done since they were married. I Made has two children. The first child is in high school and the second in the elementary school.

I Made has one sow and eight piglets that he will keep for fattening. Aside from being a pig farmer, I Made also works as a truck driver, transporting coconut. 

To increase the number of pigs, I Made needs financial support. But he is plagued with waste generated by the pigs in large quantities. Therefore, he joined the biogas program from MUK. In addition to the loan, he will learn to build a biogas reactor to minimize waste from pig manure and provide organic fertilizer that will be very useful for soil fertility in his garden. 

I Made will get a 15M IDR loa. He will use 5M IDR to build the reactor and 10M IDR to buy superior quality piglets and feed and to make new cages. He hopes the plan will be successful so that he gets maximum results.

loans.use: To build a biogas reactor, purchase piglets and feed, and make new cages.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Ama is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell more fish. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest her future profits into her business, thus helping her expand to meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell more fish.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling doughnuts and meat pies in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for a year. Esi is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Esi will use the loan to buy more ingredients to make doughnuts and meat pies, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make doughnuts and meat pies, thus helping her to improve her sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling “Wakye” (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She usually sells her Wakye in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling Wakye for 20 years. Esi is married and has six children. Her husband works as a contractor. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to buy more rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. This will permit her to sell more of her tasty Wakye. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest the profits in her business, thus helping her to expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans, thus increasing her inventory levels so she can sell more of her tasty "Wakye" (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves).

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is married with three children and her husband is a petty trader. For the past seven years, she has been selling plantains, cassavas, and yams in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. Yaa has been educated through junior high school.  She is responsible for supporting her husband to pay her family's utility bills and school fees. 

Yaa is requesting a loan to purchase more produce to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her loan to expand her plantains, cassavas, and yams business and increase her capital base. In the long run, Yaa wants to expand into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, cassavas, and yams

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past four years, she has sold cooking ingredients at Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. Elisabeth's earnings are generally used to help her husband support their children. 

Elisabeth is requesting a loan to purchase additional amounts of cooking ingredients to allow her to sell more due to her increased inventory. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to market her business better and increase her working capital. Elisabeth hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Abena decided to set up her own bakery business in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). With over eight years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to purchase more bread for resale. 

She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for resale.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is a small-scale vegetable merchant in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Fati has been working as a vegetable merchant for close to six years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a vegetable stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Evelyn did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Evelyn sells corn and fish in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a miner, and together they have five children. Evelyn uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Evelyn will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of corn and fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Evelyn wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of corn and fish.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
San Juan se formo en la ciudad de San Ignacio, se encuentra en el 16º ciclo, hace ya bastante tiempo vienen trabajando juntas, todas cuentan con su actividad comercial en distintos rubros, este grupo con el tiempo ha sido solido, y cuentan con valores como la solidaridad y el compañerismo.
Fatima es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien tiene una despensa en su casa con los productos para poder abastecer a su barrio, cuenta que inicio con muy poco, pero que después gracias a su esfuerzo, y a que tiene buenos clientes esta creciendo. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora. Su meta es poder ir mejorando su salón de la despensa y tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, frutas, verduras y demás insumos para poder surtir su despensa. Espera que por medio de este crédito pueda dar a sus clientes los productos frescos a los que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The 'San Juan' group was founded in the city of San Ignacio.  Its members are currently starting their 16th loan cycle.  They have been working together for quite some time and each member has her own business activity.  This group has remained solid over the years and the members demonstrate a lot of solidarity and friendship among themselves.

Fatima is one of the members of this group.  She has a convenience store in her home where she supplies people in her neighborhood with different products.  She says that she started out with very little but, thanks to her efforts and the fact that she has good customers, her business is growing.  Fatima is a very hard-working and, above all, entrepreneurial person.  Her goal is to continue improving her store and to have more products to offer her customers.

Fatima is requesting this loan to invest in buying drinks, soda, fruit, vegetables and other products with which to stock her store.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to provide her customers with the fresh produce they are used to.

loans.use: to buy drinks, soda, fruit, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase superior quality piglets and feed.

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his late 20s, is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school while the other one is still too young. He has been selling second-hand clothes since 2011. He works from 10:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Salum's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to open another place for selling the same product and to increase  the stock in the first shop. He is really happy with the loan and appreciates the lenders who send the money and help them manage to live a comfortable life. He used the profit to pay for school fees and household expenses. He will use this loan to increase the second-hand clothes stock and sell to more clients.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group, "Masasi," with 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase the second-hand clothes stock and sell to more clients.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Due to her difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells rice and soap in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a farmer. Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Efua will use the loan to buy more rice and ingredients to make her local soap, which will help her to improve her sales. Efua wants to use the future profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and ingredients to make her local soap, which will help her in improve her sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling “Banku” (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her Banku in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling Banku for three years. Esi is married and has six children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to buy more cassava and maize, thus increasing her inventory levels. This will allow her to sell more of her tasty Banku. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest the profits in her business, thus helping her to expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and maize, thus increasing her inventory levels, which will permit her to sell more of her tasty "Banku" (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough).

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells “Kooko” (fermented maize porridge) in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Esi has identified growing demand for her product among consumers. She is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. She aims to use her loan to buy more ingredients to make Kooko to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make Kooko (fermented maize porridge) to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with four children. Her husband works as a susu collector. Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur who prepares and sells "banku," a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste. She has operated her business for the past five years, and usually sells her banku in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. The proceeds from her business go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and school fees. 

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize to increase her inventory levels. She hopes to sell greater quantities of her tasty banku. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest her profits back into her business to expand and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and maize
